story:
Hello! Thank you for coming to this page to find out more about the humanitarian photography trip I'm setting out on this summer! 


My name is Jamie Netherland, and I'm a graphic designer and photographer living in the gorgeous city of San Diego. I'm currently working toward opening my own photography and creative media business, Narrative Visual. My vision for Narrative is to have a for-profit photography studio that sets aside a percentage of all profits earned to fund a ministry of free photography services for non-profit organizations engaged in communities around the world. The hope is that with my images, these organizations will be able to build more awareness and support through sharing the stories of the lives involved in and impacted by the work they are devoted to in various communities. With increased support they will be able to grow and flourish, and to ultimately touch even more lives. Who would not want to be a part of such good work? I can't think of a better way to invest my time and resources.

Watch the video above or read below to hear more about my story and to find out how you can walk with me in my endeavor to offer free professional photography for non-profits.


----------------------

To see a preview of my work, visit: www.narrativevisual.com

The full website launch will be coming late summer, after I've returned! You can also scroll to the bottom of this page to view past photos taken in Kenya.

Video footage and imagery at the bottom of this page are from a trip taken to Nakuru, Kenya in 2012 for the purpose of working on site improvements at an orphanage. Photography was not the focus of the trip, although I was fortunate to have come home with some imagery to help tell my story now.


Beginnings

After several years of struggling with identity and purpose, fears and doubts, I find myself where I have always belonged, although I was long afraid to embrace it: the arts. If we were to sit down together, you with a coffee and me with a tea, or if we were to walk one cool morning through the foothills of San Diego, I would tell you about my journey in detail. But for now I will give you the essentials: in a season of suffering I asked God the infamous question: WHY. I didn't understand, I felt knocked down, as if I were drifting along in existence. I needed to know that God's involvement in my life was intimate, that he did in fact see me and care about even the most intricate details of my life. I wrestled him for answers. No, he didn't tell me why—but he answered the question that really mattered: he responded by saying "I am with you." I knew this before but I did not know this really. I am with you, he said, and I am not just observing you with compassion but I am beside you in every moment, feeling with you every heartache, every sigh of relief, every rising joy.

This is good news, this Emmanuel, God with us. It changes everything. 

So, from this place of rest in God's presence I began to ask a new question, the one outlined in the video above: Who am I? Because if he created me and he knows my every intricacy, then He must have had some intention in who he made me to be. As the dreams I had made and made again for myself continually shattered, I asked God for his purpose with my life. If I am here, please use me, I told him. Show me who you have made me to be, show me the gifts you have given me and how You want me to use them. I did not want a drifting existence any longer. I wanted substance and abundance. I wanted the deeper and truer life he held out to me instead of the small dreams I had held tightly on to. So I began to listen to Him speak the calling over me that I had been too afraid to step into before due to subconscious fears of failure.


So what now?

Now I desire to use the gifts, skills, and passions I've been given at their highest potential. I love (love!) the arts. Photography has been my medium of choice since I was about 11 years old. I've heard it said that the thing you should be doing is the thing you have the most fear over, and I believe this to be true. In the last year and a half those fears have been revealed to me, and I have made the choice to step past them and to stop hiding the gifts I've been given. When I realized that it was time to invest in my photography, I knew I didn't want to invest trivially. I wanted to use it purposefully and with intention. As I thought and prayed through how to do so my passion for people and cultures was brought to mind. I feel alive and connected to what is true and good in this life when I am engaged with people and places, especially when they are very different from my own. I am thrilled by the exploration of new landscapes, and I find it fascinating to learn about others—their customs and traditions, the way they do life, what they've experienced, what is significant to them, and who they are. Through conversation as well as with my camera I do my best to remain open and curious in these new environments, and I find that doing so is a blessing both to me and (it seems!) to others. It was a process but it eventually became clear to me that my gift for photography could be combined with my passion for people and cultures and used in a very purposeful way by coming alongside non-profit organizations in need of meaningful imagery to share their story through.


How you can help

This June and July, I will be photographing for up to 5 different non-profits located in Kenya and Uganda. The hours of preparation are finally coming to an end and nearly everything is in place to be set into motion. It's happening and I couldn't be more thrilled!

In the future I hope to fund these trips through the profits I make as a photographer stateside, but this first trip—which is both a step of faith as well as a learning experience—is happening before those profits have come in. 

This is where I hope to receive financial support (in exchange for perks, of course! see a few examples below) from any who want to join me on this endeavor. My total trip budget is $6,000, as outlined below. On this page there are different levels of support  that you can pledge towards the trip, as well as the perks you will receive at each level. I hope you can find a place among them to come alongside me!

If you aren't able to give financially but still want to take part in supporting me, I highly value your prayers and words of encouragement. Please do write me a letter, stop me on the street, or shoot me a text to let me know what you think, pray for me, and/or follow me on instagram to see this story unfold. You can also help by sharing my story and this page via social media (or whatever creative ways you come up with!) to get the word out to more people. 

---------------------

Thank you for any help that you can give! I truly am grateful for it all.

-Jamie


Trip Partners (non-profs)

www.footholdinternational.org

www.oneworldfutbol.com

www.streethopekenya.org

www.sure24.org.uk

www.ssekodesigns.com


Trip Budget

Transportation (airplane, trains, buses, and cars): $3,000

Visas (2): $150

Travel insurance: $250

Food and accomodation: $2,250

Preventative medication for malaria: $150

Additional supplies: $200

TOTAL: $6,000


Perk examples

Little Fox illustration sketches                 Calendar (photo on calendar not mine)


Kenya 2012

story:
Kurz und Knapp: 

Ein paar Menschen kamen zu spät und konnten kein Exemplar von DIAMONDTIMES mehr ergattern. Denen soll nun geholfen werden. Hier nochmal kurz die Fakten:

  • DIN A 5
  • Hardcover
  • 180 Seiten, Farbe

Wie lange müsste man warten?

Gar nicht. Die Kampagne ist nach 5 Tagen vorbei und schätzungsweise 9 Tage später kann ich hier sitzen und die Dinger verschicken.

Hat das Buch nicht 15 Euro gekostet? Warum kostet es nun 20?

  • Die Auflage ist so dermaßen klein, dass es nicht anders geht. Ich werde auch so daran nix verdienen.
  • Da es über Crowdfunding gemacht wird, bekommen Indiegogo und PayPal insgesamt 8% der Summe.
  • Zusätzlich ist die Verpackung im Preis enthalten.
Wenn ihr mit Euren Vorbestellungen die 3.500 Euro nicht erreicht, dann geht das Geld sofort an Euch zurück und es wird nicht nachgedruckt. Gut für mich, da ich dann nicht tagelang Bücher packen muss, aber blöd für diejenigen, die keins mehr abbekommen haben.

Viel Liebe und Ahoi!

Ben

story:
My name is Mark Lunn; I am a nature photographer living in southern Oregon.

My wife Mary is a hospice nurse, and when she told me that many hospice patients die in beds that face blank walls, I was inspired to do something about it. So I crafted a large collage poster with nine of my favorite nature photographs from the summer of 2013. I would like to donate these vibrant 39”x26” posters to any hospice patient anywhere in the world. I need your help in reaching my goal of donating at least one collage to every hospice agency in the US by the end of 2014 - that’s nearly 6,000!

To the bedbound, or anyone, blank walls can be boring, fatiguing, and depressing. Even looking at a photograph of a beautiful butterfly can be as therapeutic as a stroll in a garden. Nature nurtures and soothes - for the young and old, healthy or sick. It is my hope that my colorful collage also provides visual stimulation, calms stress and anxiety, and evokes fond memories of connecting with the earth and nature. My photographs are windows into summertime that reveal beautiful colors and forms year round.

It is an honor and delight to bring the beauty of nature to the walls and ceilings of the bedbound. The Joy Boy Project gives hospice patients, families and caregivers a comforting window to the natural world.

For a $35 donation, you will receive a beautiful collage and I will donate one to a hospice agency of your choice in your name, or in memory of someone you love.

A donation of any size would help with printing, mailing tubes and postage. If you can't donate, you can still help. Please share The Joy Boy Project on your social media sites and with your email lists! There is a grandma or a child out there on hospice who would love a beautiful nature collage!

Thank you for your support of The Joy Boy Project!

Mark

story:
10 Million Lives Struck by Worst Typhoon in History

In a single instant, nearly 10 million lives in the Visayas region of the Philippines were devastated by typhoon Haiyan/Yolanda, the most menacing tropical storm in recorded history. Deaths are projected to reach 10,000 while millions of families struggle to survive without basics like food, water, medicine, and shelter.

Shots of Hope: A Photo Cause

In a single instant, millions of lives can also be saved with your help. The photos featured here are shots of our own family visits to some of the most amazing destinations in the Philippines. They were taken by Filipino-American photojournalist, Michael Perez whose award-winning pictures have appeared in National Geographic, Sports Illustrated, Philadelphia Inquirer, and The New York Times to name a few.

Support our family's photo cause and take home a piece of the Philippines with you with a minimum donation of $75. 100% of profits* will be donated to the Philippine Red Cross, the largest humanitarian organization in the Philippines. Thousands of  volunteer relief teams trained in disaster response continue to help the hardest hit communities like Tacloban, including assisting in search and rescue efforts.
Simply choose your donation level on the right and select a photo(s) from the gallery. After payment, e-mail shotsofhope@gmail.com to notify us of your photo choice.

*Donation amounts include printing and shipping costs. Prints shipped to U.S. and Canada only. Orders processed after the campaign deadline of December 31, 2013.

Your Impact

This typhoon has uprooted millions but it has not crushed the Filipino spirit.  Our goal of $1,000 equals over Php 44,000 (Philippine pesos)––a huge help towards rebuilding lives!  Every amount counts. With our help, the Philippine Red Cross can sustain providing relief and hope where there is so much devastation. Your contribution supports ongoing efforts such as:

  • Food, water, and shelter distributed to over 750,000 to date
  • Welfare desks that oversee restoring families and tracing services
  • Blood banks
  • Tent cities and loader ships to transport disaster affected people to safety
Follow the Philippine Red Cross on Facebook or @philredcross on Twitter to stay on top of the latest relief effort news.

Thanks so much for hearing us out and visiting this page. Please pass it on!

The Perez family

Questions? Contact shotsofhope@gmail.com

story:
In the summer of 1996, I began photographing the Green Bay Packers for Dick Schaap's book, Green Bay Replay. 

That season culminated with the Packers winning Super Bowl XXXI.

This was the first time the Pack had won the Super Bowl since my dad's team won Super Bowl II in 1968.

In 2000, 50 photographs from this project were exhibited at the Leigh-Yawkey Woodson Museum in Wausau, Wisconsin and then toured art venues throughout the state for the next three years.

2016 will be the 20th anniversary of that season and with your help, I'd like to publish a coffee-table photography book of my photographs. Dick used words to tell the story of the relationship between Lombardi's Packers and Holmgren's Packers and the fans that loved them and now my book will tell that story in pictures. 

You'll see photos of Bart Starr with Brett Favre, Willie Davis with Reggie White and you'll see Paul Hornung and Willie Wood as Honorary Co-Captains at midfield for the NFC Championship game coin toss.

And of course, you'll see shots of the fans plus much, much more.

I need your help to cover the costs of hiring a photo editor, a text editor, a book designer, drum scanning and post-processing the negatives and printing and shipping the books. 

REWARDS INCLUDE:

And check out the Inside The Locker Room magazine here: https://vimeo.com/139093198

I have no doubt that deadlines will be met and the book will become a reality. Of course all backers will be kept aware of the book production process as it happens via regular updates. I can't wait to begin production of this book!

In 2000, 50 photographs from this project were exhibited at the Leigh-Yawkey Woodson Museum in Wausau, Wisconsin and then toured art venues throughout the state for the next three years.

Green Bay Replay exhibition installation photos at the Leigh-Yawkey Woodson museum in Wausau, WI

Dick used words to tell the story of the relationship between Lombardi's Packers and Holmgren's Packers and the fans that loved them and now my book will tell that story in pictures.

I need your help to cover the costs of hiring a photo editor, a text editor, a book designer, drum scanning and post-processing the negatives and printing and shipping the books. 

Dad, me, Dick Schaap and Fuzzy Thurston at Fuzzy's bar, Shenanigan's, during the 1996-97 season.
REWARDS INCLUDE:
The two CD set chronicles Lombardi's unprecedented 1967 championship season through the eyes of Jerry Kramer and his teammates. Click on the CD cover to hear a sample track.And check out the Inside The Locker Room magazine here: https://vimeo.com/139093198

Brett Favre with Bart Starr

Willie Davis, Brett Favre, Reggie White and Bart Starr also known as, "The Foursome"

Brett Favre raises his arms after throwing a TD in the NFC Divisional Playoff game against the San Francisco 49ers.

Reggie White points to the heavens after the Packers defeated the Carolina Panthers in the NFC Championship game.

Brett Favre with Reggie White in the podium in Lambeau Field after winning the NFC Championship
I have no doubt that deadlines will be met and the book will become a reality. Of course all backers will be kept aware of the book production process as it happens via regular updates. I can't wait to begin production of this book!

story:
FB: We decided to combine our love for animals and skills in photography to create this purpose driven venture. By producing unique, crowd-powered content, featuring our Bunnies, we want to raise money to help animals which were not so lucky.


What you get: Enticing set of pictures, warm feeling and many Bunnies-updates along the way


Evolve the story with your contribution!


FB: Sometimes even the biggest bunch of the juiciest carrots won’t get things going. Real production needs real money. Your contribution is enabling us to produce exciting things, without constraining our creativity and to give back to those in need.


What we need: Cover the costs of location fees, Bunnies’ commissions, crew and accessories. And all the carrots of course.


Projected budget for production:

FB: Excellent question! There many ways how you can help our cause, beyond financial contribution:

1. Share campaign with your friends, using social media buttons bellow the pitch video or our URL http://igg.me/at/FragrantBunnies

2. Leave us a comment

3. Follow campaign to keep in touch with our updates

Q: What if I have contributed, but don’t like the execution of the story?

FB: We don’t really know how one could eventually not like our stories, but after providing us constructive feedback, we will gladly refund your contribution.

Q: How many Bunnies (pets) were injured and traumatized during your ridiculous productions?

FB: Since all of them are our own pets, they are precious for us. None of them were stressed during production. However, we chopped some carrots…

Q: You have a lot of carrots in your pictures, do Bunnies (pets) really like them?

FB: Yes, indeed. What is surprising for many people, the green tops are their favorite part and they eat them first. Not like Bugs Bunny in the cartoons.

story:
Introduction

Welcome from Andy Rouse and Aditya "Dicky" Singh. We are two tiger nutcases and professional photographers, born on different continents but now close family. We've been brought together by our love of tigers and for one amazing tigress called Noor. Here she is...

It's taken us 4 years to bring you this book, that's 4 years of very dedicated photography.

We've followed Noor through the highs and the lows of her life, the result is a stunning 160 page fine art book that needs your support to make all our efforts worthwhile. It's a lavishly illustrated book, there are no filler images here, our photography is world class and so is the book...as befits the Queen of Ranthambhore. 

Here's 5 reasons why you should support this campaign:

  1. Jaw dropping images including hunting sequences and tender moments with cubs
  2. Engaging stories that bring the pictures to life and put you right there with us
  3. A conservation focus and support for local Ranthambhore conservation projects
  4. Simply because images look better in print than on the screen
  5. Perks for Indian based supporters with local postage from Delhi. Low postage rates for Australia / NZ / USA and Canada check the Perks with flags for details. 

And  if you don't support us then we may knock on your door looking like this!!!!

I know it is a frightening thought!

Our book is packed with JAW DROPPING IMAGES like these:


 

The book has something for everyone:

For the Tiger Lover - we cover all aspects of Noor's life via a collection of stories about our most wonderful encounters with her. We've included other wildlife too, leopards, birds, deer all feature. The writing puts you right there with us at the decisive moments, it will captivate you and really bring the pictures to life. 

For the Photographer - the images will inspire you with a mixture of styles rarely seen in any wildlife book encompassing colour, monochrome and Infra-Red. With the latter we have a lovely Infra-Red portfolio showing Noor's territory in the harsh light of Summer. Plus you will get commentary throughout on what it's like being a Noor photographer AND two spreads of Photo Hints & Tips that you can use for your own photography.

Noor, Queen of Ranthambhore is designed and ready to print at the best fine art book printers in Italy, all we need is your support. Here's the cover spread:

Perks - So we've put together a range of perks for you, all giving great discounts to encourage you too support us in this campaign and get this beautiful book published. It's no risk for you either as we will supply your Perk even if we do not reach our complete funding target, so why not save some more and support a great project today!

Indian Supporters - tired of paying big postage charges for books? Well not on here, we have setup two special perks for you identified by your national flag. Books ordered through these Perks will be posted directly from Delhi. 

Here we are working in the field over the 4 years that it took to shoot this book!

The Book Project

Since we wanted to produce something quite special we have used the best in the business,  Printer Trento in Italy, to produce a book of stunning quality. The book itself is 300mm x 260mm, 160 pages packed with incredible images of Noor and her life. The cover is not the usual dust jacket, instead we have chosen a slightly vintage approach to instead have the cover printed straight onto the book. It’s a beautiful book and we know that you will love it. 

Here's Andy & designer Nick Otway checking out the final proofs of the cover in London, and you can see he is very happy!!!!

This is why, here's a few spreads from the final PDF:

Photography in Ranthambhore is tough as there are no concessions, and rightly so. We are not allowed to use camera traps (which both of us dislike anyway) and have to shoot from the road at all times. To get low angles means using the natural contours of each zone, and working with other jeeps so that they understand what we are trying to achieve. We concentrate on light and composition to tell our story, and as ever the amazing Noor is a very willing subject!

One of the areas of photography that is perhaps the toughest to get, because of the topography, are landscapes of the area. So we decided early on that most of our wide angles would involve a tiger, and that we would not include landscapes just for the sake of it. We also decided very early on to push the boundaries of our photography and use monochrome and infra-red imagery to really tell the story that we wanted to. The habitat is a harsh and unforgiving place, particularly in the extreme heat of summer (where it can be 47C and more), and we were determined to show that. The result is a mixture of photographic styles and techniques that few books have ever seen. This book is very, and unashamedly, picture led. We have a good story throughout so you know what's happening and what we felt at the time, but it's very very picture led...

Conservation Focus

There is no doubt that tigers are in trouble but we believe 100% that they will continue to survive as enough talented people are dedicated to their conservation. Whether it be at international, national or grass roots level, there are tiger champions everywhere and we have included a section in this book to show you the people who we think are making a real difference...

 

One particular local organisation that we work closely with is called Tiger Watch. They are based in Ranthambhore and work with the local people on the boundary zones of the national park, where conflicts and poaching can occur. You can see one of their in-the-field seminars in the pictures above.

There are many great charities and organisations doing great work, we have highlighted some of these in the book, but since Tiger Watch is local and works to protect tigers like Noor we are going to use some proceeds from the sales of this book to fund some of their projects. We don't make great claims about this, and it's not a fixed percentage, but when we get decent sales revenue we will see which Tiger Watch projects we can help fund and will publish the details on social media. That's why we aren't making a great claim about this, we are doing because it's the right thing!

So as photographers where do we fit in conservation? Well we have both raised funds for conservation projects in Ranthambhore, the last one was to dig a well on the outskirts of Ranthambhore to stop tigers going into villages to get water in the dry season. You didn't see it on social? No because we took some of the profits from Andy's first tiger book and used them without any fanfare. Also from that book donations were made to several other NGO's as well. 

We don't make any claims about our conservation credentials, as we are just two tiger loving photographers. But what we do is to give wild tigers great PR throughout the world with our work, and allow others much more talented than we are to deliver their conservation messages more effectively by using our powerful imagery. We are PR agents for Noor and her fellow tigers. And that is the focus behind this book, we want you to love tigers like we do, and perhaps afterwards get involved by supporting one of the organisations that we highlight.  Only by supporting these great organisations and the valuable work that they do, and getting greater public awareness, will the tiger survive. We have all got to learn to live together in this expanding world, and that desire must come from within.

Perks and Details

We have tried to offer you decent discounts on perks and also some things that money cannot buy. For the benefit of our India based supporters we have also created a couple of special Perks for you, like local postage from Delhi thus saving large courier costs. 

The Regular Edition

The beautiful regular edition of the book will be signed by both of us. Don't ask as it was a logistical nightmare but this is truly unique and will be the only time you can get both of us signing the books, right here right now!  We estimate shipping to begin in early November and will contact you before shipping to see if you'd like a personal dedication. 

India based clients please see below as we have a special perk for you!

Please see FAQ for postage details.

The Regular Edition India Edition

For our India based supporters, this is exactly the same as the Regular Edition except that it's posted from Delhi so the postage cost is a reasonable one. 

Noor Collectors Edition

The Collectors Edition of the book is a Perk for the person that wants something a little more exclusive. You will get a standard edition of the book, personally signed by both photographers, and your choice of 3 limited edition prints (or all 3!). Both sit inside a beautiful woven embossed slip case for stylish storage.

All Collectors Edition prints measure 290mm by 230mm and are printed on fine art PhotoRag Giclee paper, which has a wonderful texture and is light fast so will not fade over time. The prints have a generous white border to allow easy framing and as well as the edition number and signature bear the print title with "Andy Rouse Collectors Edition" underneath. All are personally signed & numbered by Andy Rouse and limited to 75 per edition. 

Collectors Edition Perks A, B and C allow you to choose which one of the limited edition prints you would like, whereas for Collectors Edition D you get them all!

Here is the "Beautiful Noor" print:

And here is Motherly Love:

Finally Noor's Kingdom:

Please see FAQ for postage details.

Tigers, a Celebration of Life, Collectors Edition

Andy's first Tiger book sold out both editions and he has the last few boxes left, which he is using to give a great Reward combo. It's a 96 page book packed with great images and writing, with no less than three award winning images from the major competitions. The Collectors Edition comes with a wonderful A4 limited edition print showing Machali, arguably the most famous tiger to have ever lived:

Both book and print are supplied in a stylish brown slip case as shown:

This edition is available as part of Book Package 1 or the Ranthambhore Royalty Package with our new Noor Collectors Edition.

Small Canvas - Noor Love

This is a lovely canvas measuring 305mm x 203mm that is supplied on stretchers and ready to hang. It shows a tender moment between Noor and one of her first cubs and will make a lovely gift.

 

Giclee Photorag Print - Noor's Family

A reminder of a wonderful encounter with Noor and her second brood, Noor's family is a divine open edition Giclee Photorag print:

The print is A3 in size so that it's not too big but certainly large enough to see the wonderful detail. It measures 42 cm x 22 cm and has a generous border all around. A beautiful print, if you want a larger one then just let us know.

Limited Edition Canvas - Eye of the Tiger

We are pleased to bring you a special 100cm (1m longest side) limited edition fine art Canvas,  hand printed and supplied on stretchers so it is ready to hang. With a light fast treatment and a textured appearance, canvas prints provide a wonderful medium for photography, being simple to hang and not requiring any special lighting to shine. Because of this texture we have chosen this Eye of the Tiger image from the book, which features Noor's first male cub called Sultan as an adult male. It will be limited to 50 prints only and will be supplied with a signed and dated certificate of authenticity:

And here it is in situ...

The canvas shipped in drop proof packaging worldwide and is ready to hang. Please see FAQ for postage details.

Limited Edition Canvas - The Big Fight

A special discount here for Andy's very well known The Big Fight image which won Highly Commended in the BBC Wildlife Photographer of the Year Competition:

It's a spectacular image showing Ranthambhore Royalty Machali fighting with one of her cubs over territory, a real coming of age image. Due to the texture this image looks best on canvas and we have chosen a mid size of 80cm for this special discounted edition:

 

Limited Edition Metallic Canvas - Kingdom of Noor

An incredible limited edition of 100, printed on beautiful Metallic Canvas. It's a stunning image that was taken in the last two minutes of light as Noor relaxed in a quiet waterhole...

Check this video out...

Yes it's a truly beautiful image and one with an incredible finish, Metallic Canvas is just truly amazing with such a feeling and presence. Here it is on the wall...

So we have great pleasure in including this as a 100cm Metallic Canvas in our list of Perks. It is a truly special image and one that will grace any wall.

Portfolio Review

Want your favourite 5 or 10 shots reviewed by Andy Rouse? Well this is the reward for you. Send low res shots to Andy and he will make a video review of them for you which will be sent back to your email. It could be your favourite images, or perhaps some for a project you are working on or maybe something that you are struggling with. Perhaps you need help finding your own vision and style, a direction for your photography? Need composition advice or just a re-assurance? Want to buy a special gift for a loved one or photo mad friend? Well this is the perfect reward. Andy’s portfolio reviews are very positive and inspiring, looking at composition, technique and direction. It’s like having a guru right there at your fingertips, and as we have said don’t worry, he is always very very positive and encouraging. Here is a review that Andy did of some recent Galapagos images that he took so check it out!

All portfolio reviews will be dealt with on a first come first served based once the book has been printed. The video review will be an MP4 video file, sent to you via file transfer, where  you will see your image on screen with a small window to show Andy talking about it. It’s a very cool video and will be a great help to your photography. Andy will place no time limit on this video, if he wants to spend time looking at one image then he will as he loves looking at pictures and helping photographers find their own style. 

Andy Rouse Ranthambhore Photo Seminar

We have a wonderful Perk for you with a special Andy Rouse Photography seminar for Indian photographers. It will be held at Dicky & Poonam Singh's Ranthambhore Bagh on November 30th 2018 between 2pm and 6pm and will simply be a wonderful learning experience in a fun and friendly environment.

Andy gives many seminars and workshops to aspiring nature photographers around the world to help them reach the next level with their photography. In this special seminar, Andy will give you the benefit of his extensive photographic knowledge with a range of special presentations, focussing on subjects such as shooting techniques, winning compositions and atmospheric lighting (i.e. backlight and silhouettes). He will also present his top 20 favourite images of all time and tell you the story behind them, plus analysing all the technical considerations that he used when making the shots. Finally he will look at helping you to find your own vision and style by looking at some of his most successful projects and how he undertook them. 

This will be an inspiring seminar for all levels of photographer as Andy is a very engaging and inspiring presenter. The seminar will be packed with great images and top tips, a must for all levels of photographer!

The Golden Seat Packages

For years we have taken small groups of tiger lovers to work with us in Ranthambhore with our favourite tigers. We are experts at getting in the right position at the right time, and pride ourselves that we teach our clients a lot about photography as well as about tiger life. We use our intimate knowledge of the park, and our vast experience at favourite tiger routes, to give our clients the best chance of getting great tiger images. We do this with the aid of zone free all day permits, which allow us to go where we think the action is without any restriction on time or allocated zone. It gives us the freedom to ensure that we have the best chance of getting you something different and unique, rather than the same old headshot or postcard style shot.

So we have great pleasure to include our Golden Seats in the Perks program as this is not something that we usually do. This is something that truly money cannot buy, you will work alongside the best tiger photography team on the planet. In the driving seat will be Himmat “The Boss” Singh, chosen driver for many film crews in Ranthambhore and Andy’s driver for the few past years. Next to him in the front will be Dicky, who will be controlling the positioning of the jeep. and offering photographic advice. In the back will be supreme guide Rajkumar. On some of the packages you will also get Andy too in the back, offering camera advice, composition tips and just being your ever present camera guru to ensure that you get the best pictures possible.

You can come any yourself of course for much cheaper, but you won't get anything like the images we can get for you. Of course wildlife is wildlife and it's unpredictable but we give you the best chance!

Wow now that is the dream team.

We are offering several different packages with varying length and people:

VIP All-Zone Tiger Safari- India Passport Holders only, upto 4 people - 1 full day all zone VIP pass. You will be guided by Aditya "Dicky" Singh and the team of Himmat and Rajkumar. Perfect for a one day stop in Ranthambhore to give you the best chance of getting good pictures of tigers, it covers up to 4 people in this cost so why not treat a few friends! This package does not include travel, accommodation or food and is for Indian clients only and you will have your own ideas of how to get there and where to stay. Please ignore the specified date, the day can be taken at any time and all arrangements will be handled by Poonam Singh who runs our tiger lives and will make your trip a reality. She can also handle accommodation too in the excellent Bagh. See the T&C's below.

Note that you will get one signed book for each person in the jeep, so if there are 4 of you then you will each get a book. 

Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 1 - Non Indian passport holders only, 1 person - 3 full day all zone VIP passes. You will be in the back of the jeep exclusively with Andy and Rajkumar. The middle seat will be removed, allowing low angle shooting in all situations and unparalleled access. In the front will be Aditya "Dicky" Singh and Himmat. It's an amazing opportunity to treat yourself as you will not only improve your photography a great deal with a guru sitting right next to you helping you every second BUT you are with the best team at finding and photographing tigers. See the T&C's below.

We have included full Delhi to Delhi costs including your transfers (train and car), accommodation at the Ranthambhore Bagh on a full board basis, all of your park fees and everything we can think of. Not included are your air fares from your home to Delhi, alcoholic and soft drinks, tips plus other items of a personal nature.

You will receive one personally signed Collectors Edition, which will be sent in November 2018.

Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 2- The same as Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 1 but with 2 people in the back so the middle seat will be used, perfect for a couple or two friends. It's a good deal and currently a 5 day safari with us, with you spread across two vehicles with 4 other clients is £4350. So you will get us all to yourselves and remember this is for two people!

Again all costs are included but accommodation is costed on a shared basis, single rooms are available at a supplement payable locally. See the T&C's at the bottom of this page.

You will receive two personally signed Collectors Editions, which will be sent in November 2018.

    As you can see a great collection of Perks there!

    Now here's some more information about us and the project.

    New Perks?

    If you see something here but would like a different twist or combo then just write to us and if we like it we will add it to the Perks to benefit everyone!

     

    Our Journey

    Our journey together started back in 2008 with the immortal Ranthambhore tigress Machali. Working together over a 2 month period we developed a bond and an understanding that has grown into our ‘family’ relationship today. It was Noor that really brought us together though, as over the years this incredible tigress has opened up her lives in front of us and treated us to some incredible intimate encounters. It is these encounters that form the backbone of this book and to which we invite you to share with us.

    Both of us love photographing tigers, you could say we are addicts, and we are both very good at it. It doesn’t matter to either of us who has won the most awards, we enjoy sharing our photography together and bouncing ideas off each other. That is very much the philosophy of this book; you will not know who took the individual images as it doesn’t matter, our time with Noor has always been a shared experience and that is the message that we want to bring from this book. Teamwork. Collaboration. United by a passion for photography, tigers and conservation. That is what defines us.

    So what is so special about Noor as there are many great tigress’s in Ranthambhore? It’s hard to describe really, she’s just the ultimate tigress for us, an incredibly ruthless killing machine one minute and a tender mother the next. There’s no doubt she’s a mean mamma. Really mean, sometimes scarily so. On more than one occasion her piercing stare has made both of us take our eyes back from the camera and look away. We love her all the more for this, we are drawn to her; she’s our muse, we have spent every moment we can in her territory and in return she has shared incredible moments of her life with us. 

    Noor’s territory spans Ranthambhore zones 1,2 and part of 6, all three are tough and uncompromising places to live. Winters are freezing cold whilst the summer heat is relentless and unforgiving; everywhere you look towering bluffs dominate the skyline; dark, threatening, and unwelcoming to all comers. In this tough environment Noor has flourished, raising 3 litters to maturity, with her cubs spreading out across Ranthambhore and beyond. 

    About the Team

    From the very start we wanted to create something that appealed to a wide diversity of tiger lovers worldwide, from conservationists to photographers to those that just love all things tiger. So we’ve worked very hard on this project and dedicated so much time over the past few months to getting the right images in the book that allow us to tell our story.

    Nick Otway

    From the outset we knew that we needed a great designer, someone who could take our vision and make sense of it. Andy had worked with Nick before and was impressed by his determination to produce something very different, through a willingness to bend perceived rules. As the book evolved from it’s earliest scribbles, Nick listened to our stories and really helped us build a structure that made sense. So we hope when you pick it up and read it you will see that it flows really well through our encounters with Noor, many of which have been published in the national and international press.

    Valmik Thapar

    We start with a wonderful foreword from India’s foremost tiger expert Valmik Thapar, who really sets the book into perspective. In his words:

    Aditya ‘Dicky’ Singh and Andy Rouse capture the incredible beauty of the tiger through the story of Noor who survived this last decade and epitomises the very best of Ranthambhore’s amazing tigers. I am certain that Dicky and Andy have created a book that will always be a landmark in the ever-evolving natural historyof Ranthambhore’s tigers.

     Photo Team - Andy Rouse and Aditya "Dicky" Singh

    You may or may not know much about us. Well we are both professional wildlife photographers, have both won major international awards, are both proud Dads and both share a love of all things tiger. Here's what we think of each other...

    Dicky on Andy - “I first met Andy Rouse, over a decade ago, when he came down to Ranthambhore to work on his tiger book after I had promised to get him some amazing tiger images. I had heard of Andy from before and had been following his work for a few years. I knew he was good, really good at his work. I had been living on the outskirts of Ranthambhore for over a decade and had worked with many cinematographers and photographers, though none of them was like Mr Rouse. At that time, I knew Ranthambhore better than most people in this world and I thought I knew enough about photography not to embarrass myself. The eight weeks or so that we spent together, shooting tigers in Ranthambhore in 2008, was a big milestone in my life, a time when I found a guru and a close friend. At the end of our eight weeks together, he called me a photographer. When Andy Rouse starts calling you a “photographer” you know  you have arrived. I had graduated from a “camera owner”  to an “outdoor photographer.” Finally I had moved from taking pictures, to making them. Since then we have personally grown really close to each other, more family than friends. Over the years, we have shot a lot of images together and partied a lot, something that both of us plan to keep doing. Andy is an amazing animal photographer, though slightly crazy and that is why we get along so damn well.”

    Andy on Dicky - “I first met Dicky in order to work on my first Tiger book. He had written me this email out of the blue criticising my existing tiger work and saying that he could get me far better images in Ranthambhore in exchange for some photographic tuition. It was cheeky to the point of me deleting the email, but there was also something about it that made me respond, and made me take that chance over 10 years ago. Since then I’ve become one of the family at  his home and shared so many wonderful adventures, many of which you will see in this book. I’ve watched as he has grown in stature as a photographer, he’s always had the gift of knowing tiger behaviour but I’ve expanded his horizons and shown him new ways of shooting. Many of the amazing infrared images in this book are his, certainly a case of the student becoming the master. As a conservationist you will never find anyone more passionate and willing to engage in the fiery world of social media to defend his beloved Ranthambhore. On the social side he is a larger than life character with an army of close friends who I now call my own; we’ve shared some heavy parties together too, both at Holi festival and his legendary 50th birthday week. In conclusion, Dicky is the most trustworthy, loyal and decent friend I could wish to have, and as a photographer he is simply one of the best.”

    And Finally

    ​So that is it, if you have got to the bottom here you must be keen. We hope that you can support this project and allow Noor, Queen of Ranthambhore to be a reality. 

    Important T&C's for all Perks

    1. We only use tracked postal services and we will include insurance for lost items in transit.
    2. We will endeavour to tell everyone when your Perk is dispatched and, if we can, provide tracking details so you can manage it locally. If something fails to arrive then please bear with us as they maybe a small delay in getting you a replacement shipped whilst we "negotiate" with the courier. We will always keep you informed at all times.
    3. If you have any problems or questions then please don't whinge and whine on social media, just contact us and we will sort it. We are decent and honest people.

    Important T&C's for the Golden Seats

    1. You can take your golden seats at any time between November 1st and June 15th as this is the tiger watching season.
    2. Owing to the difference in permit costs, The VIP All-Zone Tiger Safari is only open to Indian passport holders. Please do not apply for this if you do not have an Indian passport as we will not be able to fulfil your Perk.
    3. We will need at least 6 months notice for the permits. If the dates are not workable for us you will be offered alternatives.
    4. We reserve the right to increase the cost if national park / permit or jeep fees are significantly raised, anything reasonable and we will just absorb it and keep the cost the same. 
    5. No alternatives can be given and once booked we operate a zero refund policy so please ensure that you have adequate travel insurance to cover all eventualities that might arise that may prevent you from taking the trip.
    6. Once you have purchased this perk we will contact you and you will then liaise with our boss Poonam who will sort out your requirements and get us all in the same place at the same time. 
    7. You will be provided with comprehensive pre-departure info for the trip so you will be fully prepared for any eventuality!
    8. Tigers are unpredictable and you must understand that whilst we are the best at what we do, the tigers may have other ideas. We cannot therefore guarantee sightings or that you will be able to photograph them if seen, instead we can 100% guarantee that we will try 200% for you every single second of the day to achieve your goals.

This book is very, and unashamedly, picture led. We have a good story throughout so you know what's happening and what we felt at the time, but it's very very picture led...Conservation FocusThere is no doubt that tigers are in trouble but we believe 100% that they will continue to survive as enough talented people are dedicated to their conservation. Whether it be at international, national or grass roots level, there are tiger champions everywhere and we have included a section in this book to show you the people who we think are making a real difference... One particular local organisation that we work closely with is called Tiger Watch. They are based in Ranthambhore and work with the local people on the boundary zones of the national park, where conflicts and poaching can occur. You can see one of their in-the-field seminars in the pictures above.There are many great charities and organisations doing great work, we have highlighted some of these in the book, but since Tiger Watch is local and works to protect tigers like Noor we are going to use some proceeds from the sales of this book to fund some of their projects. We don't make great claims about this, and it's not a fixed percentage, but when we get decent sales revenue we will see which Tiger Watch projects we can help fund and will publish the details on social media. That's why we aren't making a great claim about this, we are doing because it's the right thing!So as photographers where do we fit in conservation? Well we have both raised funds for conservation projects in Ranthambhore, the last one was to dig a well on the outskirts of Ranthambhore to stop tigers going into villages to get water in the dry season. You didn't see it on social? No because we took some of the profits from Andy's first tiger book and used them without any fanfare. Also from that book donations were made to several other NGO's as well. We don't make any claims about our conservation credentials, as we are just two tiger loving photographers. But what we do is to give wild tigers great PR throughout the world with our work, and allow others much more talented than we are to deliver their conservation messages more effectively by using our powerful imagery. We are PR agents for Noor and her fellow tigers. And that is the focus behind this book, we want you to love tigers like we do, and perhaps afterwards get involved by supporting one of the organisations that we highlight.  Only by supporting these great organisations and the valuable work that they do, and getting greater public awareness, will the tiger survive. We have all got to learn to live together in this expanding world, and that desire must come from within.Perks and DetailsWe have tried to offer you decent discounts on perks and also some things that money cannot buy. For the benefit of our India based supporters we have also created a couple of special Perks for you, like local postage from Delhi thus saving large courier costs. The Regular EditionThe beautiful regular edition of the book will be signed by both of us. Don't ask as it was a logistical nightmare but this is truly unique and will be the only time you can get both of us signing the books, right here right now!  We estimate shipping to begin in early November and will contact you before shipping to see if you'd like a personal dedication. India based clients please see below as we have a special perk for you!Please see FAQ for postage details.The Regular Edition India EditionFor our India based supporters, this is exactly the same as the Regular Edition except that it's posted from Delhi so the postage cost is a reasonable one. Noor Collectors EditionThe Collectors Edition of the book is a Perk for the person that wants something a little more exclusive. You will get a standard edition of the book, personally signed by both photographers, and your choice of 3 limited edition prints (or all 3!). Both sit inside a beautiful woven embossed slip case for stylish storage.All Collectors Edition prints measure 290mm by 230mm and are printed on fine art PhotoRag Giclee paper, which has a wonderful texture and is light fast so will not fade over time. The prints have a generous white border to allow easy framing and as well as the edition number and signature bear the print title with "Andy Rouse Collectors Edition" underneath. All are personally signed & numbered by Andy Rouse and limited to 75 per edition. Collectors Edition Perks A, B and C allow you to choose which one of the limited edition prints you would like, whereas for Collectors Edition D you get them all!Here is the "Beautiful Noor" print:And here is Motherly Love:Finally Noor's Kingdom:Please see FAQ for postage details.Tigers, a Celebration of Life, Collectors EditionAndy's first Tiger book sold out both editions and he has the last few boxes left, which he is using to give a great Reward combo. It's a 96 page book packed with great images and writing, with no less than three award winning images from the major competitions. The Collectors Edition comes with a wonderful A4 limited edition print showing Machali, arguably the most famous tiger to have ever lived:Both book and print are supplied in a stylish brown slip case as shown:This edition is available as part of Book Package 1 or the Ranthambhore Royalty Package with our new Noor Collectors Edition.Small Canvas - Noor LoveThis is a lovely canvas measuring 305mm x 203mm that is supplied on stretchers and ready to hang. It shows a tender moment between Noor and one of her first cubs and will make a lovely gift. Giclee Photorag Print - Noor's FamilyA reminder of a wonderful encounter with Noor and her second brood, Noor's family is a divine open edition Giclee Photorag print:The print is A3 in size so that it's not too big but certainly large enough to see the wonderful detail. It measures 42 cm x 22 cm and has a generous border all around. A beautiful print, if you want a larger one then just let us know.Limited Edition Canvas - Eye of the TigerWe are pleased to bring you a special 100cm (1m longest side) limited edition fine art Canvas,  hand printed and supplied on stretchers so it is ready to hang. With a light fast treatment and a textured appearance, canvas prints provide a wonderful medium for photography, being simple to hang and not requiring any special lighting to shine. Because of this texture we have chosen this Eye of the Tiger image from the book, which features Noor's first male cub called Sultan as an adult male. It will be limited to 50 prints only and will be supplied with a signed and dated certificate of authenticity:And here it is in situ...The canvas shipped in drop proof packaging worldwide and is ready to hang. Please see FAQ for postage details.Limited Edition Canvas - The Big FightA special discount here for Andy's very well known The Big Fight image which won Highly Commended in the BBC Wildlife Photographer of the Year Competition:It's a spectacular image showing Ranthambhore Royalty Machali fighting with one of her cubs over territory, a real coming of age image. Due to the texture this image looks best on canvas and we have chosen a mid size of 80cm for this special discounted edition: Limited Edition Metallic Canvas - Kingdom of NoorAn incredible limited edition of 100, printed on beautiful Metallic Canvas. It's a stunning image that was taken in the last two minutes of light as Noor relaxed in a quiet waterhole...Check this video out...Yes it's a truly beautiful image and one with an incredible finish, Metallic Canvas is just truly amazing with such a feeling and presence. Here it is on the wall...So we have great pleasure in including this as a 100cm Metallic Canvas in our list of Perks. It is a truly special image and one that will grace any wall.Portfolio ReviewWant your favourite 5 or 10 shots reviewed by Andy Rouse? Well this is the reward for you. Send low res shots to Andy and he will make a video review of them for you which will be sent back to your email. It could be your favourite images, or perhaps some for a project you are working on or maybe something that you are struggling with. Perhaps you need help finding your own vision and style, a direction for your photography? Need composition advice or just a re-assurance? Want to buy a special gift for a loved one or photo mad friend? Well this is the perfect reward. Andy’s portfolio reviews are very positive and inspiring, looking at composition, technique and direction. It’s like having a guru right there at your fingertips, and as we have said don’t worry, he is always very very positive and encouraging. Here is a review that Andy did of some recent Galapagos images that he took so check it out!All portfolio reviews will be dealt with on a first come first served based once the book has been printed. The video review will be an MP4 video file, sent to you via file transfer, where  you will see your image on screen with a small window to show Andy talking about it. It’s a very cool video and will be a great help to your photography. Andy will place no time limit on this video, if he wants to spend time looking at one image then he will as he loves looking at pictures and helping photographers find their own style. Andy Rouse Ranthambhore Photo SeminarWe have a wonderful Perk for you with a special Andy Rouse Photography seminar for Indian photographers. It will be held at Dicky & Poonam Singh's Ranthambhore Bagh on November 30th 2018 between 2pm and 6pm and will simply be a wonderful learning experience in a fun and friendly environment.Andy gives many seminars and workshops to aspiring nature photographers around the world to help them reach the next level with their photography. In this special seminar, Andy will give you the benefit of his extensive photographic knowledge with a range of special presentations, focussing on subjects such as shooting techniques, winning compositions and atmospheric lighting (i.e. backlight and silhouettes). He will also present his top 20 favourite images of all time and tell you the story behind them, plus analysing all the technical considerations that he used when making the shots. Finally he will look at helping you to find your own vision and style by looking at some of his most successful projects and how he undertook them. This will be an inspiring seminar for all levels of photographer as Andy is a very engaging and inspiring presenter. The seminar will be packed with great images and top tips, a must for all levels of photographer!The Golden Seat PackagesFor years we have taken small groups of tiger lovers to work with us in Ranthambhore with our favourite tigers. We are experts at getting in the right position at the right time, and pride ourselves that we teach our clients a lot about photography as well as about tiger life. We use our intimate knowledge of the park, and our vast experience at favourite tiger routes, to give our clients the best chance of getting great tiger images. We do this with the aid of zone free all day permits, which allow us to go where we think the action is without any restriction on time or allocated zone. It gives us the freedom to ensure that we have the best chance of getting you something different and unique, rather than the same old headshot or postcard style shot.So we have great pleasure to include our Golden Seats in the Perks program as this is not something that we usually do. This is something that truly money cannot buy, you will work alongside the best tiger photography team on the planet. In the driving seat will be Himmat “The Boss” Singh, chosen driver for many film crews in Ranthambhore and Andy’s driver for the few past years. Next to him in the front will be Dicky, who will be controlling the positioning of the jeep. and offering photographic advice. In the back will be supreme guide Rajkumar. On some of the packages you will also get Andy too in the back, offering camera advice, composition tips and just being your ever present camera guru to ensure that you get the best pictures possible.You can come any yourself of course for much cheaper, but you won't get anything like the images we can get for you. Of course wildlife is wildlife and it's unpredictable but we give you the best chance!Wow now that is the dream team.We are offering several different packages with varying length and people:VIP All-Zone Tiger Safari- India Passport Holders only, upto 4 people - 1 full day all zone VIP pass. You will be guided by Aditya "Dicky" Singh and the team of Himmat and Rajkumar. Perfect for a one day stop in Ranthambhore to give you the best chance of getting good pictures of tigers, it covers up to 4 people in this cost so why not treat a few friends! This package does not include travel, accommodation or food and is for Indian clients only and you will have your own ideas of how to get there and where to stay. Please ignore the specified date, the day can be taken at any time and all arrangements will be handled by Poonam Singh who runs our tiger lives and will make your trip a reality. She can also handle accommodation too in the excellent Bagh. See the T&C's below.Note that you will get one signed book for each person in the jeep, so if there are 4 of you then you will each get a book. Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 1 - Non Indian passport holders only, 1 person - 3 full day all zone VIP passes. You will be in the back of the jeep exclusively with Andy and Rajkumar. The middle seat will be removed, allowing low angle shooting in all situations and unparalleled access. In the front will be Aditya "Dicky" Singh and Himmat. It's an amazing opportunity to treat yourself as you will not only improve your photography a great deal with a guru sitting right next to you helping you every second BUT you are with the best team at finding and photographing tigers. See the T&C's below.We have included full Delhi to Delhi costs including your transfers (train and car), accommodation at the Ranthambhore Bagh on a full board basis, all of your park fees and everything we can think of. Not included are your air fares from your home to Delhi, alcoholic and soft drinks, tips plus other items of a personal nature.You will receive one personally signed Collectors Edition, which will be sent in November 2018.Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 2- The same as Golden Seat DreamTeam Safari 1 but with 2 people in the back so the middle seat will be used, perfect for a couple or two friends. It's a good deal and currently a 5 day safari with us, with you spread across two vehicles with 4 other clients is £4350. So you will get us all to yourselves and remember this is for two people!Again all costs are included but accommodation is costed on a shared basis, single rooms are available at a supplement payable locally. See the T&C's at the bottom of this page.You will receive two personally signed Collectors Editions, which will be sent in November 2018.As you can see a great collection of Perks there!Now here's some more information about us and the project.New Perks?If you see something here but would like a different twist or combo then just write to us and if we like it we will add it to the Perks to benefit everyone! Our JourneyOur journey together started back in 2008 with the immortal Ranthambhore tigress Machali. Working together over a 2 month period we developed a bond and an understanding that has grown into our ‘family’ relationship today. It was Noor that really brought us together though, as over the years this incredible tigress has opened up her lives in front of us and treated us to some incredible intimate encounters. It is these encounters that form the backbone of this book and to which we invite you to share with us.Both of us love photographing tigers, you could say we are addicts, and we are both very good at it. It doesn’t matter to either of us who has won the most awards, we enjoy sharing our photography together and bouncing ideas off each other. That is very much the philosophy of this book; you will not know who took the individual images as it doesn’t matter, our time with Noor has always been a shared experience and that is the message that we want to bring from this book. Teamwork. Collaboration. United by a passion for photography, tigers and conservation. That is what defines us.So what is so special about Noor as there are many great tigress’s in Ranthambhore? It’s hard to describe really, she’s just the ultimate tigress for us, an incredibly ruthless killing machine one minute and a tender mother the next. There’s no doubt she’s a mean mamma. Really mean, sometimes scarily so. On more than one occasion her piercing stare has made both of us take our eyes back from the camera and look away. We love her all the more for this, we are drawn to her; she’s our muse, we have spent every moment we can in her territory and in return she has shared incredible moments of her life with us. Noor’s territory spans Ranthambhore zones 1,2 and part of 6, all three are tough and uncompromising places to live. Winters are freezing cold whilst the summer heat is relentless and unforgiving; everywhere you look towering bluffs dominate the skyline; dark, threatening, and unwelcoming to all comers. In this tough environment Noor has flourished, raising 3 litters to maturity, with her cubs spreading out across Ranthambhore and beyond. About the TeamFrom the very start we wanted to create something that appealed to a wide diversity of tiger lovers worldwide, from conservationists to photographers to those that just love all things tiger. So we’ve worked very hard on this project and dedicated so much time over the past few months to getting the right images in the book that allow us to tell our story.Nick OtwayFrom the outset we knew that we needed a great designer, someone who could take our vision and make sense of it. Andy had worked with Nick before and was impressed by his determination to produce something very different, through a willingness to bend perceived rules. As the book evolved from it’s earliest scribbles, Nick listened to our stories and really helped us build a structure that made sense. So we hope when you pick it up and read it you will see that it flows really well through our encounters with Noor, many of which have been published in the national and international press.Valmik ThaparWe start with a wonderful foreword from India’s foremost tiger expert Valmik Thapar, who really sets the book into perspective. In his words:Aditya ‘Dicky’ Singh and Andy Rouse capture the incredible beauty of the tiger through the story of Noor who survived this last decade and epitomises the very best of Ranthambhore’s amazing tigers. I am certain that Dicky and Andy have created a book that will always be a landmark in the ever-evolving natural historyof Ranthambhore’s tigers. Photo Team - Andy Rouse and Aditya "Dicky" SinghYou may or may not know much about us. Well we are both professional wildlife photographers, have both won major international awards, are both proud Dads and both share a love of all things tiger. Here's what we think of each other...Dicky on Andy - “I first met Andy Rouse, over a decade ago, when he came down to Ranthambhore to work on his tiger book after I had promised to get him some amazing tiger images. I had heard of Andy from before and had been following his work for a few years. I knew he was good, really good at his work. I had been living on the outskirts of Ranthambhore for over a decade and had worked with many cinematographers and photographers, though none of them was like Mr Rouse. At that time, I knew Ranthambhore better than most people in this world and I thought I knew enough about photography not to embarrass myself. The eight weeks or so that we spent together, shooting tigers in Ranthambhore in 2008, was a big milestone in my life, a time when I found a guru and a close friend. At the end of our eight weeks together, he called me a photographer. When Andy Rouse starts calling you a “photographer” you know  you have arrived. I had graduated from a “camera owner”  to an “outdoor photographer.” Finally I had moved from taking pictures, to making them. Since then we have personally grown really close to each other, more family than friends. Over the years, we have shot a lot of images together and partied a lot, something that both of us plan to keep doing. Andy is an amazing animal photographer, though slightly crazy and that is why we get along so damn well.”Andy on Dicky - “I first met Dicky in order to work on my first Tiger book. He had written me this email out of the blue criticising my existing tiger work and saying that he could get me far better images in Ranthambhore in exchange for some photographic tuition. It was cheeky to the point of me deleting the email, but there was also something about it that made me respond, and made me take that chance over 10 years ago. Since then I’ve become one of the family at  his home and shared so many wonderful adventures, many of which you will see in this book. I’ve watched as he has grown in stature as a photographer, he’s always had the gift of knowing tiger behaviour but I’ve expanded his horizons and shown him new ways of shooting. Many of the amazing infrared images in this book are his, certainly a case of the student becoming the master. As a conservationist you will never find anyone more passionate and willing to engage in the fiery world of social media to defend his beloved Ranthambhore. On the social side he is a larger than life character with an army of close friends who I now call my own; we’ve shared some heavy parties together too, both at Holi festival and his legendary 50th birthday week. In conclusion, Dicky is the most trustworthy, loyal and decent friend I could wish to have, and as a photographer he is simply one of the best.”And Finally​So that is it, if you have got to the bottom here you must be keen. We hope that you can support this project and allow Noor, Queen of Ranthambhore to be a reality. Important T&C's for all Perks
We only use tracked postal services and we will include insurance for lost items in transit.
We will endeavour to tell everyone when your Perk is dispatched and, if we can, provide tracking details so you can manage it locally. If something fails to arrive then please bear with us as they maybe a small delay in getting you a replacement shipped whilst we "negotiate" with the courier. We will always keep you informed at all times.
If you have any problems or questions then please don't whinge and whine on social media, just contact us and we will sort it. We are decent and honest people.
Important T&C's for the Golden Seats
You can take your golden seats at any time between November 1st and June 15th as this is the tiger watching season.
Owing to the difference in permit costs, The VIP All-Zone Tiger Safari is only open to Indian passport holders. Please do not apply for this if you do not have an Indian passport as we will not be able to fulfil your Perk.
We will need at least 6 months notice for the permits. If the dates are not workable for us you will be offered alternatives.
We reserve the right to increase the cost if national park / permit or jeep fees are significantly raised, anything reasonable and we will just absorb it and keep the cost the same. 
No alternatives can be given and once booked we operate a zero refund policy so please ensure that you have adequate travel insurance to cover all eventualities that might arise that may prevent you from taking the trip.
Once you have purchased this perk we will contact you and you will then liaise with our boss Poonam who will sort out your requirements and get us all in the same place at the same time. 
You will be provided with comprehensive pre-departure info for the trip so you will be fully prepared for any eventuality!
Tigers are unpredictable and you must understand that whilst we are the best at what we do, the tigers may have other ideas. We cannot therefore guarantee sightings or that you will be able to photograph them if seen, instead we can 100% guarantee that we will try 200% for you every single second of the day to achieve your goals.

story:
C A M P A I G N   O V E R V I E W 

In the Summer of 2017, we (Eva Verbeeck and Robert Carr ), are going to spend nearly two months driving across the South of the United States.

We will be driving from Portland, Oregon to Savannah, Georgia, driving a route that takes us along the Western coast and through the Southern half of the United States. 

We will drive along the border and through ghost towns, indigenous lands, national parks, small towns and big cities. Along the way we will interview people and take their portraits. These interviews and portraits will show the faces of the United States, the diversity of this country and what challenges are Americans face as a nation. 

Photo/ Robert Carr

Photo/ Eva Verbeeck

The United States is still in its infancy as a nation. Since its origin, people from all over the world have traveled here to start a better life.  It has had a worldwide reputation for its freedom and democracy.  yet throughout its history, American society has been in a constant state of evolution. Today, we are witnessing a new chapter in the American story, one which has the potential to change the American experience.  As we drive across the country to start our own new chapter, we want to create a collection of photographs and interviews that document the state that the country is in now: diverse and powerful, fragile and beautiful.

 

We are looking for funds to

  • travel the country
  • purchase the materials needed to properly document the trip,
  • provide a cool end product for everyone to see
