story:
So hello there you awesome bunch of DNA :D 
Time for an introduction. I am Amber. I am born in Holland and am since a short time living in Germany. I am the owner of Laguz photography and model under the name Machinefairy. As a graduated photographer I do what I love most: Photographing atmospheric and sometimes almost game screenshot-ish photos and portraits. Thanks to my love for game art, costumes and anything post apocalyptic and fantasy I am able to make my own little world, an escape from reality. Working in this style has my passion, I can build up my own world into a visible image to share with anyone who wants to see it. It is my escape from reality as well as a door to another world in one image to those who look at it. My photos have to speak to the imagination, to make people think of a story or scene it could be from.

My only thing is that I do not own a camera, I lend a Canon 60D from a good friend. But now that I am graduated and moving to another country it is time to hand it back to his owner. 'But no problem there, let's get a camera!' That's what you'd think right? Yeah I wish it was that way. To be able to fund a camera I need to make new work, but I can not work without a camera. Makes sense right? This is where you can help me if you like my work and want to make your part to get more art into this world.

 

 

What is needed and what will be funded:

So, let's get into the financial details and where the money will go because I suppose you would like to know what happens with it and I fully agree with that:

- 5% goes to Indiegogo (100-,)

which leaves us with 1900-,

- I estimated the production of the perks and all to 400-,

And then we are at 1500-,

- I am aiming to buy a Canon 80D which is currently priced at 1040-, for just a body.

- 450-, is left now.

This money will be used for a lens: the Tamron 28-75/2.8 (I already own a Canon 50mm 1.8)

But what if we go over the goal? Then I will check out what can be bought for that money to enhance my work more. Studio lights for example or even a better lens or body then I had in mind. Let's just try to reach the original goal first <3

 

 

So what happens if I will not reach my goal?

It depends on how far I will be towards my goal. I wil always have to pay the 5%. Then I get the prints, posters and calendars and send them. What is left will first be used for a body (without the lens). If it is not enough to buy the body of the 80D I will choose to either save it up and keep it untill I have enough money for it or either will I buy a secondhand body, depending on the amount of money that is left.

 

So, now you know where the money goes, but what do you get?

On the side of this page I have a variety of perks you can choose from if you want more then just fund me. You can choose from a lot of different pieces of art like prints, posters and calendars. the first ones will be made and send out in 30 days. the second batch will be made and send out 30 days after that.

these posters and calendars will ONLY be given during this funding and so are limited edition!

If there is something that you would love to have (A specific picture as print for example?) but is not there, please let me know and maybe we can figure something out and I can make you a personalized perk.

 

For the perks you are able to choose between images of my photography and my modeling work. just to make a bit more clear of what is what; here you can find bigger images and the names (Calendars ca be found on top of this page):

https://www.facebook.com/machinefairy/media_set?set=a.10212651872438679.1073741877.1441478778&type=3&uploaded=21

 

 

 

 

The Impact

 

So why would you fund me, what is in it for you?

Well, for a variety of reasons:

- You help me to pursue my dream job

- You will have a great feeling of being able to help someone

- You will help putting more art into the world

- With getting certain perks you have some limited edition art items (Calendars and posters)

- with all of these, you make the world a better place <3 

- Also, with every perk I will add your name in a major thank you post on my social media pages and blog (lifeofLaguz). (You can choose if you want your name mentioned or not)

 

You back me up into new and running projects (books).

I have plans to make the post apocalypse scene that I photograph into a bigger project, maybe for galleries or a book.

And currently I have a running project about the image of beauty, aesthetics and mindset of people that are different from what 'society' expects, that I eventually want to make into a book, it is a long running project. To me it is not only a photography project, but it is also making a visible add to documenting 'today', literally making history for the future. You can find all about it on www.laguzphotography.com under ' project I AM'.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The only risk that I have now is not reaching my goal. But with your help I can! 

 

So maybe you can not fund me here, but you can help me any other way:

- If you like you could share this page on your facebook, twitter or any other social media, or simply share my post from there. Tell your friends, family, classmates, colleagues about my work and that their help is needed to create more :D

You can either send them the link or use the Indiegogo share tool/buttons that are found on this page as well.

- I would like to help you here but I want another photo on print, Is that possible? Yes! You can message me and we can make a personal perk, just for you. (You can find all my images on my Machinefairy facebook page and Laguz photography facebook page)

- You want to help me but this is just not it? you can find my design work and some great products like bags, shirts, leggings, homeware and home deco on my Redbubble and Society6 (They have a lot of cool sales going on lately!) Everything I sell on there goes straight to my savings for a camera:

https://society6.com/machineshop

http://www.redbubble.com/people/laguz

https://www.etsy.com/shop/machinefairyshop

Or keep supporting me through my Patreon page for a lot of other exclusive things: http://www.patreon.com/Machinefairy

 

'I am gonna keep an eye on you.'

If you want to keep updated about this funding, about my endeavors and/or my work then follow me on any of these websites:

Website Laguz hotography: http://laguzphotography.com

Blog: https://lifeoflaguz.wordpress.com

facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Laguzphotography/

instagram: https://www.instagram.com/laguzphoto/

tumblr: http://laguzphotography.tumblr.com

 

Then there is my modelling work as well:

Website: http://www.machinefairy.com

Blog: https://lifeoflaguz.wordpress.com

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Machinefairy/

instagram: http://www.instagram.com/Machinefairy/

tumblr: http://machinefairy.tumblr.com

 

Last but not least: Any help is greatly appreciated and any support means a lot to me and it also means that I am one step closer to my goals, thanks to you <3
story_txt:
So hello there you awesome bunch of DNA :D Time for an introduction. I am Amber. I am born in Holland and am since a short time living in Germany. I am the owner of Laguz photography and model under the name Machinefairy. As a graduated photographer I do what I love most: Photographing atmospheric and sometimes almost game screenshot-ish photos and portraits. Thanks to my love for game art, costumes and anything post apocalyptic and fantasy I am able to make my own little world, an escape from reality. Working in this style has my passion, I can build up my own world into a visible image to share with anyone who wants to see it. It is my escape from reality as well as a door to another world in one image to those who look at it. My photos have to speak to the imagination, to make people think of a story or scene it could be from.
My only thing is that I do not own a camera, I lend a Canon 60D from a good friend. But now that I am graduated and moving to another country it is time to hand it back to his owner. 'But no problem there, let's get a camera!' That's what you'd think right? Yeah I wish it was that way. To be able to fund a camera I need to make new work, but I can not work without a camera. Makes sense right? This is where you can help me if you like my work and want to make your part to get more art into this world.
 
 

What is needed and what will be funded:
So, let's get into the financial details and where the money will go because I suppose you would like to know what happens with it and I fully agree with that:
- 5% goes to Indiegogo (100-,)
which leaves us with 1900-,
- I estimated the production of the perks and all to 400-,
And then we are at 1500-,
- I am aiming to buy a Canon 80D which is currently priced at 1040-, for just a body.
- 450-, is left now.
This money will be used for a lens: the Tamron 28-75/2.8 (I already own a Canon 50mm 1.8)
But what if we go over the goal? Then I will check out what can be bought for that money to enhance my work more. Studio lights for example or even a better lens or body then I had in mind. Let's just try to reach the original goal first <3
 
 
So what happens if I will not reach my goal?
It depends on how far I will be towards my goal. I wil always have to pay the 5%. Then I get the prints, posters and calendars and send them. What is left will first be used for a body (without the lens). If it is not enough to buy the body of the 80D I will choose to either save it up and keep it untill I have enough money for it or either will I buy a secondhand body, depending on the amount of money that is left.
 
So, now you know where the money goes, but what do you get?
On the side of this page I have a variety of perks you can choose from if you want more then just fund me. You can choose from a lot of different pieces of art like prints, posters and calendars. the first ones will be made and send out in 30 days. the second batch will be made and send out 30 days after that.
these posters and calendars will ONLY be given during this funding and so are limited edition!
If there is something that you would love to have (A specific picture as print for example?) but is not there, please let me know and maybe we can figure something out and I can make you a personalized perk.
 
For the perks you are able to choose between images of my photography and my modeling work. just to make a bit more clear of what is what; here you can find bigger images and the names (Calendars ca be found on top of this page):
https://www.facebook.com/machinefairy/media_set?set=a.10212651872438679.1073741877.1441478778&type=3&uploaded=21
 
 
 
 
The Impact
 
So why would you fund me, what is in it for you?
Well, for a variety of reasons:
- You help me to pursue my dream job
- You will have a great feeling of being able to help someone
- You will help putting more art into the world
- With getting certain perks you have some limited edition art items (Calendars and posters)
- with all of these, you make the world a better place <3 
- Also, with every perk I will add your name in a major thank you post on my social media pages and blog (lifeofLaguz). (You can choose if you want your name mentioned or not)
 
You back me up into new and running projects (books).
I have plans to make the post apocalypse scene that I photograph into a bigger project, maybe for galleries or a book.
And currently I have a running project about the image of beauty, aesthetics and mindset of people that are different from what 'society' expects, that I eventually want to make into a book, it is a long running project. To me it is not only a photography project, but it is also making a visible add to documenting 'today', literally making history for the future. You can find all about it on www.laguzphotography.com under ' project I AM'.
 

Risks & Challenges
 
The only risk that I have now is not reaching my goal. But with your help I can! 
 
So maybe you can not fund me here, but you can help me any other way:
- If you like you could share this page on your facebook, twitter or any other social media, or simply share my post from there. Tell your friends, family, classmates, colleagues about my work and that their help is needed to create more :D
You can either send them the link or use the Indiegogo share tool/buttons that are found on this page as well.
- I would like to help you here but I want another photo on print, Is that possible? Yes! You can message me and we can make a personal perk, just for you. (You can find all my images on my Machinefairy facebook page and Laguz photography facebook page)
- You want to help me but this is just not it? you can find my design work and some great products like bags, shirts, leggings, homeware and home deco on my Redbubble and Society6 (They have a lot of cool sales going on lately!) Everything I sell on there goes straight to my savings for a camera:
https://society6.com/machineshop
http://www.redbubble.com/people/laguz
https://www.etsy.com/shop/machinefairyshop
Or keep supporting me through my Patreon page for a lot of other exclusive things: http://www.patreon.com/Machinefairy
 
'I am gonna keep an eye on you.'
If you want to keep updated about this funding, about my endeavors and/or my work then follow me on any of these websites:
Website Laguz hotography: http://laguzphotography.com
Blog: https://lifeoflaguz.wordpress.com
facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Laguzphotography/
instagram: https://www.instagram.com/laguzphoto/
tumblr: http://laguzphotography.tumblr.com
 
Then there is my modelling work as well:
Website: http://www.machinefairy.com
Blog: https://lifeoflaguz.wordpress.com
facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Machinefairy/
instagram: http://www.instagram.com/Machinefairy/
tumblr: http://machinefairy.tumblr.com
 
Last but not least: Any help is greatly appreciated and any support means a lot to me and it also means that I am one step closer to my goals, thanks to you <3

story:
Overview

Hey Everybody! My name is Brian C. Janes (BCJ) and I'm a photographer in Los Angeles. You may know me from my first book that was released last year, It's All That Glitters: Portraits of Burlesque Performers in Their Homes. I've been working on a new series of fine art photos lately that features movement of the female form combined with experiments in lighting. I recently entered a photo from this series in a competition called Perfect Exposures 2013 presented by The Perfect Exposure Gallery, and lo and behold, one of my photos was selected for the show! I didn't win the cash prize, unfortunately, but I'm pretty excited about being selected for the show.

Now that I've been selected, I really need your help to get my photo printed and framed to appear in the show. Time is of the essence! The opening reception for the gallery show is June 27th - just two weeks away! And I have to turn the print in to the gallery by the end of next week.

Rewards

In appreciation for your assistance I'm offering some rewards, including:

  • A special sneak peek at the series this image is a part of (all contributors get this!)
  • 8x10 prints of the selected image
  • It's All That Glitters posters
  • It's All That Glitters books
  • The framed print that wil hang in the gallery show

Breakdown

Here is where the funds from this campaign will be invested:

  • Printing
  • Matting
  • Framing
  • Creating and shipping rewards

I will invest any remaining funds into future competition opportunities.

Why This Matters

I am new to photo competitions and I believe they are a great opportunity for my creative work to receive critical feedback and recognition. This is just the first of what I hope will be many steps on a journey through competitions and exhibitions.
Other Ways You Can Help

Please take a moment to share the link to this campaign with your friends! Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus or wherever you hang out online. It's only with your help that I can be a part of this great gallery show.


Thank you for taking the time to look at my project, and thank you for all of your support!

It's All That Glitters Poster:

It's All That Glitters Book:

story:
Back Story

My name is David Thomas. I am a freelance photographer in Austin, TX. My hard drive crashed. This project is to raise funds to pay to have my photographic files recovered.

Since 2008, I have been chronicling political and other events in Austin, TX. After retiring as a project manager in the D.C. area I moved to Austin, TX, where I was determined to return to my first love - photography - and to become involved in my community. I have been able to do both.

While I had completely backed up all photos processed on a PC, I neglected to do so with about 20,000 photos processed on a Macbook Pro, using Lightroom, since the fall of 2012. I couldn't back them up on my PC-formatted external hard drive and I kept putting off getting one for my Mac. Biggest mistake of my professional life.

Extent of loss - History:

I am just sick over the possible loss of these photos. They represent personal milestones, professional achievements, and political history. They include full resolution files for a client running to be a judge in Travis County. Another client has lost, to now, photos taken at her wedding reception. Other files lost are of other clients and interested parties who keep coming back for this photo or that: wedding and engagement parties, Mitzvah, Community/neighborhood events and ceremonies, Veterans events, numerous political campaigns, head shots, group shots, dinners and galas for charitable organizations, photos from Sierra Club campaigns, the Texas Democratic State Convention and the Democratic National Convention. And I was at the Texas State Capitol this summer. I was there for the whole thing. Clients who know about the crash are understanding, but very disappointed. I would like to take away that disappointment.

Luckily, the shot above was not lost, but generations could have been denied this important portrait of Texas history in the making! Help me to prevent other moments of history being lost!


What I Need & What You Get

Ideally:

My goal now is $2,000. The funding goal of $3,000 set up at the beginning of this effort is unchangeable, but the company that is doing the recovery, DriveSavers, has lowered the amount they will charge me, since this is not a rush. The hard drive is at DriveSavers, a clean-room data recovery firm in California. They tell me that they may be able to recover all my photo files, or none. The cost is determined by whether or not and by what percentage of files they can recover. There are two steps to the recovery - mechanical and software recovery. They must first fix the mechanical problem before trying to recover the data. If I am able to recover all data, and the charge is the full $1,692, the remaining $308 will go toward offsetting the costs for the new hard drive (I am using now), the new backup drive (hooked up now), and cloud storage. I do not want this to happen again.

What happens if I raise less money?

If I raise less than my goal, and less than the cost of recovery, all funds will go to that recovery. The recovery firm will allow me to pay off the remainder over time on a "lay away" basis. I will not receive the files until the total cost is covered. 

If you help fund my project, but data is not recovered and I am charged nothing, I will donate ALL funds to the Austin Children's Shelter for whom I have taken photos. Their work is invaluable. The Austin Children's Shelter protects and heals children, young adults and families in need. The Austin Children's Shelter believes that every child and young adult in our community deserves to feel safe and to receive nurturing care in order to grow into happy, responsible and fulfilled adults. Their goal is to end child abuse and neglect; to create a community and a world that has no need of a shelter for abused or neglected children.

If I raise more than is necessary to pay for the recovery and new hard drive and back up, all remaining funds will go toward the Austin Children's Shelter.

What do you get for helping me recover my photos?

For helping me, I offer you either greatly discounted downloads and prints, or discounted or free photo shoots (in Austin). I can offer the same photo shoots in Central Texas for expenses. The discounted offers appear to the right. 

Because most of the photos I have taken in the last 2 years are on my crashed hard drive, the photos offered at this time for download or printing must come from the 3000 plus photos existing on my SmugMug site, www.davidthomasphotos.smugmug.com. These include: 10 Galleries (1,585 photos) taken at the Texas State Capitol during the June and July 2013 Stand With Women efforts, including Wendy Davis' filibuster; 10 political events (1,172 photos), including but not limited to: Wendy Davis Announces for Governor and fundraisers for Joe Kennedy III and the Equality Forward Summit with Barney Frank; over 300 photos taken at Eeyore's Birthday (an Austin tradition for over 40 years) over a number of years; and a couple of rallies.

Until February 17, I cannot offer coupons on SmugMug. I have to change my subscription and I cannot until then. In the meantime you can let me know which photo(s) you want to download or print, and I can send them to you. If you are willing to wait, and gamble, for the rest of the photos that hopefully will be recovered, I will extend the same discounts to those I can put on Smugmug. 

Most photos I have taken are viewable on my Facebook Fan Page: www.facebook.com/AustinDavePhotos. If I receive enough requests for photos on the Fan Page, that are not in SmugMug, I will upload those that can be recovered.

What Getting My Photos Back Means

My photos allow you to feel the event. To feel the energy. If you were there, to relive the experience. I would post the comments from my fans, but they are on the crashed hard drive. These photos are moments in time, documentary in nature, and are history. 

And these photos and albums and moments in time are my babies. Please help me get them back.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, but would like to help me get my photos back, please pass this link to your friends (personal and Facebook) and families. Please let others know of the importance to me and to those interested in Austin, TX political history. 

You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help get the word out.

Thank you all very much for donating to this project.

story:
4 août 2020 - 18:07

                             Beyrouth Mon Amour
                                 Ouvrage Collectif

 

Ce projet est l’œuvre d’un collectif d’écrivains et photographes libanais et non libanais qui a conçu la réalisation d’un livre, le premier du genre, consacré à la tragédie du 4 août. Recueil de textes et de photos en couleurs, cet ouvrage collectif, se donne une double vocation : entretenir la mémoire de ce qui s’est passé ce jour-là, par respect pour les innombrables victimes de l’explosion, et apporter une aide à cette jeunesse abandonnée. À cet effet, TOUS LES BÉNÉFICES de l’ouvrage leur seront intégralement affectés, et ce selon trois axes : à travers l’ouvrage imprimé au Liban qui se vendra à un prix très abordable, et sur deux plateformes en lignes au Canada et en France, couvrant ainsi le Canada, les USA et l’Europe, selon le principe de l’impression sur demande qui nécessite néanmoins un apport financier de départ permettant de faire baisser le coût de l’impression en préachetant une quantité qui sera disponible à l’achat avec une marge conséquente. Des bienfaiteurs ont déjà couvert une partie des frais des 3000 exemplaires qui seront imprimés au Liban. Afin que ces trois fronts d’aide soient couverts, un montant de 5500 EUR permettrait de démarrer cette aventure éditoriale à vocation humanitaire.
La somme collectée sera répartie entre trois structures qui œuvrent déjà sur ce terrain : ERASMUS EXPERTISE, AFEL, AL MAJAL.

PS: Comme il y avait une cagnotte qui avait eté lancée en parallèle pour compléter celle-ci et puis clôturée suite à des soucis informatiques, les deux appels à contribution ont été concentrés sur cette plateforme, ce qui a nécessité un changement dans la somme fixée ainsi que la durée.

story:
Herzlich willkommen bei ‚Happy Berry Photography‘!

 Mein Name ist Jennifer, wohnhaft in Leipzig und 21 jahre alt. Damit Du Dir besser vorstellen kannst, wer und was Happy Berry Photography ist, möchte ich Dir gern alles vorstellen. Mit der Fotografie habe ich im Frühjahr 2013 angefangen. Anfangs kannte man mich noch unter dem Namen „Shooter Style“.
Erst klang es professionell und modern, doch mit der Zeit klang es für mich immer unpersönlicher. Es passte nicht zu mir.
Ich bin ein fröhlicher Mensch und wollte, dass mein Name auch das ausstrahlt. Durch viele verschiedene Gedankengänge kam ich am Ende auf den Namen „Happy Berry Photography“.

 Das Vorhaben :


Kurz und knackig erzählt, brauche ich finanzielle Unterstützung für diverses Fotoequipment & Stylingzubehör (Fotostudio, Make-up, Objektive, etc.) "Happy Berry Photography" ist für mich weder ein Hobby, noch einfach das Fotografieren, sondern mein Leben. Ich fotografiere jeden Tag, und ohne meine Kamera wäre ich nicht mehr ich... Deshalb studiere ich auch Fotodesign um meinen Traum, das eigene Fotostudio, einmal zu verwirklichen. Also ist das echt nicht nur ein Hobby, sondern eine reine Herzensangelegenheit. Es ist ja nicht nur die Fotografie die mir besonderen Spaß macht, sondern auch das Stylen meiner Modele (Haare machen, Make-up, Kleidung heraussuchen, etc.) Bitte helft Happy Berry Photography!

 Für was ist das Geld, welches Du mir gibst?

Das Geld ist in erster Linie dafür, neues Equipment (Objektiv in erster Linie) zu kaufen, wie jeder weiß nicht gerade billig, und als 21 jährige Studentin alleine nicht machbar. Für Eure Spenden bekommt ihr auch etwas, von über Prints meiner festen Modele, bis hin zu etwas selbstgenähtem meiner Modele. Für diejenigen, die aus Leipzig kommen, biete ich dann auch aufregende Shootings an. Genaueres dann. Das geld geht ausschließlich an mich (Happy Berry)


Was bewirkt ihr?:

Ihr helft mir besseres Equipment zu bekommen und helft außerdem, dass ich mich verbessere. Happy Berry Photography ist wie gesagt ein Herzensprojekt und bedeutet mir wirklich verdammt viel, jeder Mensch hat träume und ich möchte den Traum real machen, ihr helft uns wirklich wahnsinnig viel mit jeder Spende (meinen festen Modelen und mir).


Wieso hänge ich so sehr an Happy Berry Photography?

 Die Fotografie faszinierte mich schon sehr lange. Angefangen hat alles mit einigen Bildern für private Angelegenheiten, dann stellte sich das Fotografieren immer mehr in den Vordergrund. So kam es dann, dass ich deutlich öfter eine Linse vor dem Auge hatte. Allerdings empfand ich meine Werke am Anfang als nicht gut und dachte automatisch, dass ich total unbegabt bin, was mir einen Teil meiner Familie auch vermittelte und ich mit dem Hobby alleine da stand.
 Doch meine Faszination an den Bildern ließ mich hart arbeiten. Ich wollte nicht aufgeben, da jeder sagte, ich würde es nicht schaffen sei unbegabt. Darum übte ich weiter, probierte mich auch an Landschaften aus, und einige sparsame Monate später erfüllte ich mir den Wunsch einer (neueren) Spiegelreflexkamera.
Je weiter ich mich mit der Materie befasste, umso tiefer wurde die Liebe zur Fotografie. Doch nicht nur das einfache "drauf halten und los fotografieren" interessiert mich, sondern auch alles drum herum.
 Für mich geht es auch besonders darum, das perfekte Set zu haben, die richtige Location zu finden, das Model zu beraten und zu stylen – einfach alles um DAS Foto zu bekommen. Ich bin ein offener Mensch. Ich rede gern und gehe auf neue Menschen zu, besonders, wenn ich merke, dass sie eine gewisse Schüchternheit besitzen, die die Arbeit blockieren könnte. Bei mir kannst Du gewiss sein, dass es keine peinliche Stille gibt, sondern es munter vor sich geht. Generell lache ich sehr gern und viel und animiere auch jedes Model dazu es ebenfalls zu tun. Gute Gespräche und einige Lacher erleichtern mir die Arbeit, und lassen jeden entspannen. Zudem lasse ich niemanden im Regen stehen. Vor jedem Shooting mache ich mir über Posen und Mimik Gedanken, damit die Schönheit des Einzelnen auch ans Licht kommt. Nur ein begeisterndes Ergebnis stellt am Ende Dich zufrieden und im Umkehrschluss auch mich.


Mit viel Willen, Dickköpfigkeit und den Halt meiner Schwiegerfamilie sowie meiner festen Modele, konnte ich das werden was ich jetzt bin... Perfekt bin ich dennoch noch lange nicht, bitte helft mir es zu werden! Auch wenn ihr nichts spenden könnt, könnt ihr es empfehlen und weiter verbreiten.

Ich danke euch. Schaut vorbei!
story_txt:
Herzlich willkommen bei ‚Happy Berry Photography‘!
 Mein Name ist Jennifer, wohnhaft in Leipzig und 21 jahre alt.

Damit Du Dir besser vorstellen kannst, wer und was Happy Berry 
Photography ist, möchte ich Dir gern alles vorstellen.
Mit der Fotografie habe ich im Frühjahr 2013 angefangen. Anfangs kannte 
man mich noch unter dem Namen „Shooter Style“. Erst klang es 
professionell und modern, doch mit der Zeit klang es für mich immer 
unpersönlicher. Es passte nicht zu mir. Ich bin ein fröhlicher Mensch 
und wollte, dass mein Name auch das ausstrahlt. Durch viele verschiedene
 Gedankengänge kam ich am Ende auf den Namen „Happy Berry Photography“. Das Vorhaben :


Kurz und knackig erzählt, brauche ich finanzielle Unterstützung für 
diverses Fotoequipment & Stylingzubehör (Fotostudio, Make-up, 
Objektive, etc.)

"Happy Berry Photography" ist für mich weder ein Hobby, noch einfach das
 Fotografieren, sondern mein Leben. Ich fotografiere jeden Tag, und ohne
 meine Kamera wäre ich nicht mehr ich... Deshalb studiere ich auch 
Fotodesign um meinen Traum, das eigene Fotostudio, einmal zu 
verwirklichen.
Also ist das echt nicht nur ein Hobby, sondern eine reine 
Herzensangelegenheit.

Es ist ja nicht nur die Fotografie die mir besonderen Spaß macht, 
sondern auch das Stylen meiner Modele (Haare machen, Make-up, Kleidung 
heraussuchen, etc.)

Bitte helft Happy Berry Photography! Für was ist das Geld, welches Du mir gibst?

Das Geld ist in erster Linie dafür, neues Equipment (Objektiv in erster 
Linie) zu kaufen, wie jeder weiß nicht gerade billig, und als 21 jährige
 Studentin alleine nicht machbar.

Für Eure Spenden bekommt ihr auch etwas, von über Prints meiner festen 
Modele, bis hin zu etwas selbstgenähtem meiner Modele. Für diejenigen, 
die aus Leipzig kommen, biete ich dann auch aufregende Shootings an. 
Genaueres dann. 
Das geld geht ausschließlich an mich (Happy Berry)

Was bewirkt ihr?:

Ihr helft mir besseres Equipment zu bekommen und helft außerdem, dass ich mich verbessere. 
Happy Berry Photography ist wie gesagt ein Herzensprojekt und bedeutet 
mir wirklich verdammt viel, jeder Mensch hat träume und ich möchte den 
Traum real machen, ihr helft uns wirklich wahnsinnig viel mit jeder 
Spende (meinen festen Modelen und mir).

Wieso hänge ich so sehr an Happy Berry Photography? Die Fotografie faszinierte mich schon sehr lange. Angefangen hat alles 
mit einigen Bildern für private Angelegenheiten, dann stellte sich das 
Fotografieren immer mehr in den Vordergrund. So kam es dann, dass ich 
deutlich öfter eine Linse vor dem Auge hatte. Allerdings empfand ich 
meine Werke am Anfang als nicht gut und dachte automatisch, dass ich 
total unbegabt bin, was mir einen Teil meiner Familie auch vermittelte 
und ich mit dem Hobby alleine da stand. Doch meine Faszination an den 
Bildern ließ mich hart arbeiten. Ich wollte nicht aufgeben, da jeder 
sagte, ich würde es nicht schaffen sei unbegabt. Darum übte ich weiter, 
probierte mich auch an Landschaften aus, und einige sparsame Monate 
später erfüllte ich mir den Wunsch einer (neueren) Spiegelreflexkamera.
Je weiter ich mich mit der Materie befasste, umso tiefer wurde die Liebe
 zur Fotografie. Doch nicht nur das einfache "drauf halten und los 
fotografieren" interessiert mich, sondern auch alles drum herum. Für mich geht es auch besonders darum, das perfekte Set zu haben, die 
richtige Location zu finden, das Model zu beraten und zu stylen – 
einfach alles um DAS Foto zu bekommen.

Ich bin ein offener Mensch. Ich rede gern und gehe auf neue Menschen zu,
 besonders, wenn ich merke, dass sie eine gewisse Schüchternheit 
besitzen, die die Arbeit blockieren könnte. Bei mir kannst Du gewiss 
sein, dass es keine peinliche Stille gibt, sondern es munter vor sich 
geht. Generell lache ich sehr gern und viel und animiere auch jedes 
Model dazu es ebenfalls zu tun. Gute Gespräche und einige Lacher 
erleichtern mir die Arbeit, und lassen jeden entspannen. Zudem lasse ich
 niemanden im Regen stehen. Vor jedem Shooting mache ich mir über Posen 
und Mimik Gedanken, damit die Schönheit des Einzelnen auch ans Licht 
kommt.
Nur ein begeisterndes Ergebnis stellt am Ende Dich zufrieden und im 
Umkehrschluss auch mich.

Mit viel Willen, Dickköpfigkeit und den Halt meiner Schwiegerfamilie 
sowie meiner festen Modele, konnte ich das werden was ich jetzt bin... 
Perfekt bin ich dennoch noch lange nicht, bitte helft mir es zu werden! 

Auch wenn ihr nichts spenden könnt, könnt ihr es empfehlen und weiter verbreiten.
Ich danke euch. Schaut vorbei!

story:
Join me on my journey as I travel the US in search for remaning WWII veterans.

I want to make a book that documents my travels across the country in which I interview and photograph World War II veterans. The youngest of the vets are nearing 90 years old and very soon, this opportunity will be lost.

The book will be as much about as this diverse country as it will the men and women I meet. If I can mix this with stories no one else can tell and a perspective different to which young people are exposed, the book will be more than interesting, but also of importance.

The interviews, while focusing on WWII experiences, will delve into post war experiences of the interviewees. This ties the men into the locales where they’re interviewed and elevates the undertaking beyond just a series of interviews. In order to achieve this sense of grounding, I will make an effort to avoid a series of photos at retirement homes.

I hope this communicates the nature of our proposed undertaking, our artistic goals, through sight and sound, and our perceptive goals through the words and lives of the veterans.

This was the wording of the "one sheet" I wrote that a production company saw and contacted me wanting to make this book. Unfortunately, after months of planning, investors of the film pulled out of the project and my movie was shelved.

I'm coming to IndieGoGo with the hope of breathing new life into this project of mine. 

The funding of the project will go to:

  • renting equipment
  • renting a car to travel across the country
  • gas/accommodation
  • getting the book printed
  • reward fullfilment

What's great about funding this project, is that you actually fund the book as well.

Here are some videos that I made to support the project:

A recent interview with Major Francis Turner (ret)


The Original Pitch for the Project 3 years ago


Interviews with 'Saving Private Ryan' actor, Adam Goldberg



If this project gets funded, I will set out to start shooting immediately. I plan to be out on the road for 2-3 months making my journey, meeting the vets, and hopefully have a book produced by Veterans Day 2014

Thank you so much for stopping by to check out my project, and a big THANK YOU if you have donated.

If you weren't able to make a financial donation, spreading the word helps just as much!

Thank you,

-Mike Lerner

story:
Our Story

Hi, I'm Saundra. A single mom, who's finally adventuring out with a cause and purpose. Ever since my father introduced me to photography it's been a dream of mine to open a studio for everyone. I've been an amateur photographer for 30+ years and now want to do it full time and do it right.

 I've always been fascinated by being able to capture a moment in time. Things you and I will never see again the same way, can be captured, then magically every time that image is viewed, it takes you right back to that  moment. That's a magnificent feeling, but that is where my frustration begins. I began to see that so many people would love to get family portraits, pet portraits, or high quality wedding/event photos, but can't and don’t because of the high prices. I want to change that. I believe that I can offer excellent photography for every person on a budget. I just need the financial boost to do it.

 In Aug. 2010, I moved from Atlanta, GA. to Gatlinburg, TN., with two purposes 1. To assist in the care of my mother, and 2. to take advantage of creating a new life, going after my dreams and working in the photography world. From this my vision has grown to see a need in East Tennessee. Family is everything here. People take their heritage very serious and are proud of the photos they have. I want to be a part of that; I want to make a difference for the people who can't spend thousands of dollars on photo packages. To do this I need your assistance.

The Impact

The impact of what I am offering maybe priceless to some, and a real blessing to many. We all live in a time where we watch every penny coming and going. People are so tired of all the new "have to's" just to put food on the table that they are desperate for something lasting, something fun and something to share. Images of the new baby in great-grandma's arms, is priceless, but many are doing without or getting by with a snapshot. Don't you believe that moments like the above example deserve a studio quality image? I think, the babies, the grandparents, and the generations and more, all deserve to have excellent quality studio photography document their joy. I don't want to think that one day when they don't have the pictures it reminds them of when times were really hard or they wished they had went ahead and got the pictures of the one who passes away. That's when you get the "I wish things could have been different."

 
What We Need & What You Get

To accomplish this vision I need to add to the photo equipment that I all ready have. The totals of the equipment come to $2996.00. That is why I chose the amount of $3000. The following is a breakdown of equipment.

·       Portrait Len with Auto Focus (70mm-200mm)

·       Lensbaby, The Composer: a selective focal lens that offers unlimited creative images.

·       Studio lighting kit A.(includes 2 continuous lighting stands, umbrellas, bulb,)

·       Studio lighting kit B (includes 2 strobe lights, bulbs, stands, soft boxes)

·       Seamless backdrops in smoke, beige, black, white and wine.

·       Gelatin light covers. (colored transparencies that go over the lights)

·       Software: Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Lightroom. 

·       Portrait Props and Sets (seating, accent pieces)

·        3 Sample pieces (1. 11x14 Canvas, 2. Coffee table book, min 8 pages, 3. Affordable photo package.

 

If I do not reach my goal, what money does come in I will to apply it to this list. I will also post pictures of what is purchased on Facebook so that it can be seen. On top of the perks I have listed, I would like you to know that at the end of this campaign, from my earnings in the first month of business, I will donate and pass it forward to someone else in the photography business here on IndieGoGo.

Since I do not have other funding available I'm depending on your assistance to make something great happen.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Along with contributing, another great way to help out is to share the love. Yup, DIWO (Do It With Others) Please share this information to everyone you know. Make some noise and let’s get the word out. Giving is an amazing experience for not just the person who is in need, but for the giver. By sharing this, you give an opportunity for others to outsource of themselves. Click on those share tools!


Thank you so very much.

Along with contributing, another great way to help out is to share the love. Yup, DIWO (Do It With Others) Please share this information to everyone you know. Make some noise and let’s get the word out. Giving is an amazing experience for not just the person who is in need, but for the giver. By sharing this, you give an opportunity for others to outsource of themselves. Click on those share tools!
Thank you so very much.

story:
Herzlich willkommen bei ‚Happy Berry Photography‘!

Mein Name ist Jennifer, wohnhaft in Leipzig und 21 jahre alt. Damit Du Dir besser vorstellen kannst, wer und was Happy Berry Photography ist, möchte ich Dir gern alles vorstellen. Mit der Fotografie habe ich im Frühjahr 2013 angefangen. Anfangs kannte man mich noch unter dem Namen „Shooter Style“. 
Erst klang es professionell und modern, doch mit der Zeit klang es für mich immer unpersönlicher. Es passte nicht zu mir. 
Ich bin ein fröhlicher Mensch und wollte, dass mein Name auch das ausstrahlt. Durch viele verschiedene Gedankengänge kam ich am Ende auf den Namen „Happy Berry Photography“.



Das Vorhaben : 

Kurz und knackig erzählt, brauche ich finanzielle Unterstützung für diverses Fotoequipment & Stylingzubehör (Fotostudio, Make-up, Objektive, etc.) "Happy Berry Photography" ist für mich weder ein Hobby, noch einfach das Fotografieren, sondern mein Leben. Ich fotografiere jeden Tag, und ohne meine Kamera wäre ich nicht mehr ich... Deshalb studiere ich auch Fotodesign um meinen Traum, das eigene Fotostudio, einmal zu verwirklichen. Also ist das echt nicht nur ein Hobby, sondern eine reine Herzensangelegenheit. Es ist ja nicht nur die Fotografie die mir besonderen Spaß macht, sondern auch das Stylen meiner Modele (Haare machen, Make-up, Kleidung heraussuchen, etc.) Bitte helft Happy Berry Photography!


 Für was ist das Geld, welches Du mir gibst? 

Das Geld ist in erster Linie dafür, neues Equipment (Objektiv in erster Linie) zu kaufen, wie jeder weiß nicht gerade billig, und als 21 jährige Studentin alleine nicht machbar. Für Eure Spenden bekommt ihr auch etwas, von über Prints meiner festen Modele, bis hin zu etwas selbstgenähtem meiner Modele. Für diejenigen, die aus Leipzig kommen, biete ich dann auch aufregende Shootings an. Genaueres dann. Das geld geht ausschließlich an mich (Happy Berry) 

Was bewirkt ihr?: 

Ihr helft mir besseres Equipment zu bekommen und helft außerdem, dass ich mich verbessere. Happy Berry Photography ist wie gesagt ein Herzensprojekt und bedeutet mir wirklich verdammt viel, jeder Mensch hat träume und ich möchte den Traum real machen, ihr helft uns wirklich wahnsinnig viel mit jeder Spende (meinen festen Modelen und mir). 

Wieso hänge ich so sehr an Happy Berry Photography?

 Die Fotografie faszinierte mich schon sehr lange. Angefangen hat alles mit einigen Bildern für private Angelegenheiten, dann stellte sich das Fotografieren immer mehr in den Vordergrund. So kam es dann, dass ich deutlich öfter eine Linse vor dem Auge hatte. Allerdings empfand ich meine Werke am Anfang als nicht gut und dachte automatisch, dass ich total unbegabt bin, was mir einen Teil meiner Familie auch vermittelte und ich mit dem Hobby alleine da stand.
 Doch meine Faszination an den Bildern ließ mich hart arbeiten. Ich wollte nicht aufgeben, da jeder sagte, ich würde es nicht schaffen sei unbegabt. Darum übte ich weiter, probierte mich auch an Landschaften aus, und einige sparsame Monate später erfüllte ich mir den Wunsch einer (neueren) Spiegelreflexkamera. 
Je weiter ich mich mit der Materie befasste, umso tiefer wurde die Liebe zur Fotografie. Doch nicht nur das einfache "drauf halten und los fotografieren" interessiert mich, sondern auch alles drum herum.
 Für mich geht es auch besonders darum, das perfekte Set zu haben, die richtige Location zu finden, das Model zu beraten und zu stylen – einfach alles um DAS Foto zu bekommen. Ich bin ein offener Mensch. Ich rede gern und gehe auf neue Menschen zu, besonders, wenn ich merke, dass sie eine gewisse Schüchternheit besitzen, die die Arbeit blockieren könnte. Bei mir kannst Du gewiss sein, dass es keine peinliche Stille gibt, sondern es munter vor sich geht. Generell lache ich sehr gern und viel und animiere auch jedes Model dazu es ebenfalls zu tun. Gute Gespräche und einige Lacher erleichtern mir die Arbeit, und lassen jeden entspannen. Zudem lasse ich niemanden im Regen stehen. Vor jedem Shooting mache ich mir über Posen und Mimik Gedanken, damit die Schönheit des Einzelnen auch ans Licht kommt. Nur ein begeisterndes Ergebnis stellt am Ende Dich zufrieden und im Umkehrschluss auch mich. 


Mit viel Willen, Dickköpfigkeit und den Halt meiner Schwiegerfamilie sowie meiner festen Modele, konnte ich das werden was ich jetzt bin... Perfekt bin ich dennoch noch lange nicht, bitte helft mir es zu werden! Auch wenn ihr nichts spenden könnt, könnt ihr es empfehlen und weiter verbreiten. 

Schaut vorbei um weitere bilder zusehen :D

Darum übte ich weiter, probierte mich auch an Landschaften aus, und einige sparsame Monate später erfüllte ich mir den Wunsch einer (neueren) Spiegelreflexkamera. Je weiter ich mich mit der Materie befasste, umso tiefer wurde die Liebe zur Fotografie. Doch nicht nur das einfache "drauf halten und los fotografieren" interessiert mich, sondern auch alles drum herum. Für mich geht es auch besonders darum, das perfekte Set zu haben, die richtige Location zu finden, das Model zu beraten und zu stylen – einfach alles um DAS Foto zu bekommen. Ich bin ein offener Mensch. Ich rede gern und gehe auf neue Menschen zu, besonders, wenn ich merke, dass sie eine gewisse Schüchternheit besitzen, die die Arbeit blockieren könnte. Bei mir kannst Du gewiss sein, dass es keine peinliche Stille gibt, sondern es munter vor sich geht. Generell lache ich sehr gern und viel und animiere auch jedes Model dazu es ebenfalls zu tun. Gute Gespräche und einige Lacher erleichtern mir die Arbeit, und lassen jeden entspannen. Zudem lasse ich niemanden im Regen stehen. Vor jedem Shooting mache ich mir über Posen und Mimik Gedanken, damit die Schönheit des Einzelnen auch ans Licht kommt. Nur ein begeisterndes Ergebnis stellt am Ende Dich zufrieden und im Umkehrschluss auch mich. Mit viel Willen, Dickköpfigkeit und den Halt meiner Schwiegerfamilie sowie meiner festen Modele, konnte ich das werden was ich jetzt bin... Perfekt bin ich dennoch noch lange nicht, bitte helft mir es zu werden! Auch wenn ihr nichts spenden könnt, könnt ihr es empfehlen und weiter verbreiten. Schaut vorbei um weitere bilder zusehen :D

story:
The project:

 

Today I'm sharing for the first time my biggest and most personal project: Estranged. This project is the culmination of a year of planning and production and is now in its final stages of completion. Estranged explores my personal experiences as a foreigner in the city of Paris, far from all family and previous social relationships.

This project is the final step towards my Bachelor of Photography and is the product of everything I've learned and experienced over the last few years in my studies. The series will be exhibited in a gallery setting for my graduation, but also at Paris Photo in November, one of the largest photography fairs in Europe. But to get to that point, I'll need your help!

 

What's the cost and what do you get?

 

I'm an experimental photographer, and this project has allowed me to develop my creative and technical knowledge of the medium to create something that is very special to me. I have taken an old and mostly forgotten photographic process and transposed it into a contemporary setting. Invented in 1850, this process, known as albumen printing, is one of the oldest means of creating a photo. It is a purely analog process involving egg whites and silver to create a lasting image, and every print takes multiple days to produce. After finding and tweaking original chemical formulas, I have since been able to integrate this process in my work. If you'd like to learn more about albumen printing you can visit this link. Otherwise, I'll spare you the details.

The experimentation process has not been cheap however, and now I need your help to finalize the project! There will be eight pieces exhibited, each of them in their own frame. The framing alone will cost 600 euros, and the prints will cost around 400 euros for a total of 1000 euros. In addition to the pieces on the wall, my thesis will be on display along with my portfolio with three other series I have produced. The portfolio has a total production cost of 150 euros plus another 200 euros for the printed thesis.

Any additional funds will be used to reimburse my production costs and allow me to continue making my art as I start my career as a professional photographer!

But don't worry, no matter the donation, you get something in return! Everyone is invited to the exhibition on June 27th in Paris so I can thank you in person, and to see what you've helped create! There are of course various kickbacks that you can see under "perks" as well!

 

 

Other ways you can help:

 

If you can't contribute financially, you can still help! Share this project with all your art loving friends and they can contribute, and even get their own prints!

 

Thank you for taking the time to read about my project, and I hope to see you at the show!

story:
THIS IS

27/4 UPDATE: Everyone on the THIS IS senior team and all the exhibitors have been amazed by your generosity! We thank you for getting us so close to our original target, and you have given us the ability and confidence to set our sights higher.

If funded more than £500 we would able to :

  • Increase the quality and quantity of invites to professionals drastically increasing the chances of each of us meeting someone integral to our growing careers!
  • Focus on PR and marketing to ensure that we equal if not outshining the other courses and universities showing 
  • Allow us to host our guests professionally with refreshments for the warm summer week we are expecting
  • Allow us to get help from knowledgeable professionals such as technicians so there will be less challenges to overcome in the logistics of putting on the show
  • Possibly enable more and higher quality copies of the THIS IS publication 


THIS IS a graduate showcase of the photographic work created by USW's Photography for Fashion and Advertising 2015 graduates. 

THIS IS work that doesn't take itself too seriously but maintains it's industry and commercial quality and abilities. 
THIS IS a showcase of diverse and inspired work, not only photographic but written, filmic and much more. 
THIS IS a graduate show that will be open to all but focused on creative professionals and their industries. 
THIS IS an opportunity for us to gain contacts, knowledge, experience and hopefully employment after three years of hard work!
THIS IS in need of funds to aid our ability to make the show the most professional, enjoyable and beautiful as possible. Contributors would be allowing us to fulfil our potential! 
Funding aid is needed for:
  • Hanging materials 
  • Transporting work from Newport to London
  • PR and marketing materials 
  • Invites to Creative professionals to engage the industry 

THIS IS the show details:
Where: Blackall Studios, Shoreditch, London EC2A 4QS
When: June 11th-13th 2015
Industry Private View: 10th June
If you'd like to help 27 creative students to gain a foothold in creative industries and help us start our lives and careers than please read on.

We are aiming for £500 to help us pay for the above aspects of the show, alongside our own fundraising, personal student contributions and sponsorship efforts.
We would like to raise a minimum of £500 so we may have base access to the aspects described.
Funding Breakdown:

  • £100  -    Hanging materials: Screws, nails, tools etc
  • £100  -    Transport of the work: Van Hire
  • £200 -     PR and marketing: THIS IS logo sign for venue, boards to direct to the venue, posters to show in the surrounding area and any and every bit of publicity we can budget in!
  • £100 -     Invites: Printing and distribution of printed origami invitations hand delivered to the offices of the companies and creatives we love

If we were unable to reach our goal we would be forced to drop integral aspects of the show such as ensuring people come with invites and PR, so we are hoping you can help us make sure that doesn't happen!

THIS IS more than photos on walls. Photography is a freeing and challenging medium that can raise questions, make statements and change not only individuals but the masses too. 
Would that last news event have been as real to you without imagery?
Would you remember your child's smile as well if you had never taken a photo of it?
Would life be as fun if you couldn't explore through fantasy and imagination through media such as film?
We challenge and explore the entire world around us. Please help showcase the work we put into these skills, creativity and there results so that we may be useful, influential and professional creatives.


THIS IS our hope. 
Every exhibiting student in the show has contributed their already strained funds so that we may come together in London and make an impact, but we fear without your help it won't happen.
We are professional and commercially taught, we don't want to do any less than we are capable of. Without your help we will be unable to fulfil ours, or the shows potential and end university, and start our careers with a bang!


THIS IS published.
The University of South Wales has kindly supported us by funding a publication of our graduate work to be available in May at the Atrium campus in Cardiff and our London show in June. This will include work from all the 2015 students exhibiting and those who were unable to participate in the London show. Within this we will be further showing our skills with branding, writing, graphic design and everything else that makes a great magazine!
Within the magazine we are hoping to showcase editorial content of short questions and answers, and twitterviews with all sorts of interesting people so why don't you follow us and get involved online too?

THIS IS sharing:
Please share, follow and promote THIS IS to be truly great!
Twitter: THISISgradshow
Instagram: THISISgradshow
#THISIS

story: I'm riding 545 miles, from San Francisco to Los Angeles to raise money and awareness in the fight against HIV/AIDS. AIDS/LifeCycle 2015 will take place May 31st through June 6th, 2015. All Donations will be Doubled up to $1500 from Salesforce. If you donate over $300 there are limited perks available for photography sessions. Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt: I'm riding 545 miles, from San Francisco to Los Angeles to raise money and awareness in the fight against HIV/AIDS. AIDS/LifeCycle 2015 will take place May 31st through June 6th, 2015. All Donations will be Doubled up to $1500 from Salesforce. If you donate over $300 there are limited perks available for photography sessions. Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Second Added Incentive for People to Support the Project

As an incentive for people to sponsor our compaign, Tomboy Tailors will send everyone who contributes at $25 or above, a coupon for $25 off a purchase at Tomboy Tailors.

If you like this business idea, please help us by supporting us.  If you provide us with a $25 donation, you will receive both a listing as a sponsor in the book and a coupon for $25 off of a purchase at Tomboy Tailors. You are in essence, providing us with a short-term bridge loan and helping support the first company in the United States to open a brick-and-mortar tailored clothing store that caters to lesbians and trans-masculine individuals.

If you contribute at a level below $25, we will send you a coupon for $25 off of your first purchase of $50 or more.

Please help us break down binary expectations for what people should wear. We as people are diverse and our options for clothing should be diverse as well.

First Added Incentive for People to Support the Project

Please be sure to see the details below about our Tomboy Tailors’ Company Tag Line Contest

All eligible submissions will be entered into the Tomboy Tailors' Company Tag Line contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's 2013 Pride Parade.  (See photo in gallery area).

ALL who contribute to this Indiegogo campaign at $7 or more will receive an email after the close of the Indiegogo campaign with a link where contributors can suggest a company Tag Line for Tomboy Tailors.  All eligible submissions will be entered into a contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's Pride Parade of 2013. See official rules in the gallery area. 

Who are we?

Tomboy Tailors is a fine clothier specializing in custom-made suits and shirts of the finest quality that are bespoke-tailored (made-to-measure for you) in the material, cut and fit that you want.

Our customers are butch/boi lesbians, trans-masculine individuals, and women and men of any identity who have a strong sense of self-expression and like to wear fine custom-made clothing.  We specialize in made-to-measure men's and women's suits and dress shirts and bring our clients bespoke tailor expertise and service.

Our vision is to provide everyone with a place where they can be themselves and experience excellent service, style, and quality. We also offer accessories and men’s shoes in a variety of sizes.

Our retail store, located in San Francisco, will be opening on February 2, 2013!

The store will be located in the Financial District of San Francisco just a few blocks from Union Square.

Our online store will be opening in approximately March 15, 2013.

What is Tomboy Dapper?

To help fund the company and celebrate dapper tomboys. To help fund our startup ANDcelebrate the 'dapper tomboy look, we are publishing a photography book, entitled Tomboy Dapper (working title), showcasing photos of butch/boi lesbians, trans-masculine individuals, and women of all stripes who show the style of donning menswear or masculine-of-center womenswear.

About 200 photographers will be partnering with us to photograph tomboys from all around the country in Tomboy Tailors' dapper styles.

What We Need

WE NEED YOUR HELP as we work to create a tailored clothing company that makes butch lesbians and trans-masculine individuals and all people feel welcome and appreciated. Your contribution will help Tomboy Tailors grow and through the book project, your contribution will help ensure more positive images of lesbians and transmasculine individuals in the society-at-large.

What You Get

Related to the book and Tomboy Tailors, we are creating an annual calendar, a seriously fun Tomboy Tailor match box, and the Tomboy Dapper book.

For $7, you will receive a eye-catching Tomboy Tailors match box perfect for your fireplace mantel. We love great looking legs!  - See a photo of our match boxes in the gallery area of this campaign.  

For $25, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper - a limited edition, hard-bound book.

For $50, you will be listed as a Change Innovator in Tomboy Dapper. You will also receive two Tomboy Tailors match boxes.

For $75, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper - a limited edition, hard-bound book AND you will receive a copy of the book.

For $250, you will be listed as a Change Innovator Sponsor in Tomboy Dapper -  AND you will receive a copy of the book. You will also receive one Tomboy Tailors match box, AND two tickets to the Tomboy Dapper Book Opening Cocktail Party which will take place in San Francisco, California or the Napa Valley area in October of 2013. 

As an incentive for people to sponsor our compaign, Tomboy Tailors will send everyone who contributes at $25 or above (including people who have already made a contribution), a coupon for $25 off a purchase at Tomboy Tailors.

If you like this business idea, please help us by supporting us.  If you provide us with a $25 donation, you will receive both a listing as a sponsor in the book and a coupon for $25 off of a purchase at Tomboy Tailors. You are in essence, providing us with a short-term bridge loan and helping support the first company in the United States to open brick-and-mortar tailored clothing store that caters to lesbians and trans-masculine individuals.

If you contribute at a level below $25, we will send you a coupon for $25 off of your first purchase of $50 or more.

Please help us break down binary expectations for what people should wear. We as people are diverse and our options for clothing should be diverse as well.

Frequently Asked Questions

See the gallery area for a document answering Frequently Asked Questions about this campaign.

Who are the Team Members of Tomboy Tailors

Tomboy Tailors currently has three employees. You can see information about Zel, Emma and Catherine within the Frequently Asked Questions document that is part of the gallary area of this campaign.

Our Contest - Take One Extra Step to Enter to Win a Dashing Ensemble in our Contest!

ALL who contribute to this Indiegogo campaign at $7 or more will receive an email after the close of the Indiegogo campaign with a link where contributors can suggest a Tag Line for Tomboy Tailors. 

All eligible submissions will be entered into the Tomboy Tailors' Company Tag Line contest where one winner will be selected to receive a custom-made suit, dress shirt, and bow-tie (total value $2,000). The lucky winner will also have the option to wear their outfit while riding a motorcycle side-car rig in San Francisco's 2013 Pride Parade.

Entries must be received by January 26, 2013 and will be judged by Tomboy Tailors' staff members. The winner will be announced at our opening party for the retail store on February 2, 2013. The winner's name will also be posted on our website by February 8, 2013.  See official rules in the gallery area.

The Impact

About 200 photographers will be partnering with us to photograph tomboys from all around the country in Tomboy Tailors' dapper styles.

Tomboy Tailors is one of the very few tailored clothing companies in the world that puts butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals as their VIP clients. We will be providing suits for men and women as well, but with such few options, we really want butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals to know that they are welcome in our store.

Not only will your contribution help support this much-needed and hard-to-find niche, but sponsors who contribute $75 or more will also receive a copy of the book, the final product of which is sure to be a prized possession.

Lastly, your contribution will ensure more positive images of lesbians and transmasculine individuals in society at large. We encourage you to help us make that happen by supporting this project and the team at Tomboy Tailors.

Tomboy Tailors thanks you for your contribution and support!

Tomboy Tailors is one of the very few tailored clothing companies in the world that puts butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals as their VIP clients. We will be providing suits for men and women as well, but with such few options, we really want butch lesbians and transmasculine individuals to know that they are welcome in our store.
Not only will your contribution help support this much-needed and hard-to-find niche, but sponsors who contribute $75 or more will also receive a copy of the book, the final product of which is sure to be a prized possession.
Lastly, your contribution will ensure more positive images of lesbians and transmasculine individuals in society at large. We encourage you to help us make that happen by supporting this project and the team at Tomboy Tailors.


Tomboy Tailors thanks you for your contribution and support!

story:
Photography for Good: South Africa.

I am a photographer and flight attendant extraordinaire, calling San Francisco home for 10 years now.  Last year, while volunteering in Africa via Virgin Unite, I dreamed up a project that now I get to realize.  I love portrait photography, and I love using photography to give back.  I am combining the two in order to make an impact in the community of Dumphries that surrounds Richard Branson's game reserve, Ulusaba. 

My project is to teach the elements of the camera so that people can express themselves through taking photos, both of their environment and the people in their lives.  We will curate a gallery of their photographs to display at their community center that visitors from the Ulusaba Lodge are invited to view and purchase.  These funds will feed directly back into their community to help provide needed services, food, and education.  At the same time, I will be taking portraits of these new artists, which I will curate into a show back here in San Francisco.  The show will consist of their portraits along side the photos they took, and a short story about what the photo means to them.  

My dream is to connect with people through photography, and then to teach them how to connect with their world through art.  

By contributing to this campaign, you are impacting a village of over 5,000 people who are eager to learn ways in which they can help themselves and be empowered.  They see cameras quite often, when people come to visit, but they have never taken a photo, or had a print to hold in their hands.  I am looking forward most to the stories they will tell me of what this means to them, and why they love the photo they took... 

What I Need, and What You Get.

The funds I raise will go towards travel expenses getting to and from Ulusaba (I will be flying SF>Washington DC>Johannesburg, and then taking a bus for 8 hours to the village).  Expenses will also cover the costs of curating the shows, both in Ulusaba and in San Francisco: Supplies, editing tools, space, printing, frames, web gallery, and production.  

Each person who contributes will be given a print of their choice from the web gallery, where all photos will be posted digitally.  

Other Ways To Contribute..

Know anyone with old cameras lying around?  Even iphones?  Small thumb drives or memory cards (cf cards) that you or your friends are not using anymore?  Do you know of someone or someplace in SF that likes to offer their space for gallery shows or fundraisers?  Can you contribute beverages or food for the opening in March?  Any other ideas to contribute?  Send them along!

story:
Who are we?

We are bunch of tech savvy software developers. After many years of creating mobile apps for other people we decided to start our own company called matchUsolutions. Our first goal is to finish and release matchUpicture app on iOS and Android platforms.

Revolution in photography

You've uploaded tons of photos online but all you get in return are only likes and comments? It's time to change it with our mobile gaming app. With matchUpicture you can improve your decoding skills, show your artistic imagination, have a lot fun and most of all - make profit of your photography skills. Thanks to carefully selected categories, everyone from a child to an old man will get to know the world of animals, nature, interesting places, sport, fashion and many more.

We hope that matchUpicture will have great impact on photography. Imagine that you can win real prizes simply by uploading photos. Please take a look at our quick tutorial below and you will see how things work:

 

How much users can win?

You probably wonder what's in there for you. We did run lots of simulations to get the numbers and please note, there are many variables in this equation like revenue from ads providers, frequency of games played, number of players etc.

The statistical chance to win a single game is always 1/64 for every user. Of course it depends on how good your imagination is and how the other users will vote.

We estimated that winning a regular(free) game will be worth 100 coins, and winning a premium game - 500 coins.  You can get one diamond (required to play premium game) for only 100 coins or 0,5$. Users can actually create their own secret photo and description suggestions, if we like your work you will be rewarded with extra 50 coins. Gathered coins can be exchanged on rewards like Amazon vouchers and PayPal money transfers with values listed below:

  • 5$ for 350 coins
  • 10$ for 500 coins
  • 25$ for 800 coins
  • 50$ for 1200 coins
  • 100$ for 1700 coins

You can grab cheapest one worth 5$ for 350 coins. Winning one premium game will be enough to get instantly 10$ worth prize (for 500 coins). Of course you can always choose more than one reward at a time.

We still want to run beta tests to make sure that those calculations are correct. We really want users to be satisfied with their winnings.

It's easy to forget about taxes so when you collect reward - we pay taxes and shipment cost for you. Feel free to dive into detailed rules here

Why crowdfunding?

We are really close to finish development stage - our apps and backend are completed in 65%. However, the whole project won't work without players, so we plan to spend all funds from this campaign on marketing and rewards. According to our calculations, after first month the whole service should be able to maintain itself without outside funding.

We also think that great community of Indiegogo will help us to make key decisions about app itself and all numbers mentioned before. That's why we plan to release beta version to all contributors and gather their precious opinion before live launch. We are very flexible and if people will ask us to implement new features or even new game modes, we'll be happy to do that.

The schedule

Honestly, we can't wait to see matchUpicture in hands of players, so we want to release live version before the end of March 2018. If this campaign turns out to be successful and the goal is reached - that's a message to us that everything is correct and we can start promotion of apps on a vast scale.

Beta tests will start in second half of February. We hope that all backers will be eager to take part in this stage. 

First release will take place in following countries: all EU member states, USA, Canada, Australia, Switzerland, and Norway but we hope to make it global someday. 

Perks

We want to show our gratitude to contributors so we've prepared few cool perks for you. Choose whatever you want and help us finish matchUpicture.

Let the best match win!

We hope that you like our ideas and extraordinary design of matchUpicture. If you do, then please share this campaign. It's all about promotion - the more people hear about us the more people will play. More players means that we get better deals with ads providers and therefore we can afford more expensive rewards for you.

We hope to see you soon in matchUpicture.

story:
UPDATE: THE BOOK HAS BEEN PRINTED! 

Orders are now being shipped as they come in. Thank you all so much for your patience.

 

The Book

The Overland book is 146 pages sized at 24x30cm, printed on premium quality 100% PCW recycled papers. Starting with an introduction to the Silk Road and a map of our Journey, Overland; Through the Middle of the World takes you through a visual journey of Central Asia, aided by seldom told stories of culture and history.

The Story

In an old dusty Georgian car market, my brother and I found ourselves negotiating over a beat up Mitsubishi Pajero with two decades worth of dents and scratches. It had a broken door, no air-con, and a quarter million kilometers to it's name. It was perfect, we knew it would take us exactly where we needed to go. Over the next three months, we would drive Caspar 11,942 kilometers, venturing deep into the forgotten lands of Karakalpakstan, traversing some of the world's highest roads in the Pamir Mountains, and crossing the largest inland body of water, the Caspian Sea (the namesake of our car).

For many (myself included), Central Asia is just a large area on the map full of places you're not sure how to pronounce. A century of Soviet occupation cast the region in a shroud of secrecy, which since the fall of the Iron Curtain, has scarcely been lifted. The surprising reality is that for much of human history, the region was considered the center of civilization, consisting of trade routes threading their way from Europe to China. Overland; Through the Middle of the World, will take the reader on a visual journey across these almost forgotten lands. This large format coffee table book is an exploration of the culture, nature, and history of the people and places that range from Istanbul in Turkey, all the way through to the far reaches of Inner Kyrgyzstan.

 
 
One of the main stylistic intentions of Overland is to draw aesthetic similarities across vastly differing subject matter, exposing parallels grounded in the universally shared human experience.
 
 
Along with history and culture, Overland draws from the stories of the people to immerse the reader deeper into the landscape. Such is the case with our time spent with K, a shepherd of the sparsely populated Ustyurt Plateau of Western Kazakhstan. Known to be one of the least hospitable environments on the planet, temperature swings of up to 100°C have been recorded between summer and winter months.
 
 
Or the stories of the people of Bulunkul. A town of 306 that has long survived nestled in the High Pamirs. Affectionately known as Central Asia's coldest town, they own little more than yaks, yet require nothing else to thrive in an environment of absolute extremes.
 
 
In between these stories, Overland will be filled with landscape focused photography that has been created in a minimalist, yet dynamic style with the intention that each photograph will magnify the emotions drawn from the subject.
 
 
 

 

 

Extra Video Content!

If you're interested in seeing a little more of what will come in the book, I created short videos of each chapter of our journey. The video below is part 3, which goes from Western Kazahkstan through all of Uzbekistan. Click the links below to check out the other five chapters.

 

If you'd like to see some more of my photos, have a scroll through my Instagram page, or browse my Website!

Risks and challenges

There are 3 stages of risk / challenge that come along with a project like this.

1. Gathering the required content to create the book.
- This stage has already been completed, so there are no longer any risk / challenges involved here.

2. Designing a quality book
- In order to fully do justice to this project, I have given myself a 6 month period of working full time to bring this project to it's full potential.

3. Printing the book
- As far as this challenge goes, high print fidelity and total quality control are the goals. For this I have total confidence that my choice in printers (Magnum Offset Printing) will deliver beyond expectations in every facet involved. Just as they have been doing for over 30 years with a massive range of printing products.
