story:
UPDATE 4/12/2021: Books purchased after December 2 (and UK orders placed between Oct 28-Mar 17) were shipped mid-late March. If you haven’t yet received your copy, it should arrive very soon! Books ordered after March 17 will be shipped within the next 2 weeks. Thank you for your support and patience.

As we say goodbye on Indiegogo, we wanted to let you know that we now have plenty of purchasing options through our We Animals Media HIDDEN webpage, including our newly released HIDDEN E-Book. 

See the "Updates" tab above for our latest updates and news.

 

UPDATE 12/2/2020: We officially released HIDDEN on November 17th, 2020 and are now sold out of the first print run! We are thrilled to know that people think this book is timely and important, and that it's reaching so many of you! We’ve shared an update, including details of our announcement of a second print run. See the "Updates" tab above for our most recent information and shipping timelines.

-------------

HIDDEN: Animals in the Anthropocene is an unflinching book of photography about our conflict with non-human animals around the globe. Through the lenses of forty award-winning photojournalists, HIDDEN shines a light on the invisible animals in our lives; those with whom we have a close relationship and yet fail to see. They are the animals we eat and wear. The animals we use for research, work, and for entertainment, as well as the animals we sacrifice in the name of tradition and religion. HIDDEN is a historical document, a memorial, and an indictment of what is and should never again be.  HIDDEN needs to be seen by as many people as possible, and this can only happen with your support. ​

Thank you for visiting our crowdfunding page. I’m Jo-Anne McArthur, a Canadian photojournalist as well as the founder of We Animals Media (WAM). My vision for this ground-breaking new book was inspired by the war photography that has shaped history. Images of conflict and suffering have always played a crucial role in exposing atrocities and galvanizing the masses. In her book Regarding the Pain of Others, political activist Susan Sontag asks who should look at suffering? When is it useful to do so? The answer is that anyone who can help should look, and that is all of us. Billions of animals suffer needlessly each day within the constructs we’ve built. We believe that the time to bear witness is now. Will you help animals by joining us to get these images seen?​



          

 

OUR TEAM

The strength of this book is in its team. HIDDEN features the work of forty award-winning photographers who have defied the odds to capture the most poignant and iconic images from animal industries around the world. Joining the We Animals Media team and I in the creation of HIDDEN is acclaimed photo editor and journalist Keith Wilson, as well as world-renowned designer David Griffin. Keith is a Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society and the founder and past editor of Outdoor Photography and Wild Planet magazines. He has interviewed the best-known photographers of our time. This will be his ninth co-produced book. David was the visuals editor of The Washington Post, director of photography of National Geographic, and has held many other design and photography positions in the media. Joining our team in colour editing is the co-editor of Photographers Against Wildlife Crime, photographer Britta Jaschinski, and Sarah Janson joins us as our intrepid project manager. We are also honoured that the book’s foreword will be written by none other than longtime vegan animal rights advocate, Joaquin Phoenix. We Animals Media will publish HIDDEN.





OUR PHOTOGRAPHERS

HIDDEN represents the work of forty photojournalists who have - and continue to - document animal stories. These photographers are the heroes who work globally to investigate and expose animal use. Their exhaustive and in depth work has resulted in some of the most compelling and historic images of animals that we have seen. Among them are (in alphabetical order): Aaron Gekoski, Aitor Garmendia, Amy Jones, Andrew Skowron, Britta Jaschinski, Daniel Beltrá, Francesco Pistilli, Jan van IJken, Joan de la Malla, Jo-Anne McArthur, Jose Valle, Kelly Guerin, Kristo Muurimaa, Konrad Lozinski, Louise Jorgensen, Luis Tato, Paul Hilton, Sabine Grootendorst, Selene Magnolia, Stefano Belacchi, Tamara Kenneally and Timo Stammberger.

The work of our contributors has been celebrated by Wildlife Photographer of the Year, Nature Photographer of the Year, Festival della Fotographia Etica, Alfred Fried Peace Award, the Wildlife Conservation Film Festival, World Press Photo, NPPA’s Best of Photojournalism, Sony World Photography Awards, Picture of the Year International, Latin International Photography Award, DAYS Japan, and Prix de la Photographie.

Our photographers have also been published in and interviewed by publications such as National Geographic, GEO, BBC Discover Wildlife, The Guardian, CNN, Telegraph, New Scientist, Newsweek, The Sunday Times, Nikon Pro, Black+White Photography, Vice, La Repubblica and The Washington Post. Additionally, their work has been used in animal advocacy campaigns worldwide.

 



 

SUPPORTING THIS HISTORIC BOOK

Your support will make this epic undertaking a reality. We say “epic” because we are producing a tome, heavy in content and actual weight. At 320 pages, 9.5 x 12.5in and hard cover, this is a 5lb book which goes to print in Italy on September 7th, 2020.

NOTEWORTHY BOOK SPECS:

  • Portrait Format - Dimension 320x240 mm - 12.6" x 9.5"
  • 320 pages
  • 204 historic images
  • 4-colour printing
  • 3 gatefold spreads
  • Hard cover + foil stamping & debossing
  • Printed on sustainably sourced paper
  • Collectible limited edition


When you purchase your copy of HIDDEN or one of our perks, you’ll be helping us to reach our crowdfunding goal of $65,000 CAD. Our funding tiers start with the purchase of one book and end with opportunities to become Publishing Partners.

Our costs include: 

  • Printing! We will be printing 1500 copies of this hard cover first edition
  • An honorarium to each contributing photographer, which will help keep them in the field, doing this important work that is often unpaid, and executed at great personal risk
  • The purchase of archival images
  • Book shipping and environmentally friendly packaging  – at 5lbs, shipping is going to be a big expense!
  • Distribution
  • Advertising and PR
  • Travel costs and overhead for conferences to present the book globally in 2021
  • The people working on this book: the time of the co-editors, the designer, the colour editor, the project manager, as well as the We Animals Media team working on design, copy, social media, and video production for this book.
     

HIDDEN will be published by We Animals Media. As a result, any profit from HIDDEN will go directly into funding animal photojournalism and continuing to build our We Animals Archive, which makes images freely available to anyone helping animals.

OUR INAUGURAL PUBLISHING PARTNERS

We gratefully recognize the partners who have supported HIDDEN with funding leading up to our crowdfunding campaign. 

Animals Australia is our first Senior Publishing Partner. This generous donation contributes specifically  to the very practical reality of book-making: distribution, fulfillment, and shipping, helping us to deliver these 5lb books around the world. 

Animal Equality, Anima International, Stephane Perrais, and Leila Boujnane are Founding Supporters. Their generous donation helps us to cover the extensive start-up costs of creating this historic book.

Casey Fisher is a Patron to the Photographers. Patrons help provide each contributing photographer with a larger honorarium for their contributions to this book.

We're tremendously grateful to these long time friends of Jo-Anne and We Animals Media! Please see our perks if you'd like to become a Publishing Partner.


 


Your investment in this book through our crowdfunding campaign is your stamp of support and solidarity with our vision to help make visible the stories of animals and create a kinder world for all. The stories within its pages are revelatory and brutal. They are proof of the emergency confronting animals globally, from industrial farming to climate change, and provide valuable insight into the relevance of animal suffering to human health. With the current Coronavirus pandemic wreaking havoc, never has a book been more relevant to the future of all animals, human and non-human alike. HIDDEN will help propel us into a new era of (re)considering our relationship with animals.

PROJECT IMPACT

The animals you will meet in this book are important, and the documentation of their lives is one crucial piece of the puzzle when it comes to animal justice. HIDDEN serves as a document that gives credibility to the coverage of its subject matter. Painful and graphic images are often overlooked by mainstream media, and they need a home that won’t disappear in the frenzy of social media or the daily news. HIDDEN creates historic representation, and we will make sure the the book will reach changemakers in the world of journalism, policy, and campaigning.


 

We Animals Media’s previous crowdfunding campaigns have proven successful, each exceeding our goals, bringing our powerful books, We Animals (2014), and Captive (2017) to life. We hope you'll watch the video we’ve made, pre-order your copy of HIDDEN, and share this campaign. In doing so, you will be helping us produce, print, and distribute this hardcover first edition of HIDDEN. The book will retail for $95, which means you are receiving a $17 discount as an initial funder, and an even greater discount on the purchase of multiple copies.

Only with your support can HIDDEN become a positive turning point in the campaign to redefine humankind’s relationship with their fellow animals. A future that consigns animal suffering to the past.

Thank you for your continued support!

With gratitude and resilience,

Jo, Keith, and the We Animals Media team


P.S. Please help us make some noise about this campaign by sharing it far and wide!

P.P.S. Please make sure to select your perk; don't just hit the pink "back it" button unless you only want to donate toward the project. Thank you!

We are thrilled to know that people think this book is timely and important, and that it's reaching so many of you! We’ve shared an update, including details of our announcement of a second print run. See the "Updates" tab above for our most recent information and shipping timelines.-------------HIDDEN: Animals in the Anthropocene is an unflinching book of photography about our conflict with non-human animals around the globe. Through the lenses of forty award-winning photojournalists, HIDDEN shines a light on the invisible animals in our lives; those with whom we have a close relationship and yet fail to see. They are the animals we eat and wear. The animals we use for research, work, and for entertainment, as well as the animals we sacrifice in the name of tradition and religion. HIDDEN is a historical document, a memorial, and an indictment of what is and should never again be.  HIDDEN needs to be seen by as many people as possible, and this can only happen with your support. ​Thank you for visiting our crowdfunding page. I’m Jo-Anne McArthur, a Canadian photojournalist as well as the founder of We Animals Media (WAM). My vision for this ground-breaking new book was inspired by the war photography that has shaped history. Images of conflict and suffering have always played a crucial role in exposing atrocities and galvanizing the masses. In her book Regarding the Pain of Others, political activist Susan Sontag asks who should look at suffering? When is it useful to do so? The answer is that anyone who can help should look, and that is all of us. Billions of animals suffer needlessly each day within the constructs we’ve built. We believe that the time to bear witness is now. Will you help animals by joining us to get these images seen?​           OUR TEAMThe strength of this book is in its team. HIDDEN features the work of forty award-winning photographers who have defied the odds to capture the most poignant and iconic images from animal industries around the world. Joining the We Animals Media team and I in the creation of HIDDEN is acclaimed photo editor and journalist Keith Wilson, as well as world-renowned designer David Griffin. Keith is a Fellow of the Royal Geographical Society and the founder and past editor of Outdoor Photography and Wild Planet magazines. He has interviewed the best-known photographers of our time. This will be his ninth co-produced book. David was the visuals editor of The Washington Post, director of photography of National Geographic, and has held many other design and photography positions in the media. Joining our team in colour editing is the co-editor of Photographers Against Wildlife Crime, photographer Britta Jaschinski, and Sarah Janson joins us as our intrepid project manager. We are also honoured that the book’s foreword will be written by none other than longtime vegan animal rights advocate, Joaquin Phoenix. We Animals Media will publish HIDDEN.OUR PHOTOGRAPHERSHIDDEN represents the work of forty photojournalists who have - and continue to - document animal stories. These photographers are the heroes who work globally to investigate and expose animal use. Their exhaustive and in depth work has resulted in some of the most compelling and historic images of animals that we have seen. Among them are (in alphabetical order): Aaron Gekoski, Aitor Garmendia, Amy Jones, Andrew Skowron, Britta Jaschinski, Daniel Beltrá, Francesco Pistilli, Jan van IJken, Joan de la Malla, Jo-Anne McArthur, Jose Valle, Kelly Guerin, Kristo Muurimaa, Konrad Lozinski, Louise Jorgensen, Luis Tato, Paul Hilton, Sabine Grootendorst, Selene Magnolia, Stefano Belacchi, Tamara Kenneally and Timo Stammberger.The work of our contributors has been celebrated by Wildlife Photographer of the Year, Nature Photographer of the Year, Festival della Fotographia Etica, Alfred Fried Peace Award, the Wildlife Conservation Film Festival, World Press Photo, NPPA’s Best of Photojournalism, Sony World Photography Awards, Picture of the Year International, Latin International Photography Award, DAYS Japan, and Prix de la Photographie.Our photographers have also been published in and interviewed by publications such as National Geographic, GEO, BBC Discover Wildlife, The Guardian, CNN, Telegraph, New Scientist, Newsweek, The Sunday Times, Nikon Pro, Black+White Photography, Vice, La Repubblica and The Washington Post. Additionally, their work has been used in animal advocacy campaigns worldwide.  SUPPORTING THIS HISTORIC BOOKYour support will make this epic undertaking a reality. We say “epic” because we are producing a tome, heavy in content and actual weight. At 320 pages, 9.5 x 12.5in and hard cover, this is a 5lb book which goes to print in Italy on September 7th, 2020.NOTEWORTHY BOOK SPECS:
Portrait Format - Dimension 320x240 mm - 12.6" x 9.5"
320 pages
204 historic images
4-colour printing
3 gatefold spreads
Hard cover + foil stamping & debossing
Printed on sustainably sourced paper
Collectible limited edition
When you purchase your copy of HIDDEN or one of our perks, you’ll be helping us to reach our crowdfunding goal of $65,000 CAD. Our funding tiers start with the purchase of one book and end with opportunities to become Publishing Partners.Our costs include: 
Printing! We will be printing 1500 copies of this hard cover first edition
An honorarium to each contributing photographer, which will help keep them in the field, doing this important work that is often unpaid, and executed at great personal risk
The purchase of archival images
Book shipping and environmentally friendly packaging  – at 5lbs, shipping is going to be a big expense!
Distribution
Advertising and PR
Travel costs and overhead for conferences to present the book globally in 2021
The people working on this book: the time of the co-editors, the designer, the colour editor, the project manager, as well as the We Animals Media team working on design, copy, social media, and video production for this book. 
HIDDEN will be published by We Animals Media. As a result, any profit from HIDDEN will go directly into funding animal photojournalism and continuing to build our We Animals Archive, which makes images freely available to anyone helping animals.OUR INAUGURAL PUBLISHING PARTNERSWe gratefully recognize the partners who have supported HIDDEN with funding leading up to our crowdfunding campaign. Animals Australia is our first Senior Publishing Partner. This generous donation contributes specifically  to the very practical reality of book-making: distribution, fulfillment, and shipping, helping us to deliver these 5lb books around the world. Animal Equality, Anima International, Stephane Perrais, and Leila Boujnane are Founding Supporters. Their generous donation helps us to cover the extensive start-up costs of creating this historic book.Casey Fisher is a Patron to the Photographers. Patrons help provide each contributing photographer with a larger honorarium for their contributions to this book.We're tremendously grateful to these long time friends of Jo-Anne and We Animals Media! Please see our perks if you'd like to become a Publishing Partner. Your investment in this book through our crowdfunding campaign is your stamp of support and solidarity with our vision to help make visible the stories of animals and create a kinder world for all. The stories within its pages are revelatory and brutal. They are proof of the emergency confronting animals globally, from industrial farming to climate change, and provide valuable insight into the relevance of animal suffering to human health. With the current Coronavirus pandemic wreaking havoc, never has a book been more relevant to the future of all animals, human and non-human alike. HIDDEN will help propel us into a new era of (re)considering our relationship with animals.PROJECT IMPACTThe animals you will meet in this book are important, and the documentation of their lives is one crucial piece of the puzzle when it comes to animal justice. HIDDEN serves as a document that gives credibility to the coverage of its subject matter. Painful and graphic images are often overlooked by mainstream media, and they need a home that won’t disappear in the frenzy of social media or the daily news. HIDDEN creates historic representation, and we will make sure the the book will reach changemakers in the world of journalism, policy, and campaigning. We Animals Media’s previous crowdfunding campaigns have proven successful, each exceeding our goals, bringing our powerful books, We Animals (2014), and Captive (2017) to life. We hope you'll watch the video we’ve made, pre-order your copy of HIDDEN, and share this campaign. In doing so, you will be helping us produce, print, and distribute this hardcover first edition of HIDDEN. The book will retail for $95, which means you are receiving a $17 discount as an initial funder, and an even greater discount on the purchase of multiple copies.Only with your support can HIDDEN become a positive turning point in the campaign to redefine humankind’s relationship with their fellow animals. A future that consigns animal suffering to the past.Thank you for your continued support!With gratitude and resilience,Jo, Keith, and the We Animals Media teamP.S. Please help us make some noise about this campaign by sharing it far and wide!P.P.S. Please make sure to select your perk; don't just hit the pink "back it" button unless you only want to donate toward the project. Thank you!

story:
Die Angst 3

 

This is the 3rd year of Die Angst Magazine.

A platform for emerging photographers, drawers, comic artists and grafic designers. And especially for completely newcomers. 

Die Angst is to 100% independent.  Everything is paid without a sponsor and for this reason I need your help to cover the ridiculous high shipping costs to achieve a +- 0 balance.

 

Participants of this years volume are:

agnes_tanuki | ashley_comer | dan_younger | dana_stirling | giacomo_fierro | guillaume_roumeguere | henriette_heimdal | hüseyin_çifel | judith_hornbogen | katlijn_blanchaert | kelly_ann_mitchell

 

leonardo_magrelli | lise_straatsma | michele_di_donato | miguel_núñez_acera | moira_ness | nick_thompson | philip_persson | sandrine_hermand_grisel | sergey_melnitchenko

 

500 Copies
297 x 210 mm

 

THANK YOU!

story:
english below

conhecer um corpo é um livro que fala da intimidade dos corpos, do processo de autoconhecimento e de aprendizagem do eu a partir do outro. O processo fotográfico decorreu entre 2017 e 2019, mas só este ano evoluiu para um objecto com um sentido e uma intenção mais apurados. Nesse sentido, a construção deste livro partiu de um regresso ao meu arquivo para encontrar uma linha narrativa intencional que permeasse nas fotografias feitas durante esse tempo. De entre mais de duas mil fotografias, a escolha recaiu em cerca de cinquenta, que comunicam entre si uma ideia melancólica da procura da minha identidade através dos corpos e dos lugares que experimentei. Assim nasce conhecer um corpo.

 

A série

“‘But most of the time—most of the time I made love only with the body.’
‘That can make one very lonely,’ I said.”
                          Giovanni’s Room, James Baldwin

Entre 2017 e 2019, tomei o hábito de pegar no meu carro e conduzir pelo país fora com uma certa frequência. Queria explorar Portugal, conhecer novas pessoas e novos sítios, queria escapar a minha própria solidão com o movimento, a estrada a passar por debaixo do meu carro. Levei a minha câmara fotográfica 35mm comigo e procurei paisagens que me atraíam, lugares que me chamavam a atenção, pessoas que me despertavam o interesse. E fotografei-os. Fotografei o mar, fotografei a terra, fotografei as cidades e as ruas, fotografei os rostos e os corpos, os corpos vestidos e despidos, parados e em movimento. Deixei-me vencer a minha dificuldade em falar com estranhos e deixaram de o ser. Abriram-se para a minha câmara, para o meu olhar, deixaram-se ser fotografados, explorados pela representação, tentados pelo desejo. E durante a procura do outro e de mais, gostava de dizer que me tinha encontrado a mim próprio; mas acho que isso não aconteceu. Foram precisos mais dois anos para perceber isso, foi preciso encontrar-me para perceber que isso ainda não tinha acontecido. Nesse sentido, olhei para trás, para as imagens que fiz nesses anos e seleccionei as que melhor comunicavam essa procura, a melancolia da exploração, do autoconhecimento, dos corpos dos outros em direcção ao meu corpo e à minha identidade. Uma colecção de imagens em que procuro nos corpos conhecer um corpo, o meu corpo.

 

Quem eu sou

Nasci em Ovar, em 1992, e sou um artista que trabalha no cruzamento entre o cinema, a fotografia, a música e as media arts. Sou licenciado em Cinema e Audiovisual pela Escola Superior Artística do Porto (2013) e frequento o Mestrado em Fotografia na Escola das Artes da Universidade Católica Portuguesa. Vivo em Braga.

O meu trabalho cruza diferentes disciplinas artísticas, utilizando as potencialidades que cada uma oferece, de forma a enriquecer as ideias e os conceitos propostos. Sou autor de dois filmes curtos de ensaio-ficção premiados e de um filme experimental. Na música, lancei discos como Tundra Fault, um projecto de música electrónica que entretanto terminei, do qual também fui autor dos vídeos musicais; e crio música ao vivo para performances e espectáculos. Na fotografia, sou autor do projecto fotográfico A Body of Land, que esteve exposto em várias ocasiões.

Já fui convidado para fazer parte do júri de festivais e para leccionar formações e workshops. Colaboro com artistas de várias áreas, como Daniel Seabra, Maria Trabulo, Antonio da Silva, Dora Vieira, David Machado, Distorted Vision e Rui P. Andrade.

 

O livro e as recompensas

Este livro é a forma que encontrei de colocar este trabalho nas tuas mãos, para lá do digital e das redes sociais. Acredito no poder do objecto físico enquanto meio de apreciação da arte, pelo que me pareceu evidente que o passo seguinte a ter uma série pronta seria publicá-la. Para isso, conto contigo e a tua contribuição neste crowdfunding. Todos os livros e prints adquiridos serão feitos e entregues mesmo se não atingirmos o objectivo deste crowdfunding, portanto não existe o risco de não teres o teu exemplar garantido.

Existem várias coisas que podes adquirir neste crowdfunding:

 

Prints

Os prints são fotografias impressas em papel fotográfico premium semi-mate, nas dimensões 15x20cm, que inclui uma margem branca a toda a volta. Todos os prints serão assinados por mim no verso. As imagens disponíveis são as que se seguem, sendo que quando escolheres as recompensas, deves explicitar qual ou quais os números das imagens pretendes. Nos updates deste crowdfunding podes ver as fotografias com mais detalhe.

 

Livro

O livro é a estrela deste crowdfunding, claro. Tem dimensões 20x25cm, 92 páginas, com 47 fotografias. A edição standard do livro será de capa mole, com o miolo em papel semi-mate.

 

Edição Especial do Livro e Prints em Fine Art

Para além da edição standard, existirá uma edição especial limitada. Esta edição será em capa dura, do mesmo tamanho, e será numerada e assinada. Esta edição existirá apenas neste crowdfunding, não podendo ser adquirido depois dele terminar. O número de livros desta edição especial será o número da única tiragem que será feita, pelo que se adquirires esta versão, terás um exemplar único de uma edição muitíssimo limitada. Com este livro, tens também a possibilidade de lhe juntares 2, 5 ou 10 prints 15x20cm, também eles numa edição especial limitada: serão os únicos prints desta série feitos em papel Fine Art, e também serão assinados e numerados.

Tanto a edição especial do livro como os prints em Fine Art são exclusivos deste crowdfunding, não sendo possível adquirir depois deste terminar.

 

Conto contigo para tornar este livro realidade!

 //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

EN

to know a body is a book about the intimacy of bodies, the process of self-knowledge and the learning of the self from the other. The photographic process took place between 2017 and 2019, but only this year it evolved into an object with a more refined sense and intention. In that sense, the construction of this book started by going back to my archive to find an intentional narrative line that permeated the photographs taken during that time. Among more than two thousand photographs, the choice fell to about fifty, which communicate a melancholic idea of the search for my identity through the bodies and places I have experienced.

 

The series

“‘But most of the time—most of the time I made love only with the body.’
‘That can make one very lonely,’ I said.”
                          Giovanni’s Room, James Baldwin

Between 2017 and 2019, I got in the habit of getting in my car and driving around the country quite often. I wanted to explore Portugal, meet new people and new places, I wanted to escape my own loneliness with movement, the road passing under my car. I took my 35mm camera with me and looked for landscapes that attracted me, places that caught my attention, people that captured my interest. And I photographed them. I photographed the sea, I photographed the land, I photographed the cities and the streets, I photographed the faces and the bodies, the bodies dressed and naked, standing and moving. I let myself overcome my difficulty in talking to strangers and they stopped being so. They opened up to my camera, to my gaze, they let themselves be photographed, explored by representation, tempted by desire. And while looking for the other and more, I would like to say that I had found myself; but I don't think that happened. It took two more years to realize that, I had to find myself to realize that it hadn't happened yet. In that sense, I looked back at the images I took in those years and selected the ones that best communicated that search, the melancholy of exploration, of self-knowledge, of the bodies of others towards my body and my identity. A collection of images in which I seek in bodies to know a body, my body.

 

Who I am

I was born in Ovar, in 1992, and I'm an artist who works at the intersection of cinema,
photography, music and media arts. I have a degree in Cinema and Audiovisual from the Escola Superior Artística do Porto (2013) and I attend the Master in Photography at the School of Arts of the Catholic University of Portugal. I live in Braga.

My work crosses different artistic disciplines, using the potential that each offers, in order to enrich the ideas and concepts proposed. I am the author of two award-winning short essay-fiction films and an experimental film. In music, I released records as Tundra Fault, an electronic music project that I finished in the meantime, of which I was also the author of music videos; and I create live music for performances and shows. In photography, I am the author of the photographic project A Body of Land, which has been exhibited on several occasions.

I have been invited to be part of festival juries and to teach trainings and workshops. I collaborate with artists from various fields, such as Daniel Seabra, Maria Trabulo, Antonio da Silva, Dora Vieira, David Machado, Distorted Vision and Rui P. Andrade.

 

The book and perks

This book is the way I found to put this work in your hands, beyond digital and social networks. I believe in the power of the physical object as a means of appreciating art, so it seemed evident that the next step in having a series ready would be to publish it. For that, I count on you and your contribution in this crowdfunding. All books and prints purchased will be made and delivered even if we do not achieve the goal of this crowdfunding, so there is no risk of not having your copy guaranteed.

There are several things you can purchase in this crowdfunding:

 

Prints

The prints are photographs printed on premium semi-matte photographic paper, sized 15x20cm, which includes a white border all around. All prints will be signed by me on the back. The available images are as follows, and when you choose the reward, you must specify the number of the images you want. In the updates of this crowdfunding you can see the photos in more detail.

 

Book

The book is the star of this crowdfunding, of course. It has 92 pages, with 47 photographs. The standard edition of the book will be in soft cover, with the inside on semi-matte paper.

 

Special Edition of the Book and Prints in Fine Art

In addition to the standard edition, there will be a special limited edition. This edition will be in hardcover, and will be numbered and signed. This edition will exist only in this crowdfunding, and cannot be purchased after it ends. The number of books in this special edition will be the number of the only print run that will be made, so if you purchase this version, you will have a copy of a very limited edition. With this book, you also have the possibility to add 2, 5 or 10 15x20cm prints, also in a special limited edition: they will be the only prints in this series made on Fine Art paper, and will also be signed and numbered.

Both the special edition of the book and the prints in Fine Art are exclusive to this crowdfunding, it is not possible to purchase after this is finished.

 

I'm counting on you to make this book a reality!

I photographed the sea, I photographed the land, I photographed the cities and the streets, I photographed the faces and the bodies, the bodies dressed and naked, standing and moving. I let myself overcome my difficulty in talking to strangers and they stopped being so. They opened up to my camera, to my gaze, they let themselves be photographed, explored by representation, tempted by desire. And while looking for the other and more, I would like to say that I had found myself; but I don't think that happened. It took two more years to realize that, I had to find myself to realize that it hadn't happened yet. In that sense, I looked back at the images I took in those years and selected the ones that best communicated that search, the melancholy of exploration, of self-knowledge, of the bodies of others towards my body and my identity. A collection of images in which I seek in bodies to know a body, my body.
 
Who I am

I was born in Ovar, in 1992, and I'm an artist who works at the intersection of cinema,photography, music and media arts. I have a degree in Cinema and Audiovisual from the Escola Superior Artística do Porto (2013) and I attend the Master in Photography at the School of Arts of the Catholic University of Portugal. I live in Braga.
My work crosses different artistic disciplines, using the potential that each offers, in order to enrich the ideas and concepts proposed. I am the author of two award-winning short essay-fiction films and an experimental film. In music, I released records as Tundra Fault, an electronic music project that I finished in the meantime, of which I was also the author of music videos; and I create live music for performances and shows. In photography, I am the author of the photographic project A Body of Land, which has been exhibited on several occasions.
I have been invited to be part of festival juries and to teach trainings and workshops. I collaborate with artists from various fields, such as Daniel Seabra, Maria Trabulo, Antonio da Silva, Dora Vieira, David Machado, Distorted Vision and Rui P. Andrade.
 
The book and perks

This book is the way I found to put this work in your hands, beyond digital and social networks. I believe in the power of the physical object as a means of appreciating art, so it seemed evident that the next step in having a series ready would be to publish it. For that, I count on you and your contribution in this crowdfunding. All books and prints purchased will be made and delivered even if we do not achieve the goal of this crowdfunding, so there is no risk of not having your copy guaranteed.
There are several things you can purchase in this crowdfunding:
 
Prints
The prints are photographs printed on premium semi-matte photographic paper, sized 15x20cm, which includes a white border all around. All prints will be signed by me on the back. The available images are as follows, and when you choose the reward, you must specify the number of the images you want. In the updates of this crowdfunding you can see the photos in more detail.

 
Book

The book is the star of this crowdfunding, of course. It has 92 pages, with 47 photographs. The standard edition of the book will be in soft cover, with the inside on semi-matte paper.
 
Special Edition of the Book and Prints in Fine Art

In addition to the standard edition, there will be a special limited edition. This edition will be in hardcover, and will be numbered and signed. This edition will exist only in this crowdfunding, and cannot be purchased after it ends. The number of books in this special edition will be the number of the only print run that will be made, so if you purchase this version, you will have a copy of a very limited edition. With this book, you also have the possibility to add 2, 5 or 10 15x20cm prints, also in a special limited edition: they will be the only prints in this series made on Fine Art paper, and will also be signed and numbered.
Both the special edition of the book and the prints in Fine Art are exclusive to this crowdfunding, it is not possible to purchase after this is finished.
 
I'm counting on you to make this book a reality!

story:
Hidden in the woods and hills in the remote parts of the state of Chhattisgarh in central India are villages in which time seems to have stood still.

Next year I will go there to document the life of local tribal jungle kids I want to do this because they are the future generation of the tribes that still exist. This is what I will be doing regardless of this indiegogo project in the first quarter of 2015. I am a young photographer looking for a way to create value through photography, and want to be ethically correct. That’s why I want to do more for the kids in rural India and that is what this indiegogo is about!

WHAT

I want to give the tribal jungle kids the opportunity to take photos of their lives. This will inspire them to look at their world from a different perspective. I want them to discover what they want to achieve in life, and for them to think about and develop their own opinion. Something I was always stimulated with as a kid. What do you want to do? Why do you want to achieve your goals? How wil you want do this? This is something the kids don’t get stimulated with very often over in rural India. 

HOW

By buying and giving the kids disposable cameras we will see how they see their lives, and we will have them learn about how to look at others and themselves through photography. The kids then themselves will receive the photos they have taken, so they have pictures to look back on when they are older, something that seems normal for us but not to them. This can be a powerful way to contribute to their sense of identity. They will also receive portraits I have taken from them for my documentary.

WHY

The tribals in India are a minority group that is being suppressed by the bigger common group of Indian people, and owners of big lumps of land. It is hard for them to grow and get the chance to grow and get educated.

THE FUNDS

The majority of the funds will be used for project supplies like disposable cameras, the developing of the negatives, printing the negatives on paper and shipping them back to rural India. Also a part of the funds will be put into the rewards for the backers of this project. If there is any money left I will use this money to enhance the project in any way I can.

I will be funding the airfare and travel costs independently so the funds raised by this indiegogo project wont go into my travel costs etc.

story:
EmePress is a documentary photography agency focused in women's issues and the LGBT community, sectors daily struggle for recognition and equality. The goal is to create visual stories than provide positive role models about women, gay, lesbian, bisexual and all queer people, of all those who with his strength and courage overcome difficulties and make this world a much more interesting and more fun place to live.

                                 

Big Media constantly publish news full of stereotypes and prejudices, and to fight against this, the first step is the visibility of the LGBT community. So we need to go beyond the breaking news and tell our stories, our true stories. And make people see them, because in today's world, exists only what we see. So, if you don't see something, does not exist, and if that doesn't exist is not named. Therefore it’s important that people see things, so they know that are real and that are there.

Who am I?

I'm Olivia Garza García, a freelance photojournalist and documentary photographer for seven years based in Monterrey, Mexico. I have participated in several exhibitions of photography in museums and galleries in my city and other cities in Mexico. 

But I haven't won big prizes, neither have published photos in international magazines. The only thing I can say about me is that I'm very committed to social causes and human rights of women and LGBT community, because I dream of living in a world where everyone is equal and life is more just and dignified for all, a world where no one can be discriminated against for any condition. And I think the best way to achieve this is through photography, because it has a great power and a increasingly strong impact on our lives.

I get my talent, expertise, passion and time. This is what I can offer you, so you can support my project. I invite you to visit my website www.oliviagarzagarcia.com, where you can see my personal work.

     

The agency

The agency is already on internet (www.eme-press.com), works through a website where the media must register to free download the images. My plan is to be free for alternative and non-profit media and long-term look at how the agency to be self-financing.
I have dedicated three months to design and technical issues of the website, so that photos can be easily downloaded. But in these months I have spent all my savings, so now I need your help to keep alive this project for at least six months (or a year if it's possible). I want to continue taking pictures and travel to other cities in Mexico, USA and Latin America to find and document interesting stories. 

What I need?

I only have my Nikon camera, a normal lens and a very slow laptop. So I need the following camera gear and financial resources for administrative expenses for at least six months.

  • 24-70mm f/2.8 Lens - $1,887
  • 35mm f/1.8 Lens - $197
  • Microphone - $130
  • A Mac Powerbook - $1,587
  • A hard drive 1TB - $115
  • Photoshop & Lightroom licenses - $120 a year
  • Final Cut Pro - $300
  • Administrative expenses - $5,000
  • Travel expenses - Undefined
  • Perks - Undefined
  • PayPal & IndieGoGo Fee - $2,000

Impact 

In the long run this agency will have a positive effect on the representation of the LGBT people in all Media. That is, it will contribute to a visual representation without stereotypes or prejudices of all queer people in newspapers and magazines.  And also, to document and show the world the lives of women and LGBT people suffering discrimination and persecution in other countries, I wish help stop these situations and fight for their rights as human beings.

Risks and challenges

My big challenge is to achieve of funding for the agency and keep this project alive, and that can really help to bring to a change in society.

Other ways you can help

Help me to make the change you wish to see in the world.
  • Share the campaign on your social networks.
  • Invite your friends to donate.
  • Please Like this on Facebook,

story:
Hi I’m Kate, the photographer and author behind The Phone Project.

What is The Phone Project?

It’s a full color collection of my photography capturing vintage telephones in awkward landscapes, snuggled up in a book next to some of my flash fiction.

This is absolutely the coolest and most profound project I've ever put together.

In a way it’s an absurdist comedy to place these phones in places they would not usually be found and that’s the beauty of the concept and the profundity of making art about the ways in which we communicate.

The Phone Project has been on my mind forever and I finally started shooting it 5 years ago! Yes, 5 years ago!

WHY?

Because Phones are Awesome

For five years I’m been collecting phones and taking pictures of them whenever I can and wherever I can. I’ve been documenting some of our last remaining phone booths too while I’m at it. Now I have over 200 photographs from NY to Death Valley, Seattle to the Salton Sea with a few more to take here in Joshua Tree and Berlin. For those of you that know my work, my films can take forever and usually when I make a book like my Mojave Weather Diaries, I am making something super accessible between films that sustains my art practice.

I always have writing available to me as my creative outlet between bigger more expensive projects. I’ve successfully printed 4 Mojave Weather Diaries without having to fund raise. But that’s because they are black and white images from my sketchbook and it’s way less expensive to print than a full color image book. That’s why I’m asking for your help this time!

It would be impossible for me to afford to print this book without your contribution.

Usually with my art books I do a very limited edition and this is for a few reasons: Firstly so the book will retain its value as a special art object, to keep printing affordable for the comics, and to reasonably distribute the art through small community readings and art openings. I’d love to print The Phone Project in an edition of 250 which will be more than I usually get to do, but it will still be small enough to be a special art book and collectable.

One of the photos was recently featured in the projection of Open Desert at the Palm Springs Art Museum!

How?

Pure Mettle and YOU!

I’ve been very successful at setting my art goals and achieving them, often in the spare few minutes I have between jobs and sleep and sometimes between holding down 3 jobs and sleeps. I made a promise to myself this year that I’d focus on finishing art projects that are important to me and making sure I reach out to my audience and make my art available as I go.

People are already willing to book me to do readings from The Phone Project later this year. How awesome is that? I have an audience waiting to laugh out loud to funny short stories about how we communicate and enjoy beautiful phone photographs that will remind people of their childhoods, our thoughts on technology, the myriad of metaphoric ways we use “the call” and of course, the surreal aspect of an object in a sometimes unexpected place.

The last time I crowd funded for a book, I raised money to pay my collaborators: the illustrator, the copy editor, the printer, and a web designer. I met my goal!  A full color photo book costs a lot more to print. Your donations at every level count tremendously and at a $100 will get you a signed and numbered copy of the book and some exciting special little art pieces I made just for this. The majority of funds raised will go to the printing of the books. The rest will be divided between: payment to a copy editor to help the fiction parts, rebooting the Kidnap Yourself website to promote the book, some to help with the overhead here at the Kidnap Yourself studio (I’ve never raised money to help keep the lights on while I work, but need to admit I need the help!), and to upgrade some of my camera equipment so I can take a few more crucial photos to top off the fine collection of phones – for instance: I can take the very last photo in Berlin when I’m there in September doing my very first artist residency!

I’m not down with the phrase “Passion project.” Art making whether it is for my films, writing, painting or photography is my life, and my life is something I’m passionate about but it’s no temporary thing or hobby, this is my commitment to my audience and to inspire other art makers and viewers along the way. I’ve been humbled and honored to receive praise for my work and combining my writing and photographs is something I live for. You can help! And your help at any level gets you a piece of art in return.

BUDGET

I thought I'd break down the budget so you know I'm being realistic and not overly ambitious.

The quote I have for 250, 100 page full color photo books with a  soft cover is $7,500. $1000 for the website re-launch, $400 for the copy editor, $800 for shipping and shipping packaging, $500 for the last camera gear, $960-1000 for the fees charged by Indie Gogo, and what's left is about $800 toward studio overhead.

It's easy to get to $12,000 making a full color book.

My dream would be to raise even more and do a Hardcover! And if we go over the amount, that's exactly what I'll do as a best case scenario.

If we can't raise the full amount, I will have to print less books, but will still need to raise approx $8,000 to pay for the other elements involved and print a beautiful edition of 100 books instead. Either way The Phone Project will be in your hands someday...by December!!

YOU RULE!

Thank you a million times over from my little desert art studio and for helping make The Phone Project a bona fide work of art you can hold in your hands.

BIO

Kate McCabe lives in the desert near the rock-n-roll heaven known as Joshua Tree, California where she founded the art collective Kidnap Yourself. In Philadelphia, her youth was dominated by dance and art where her mother taught ballet and later performed Flamenco. She is a graduate of Girls’ High, the University of the Arts and she obtained her MFA in Experimental Animation from the California Institute of the Arts under the innovative Jules Engel.  She is an award winning independent filmmaker who has shown films globally since 1995 in both film festivals and galleries and the occasional guerrilla drive-in. She is most re-known internationally for Sabbia, her first feature film, a visual album for stoner rock prince, Brant Bjork. Her current work includes paintings, photography, short fiction, and art books, in addition to the R. Crumb inspired “The Truth About Tornados”, a short story with illustrations by the Philadelphia artist Monique Ligons. Her popular sketch comic book “Mojave Weather Diaries” has produced 4 books in the series and counting. McCabe has taught film at CalArts and UC San Diego and has worked with some of Los Angeles’ most prolific independent filmmakers including Eli Roth and Pat O’Neill. She will be the artist in residence at Studio Lichtenberg in Berlin in September, 2016 and had her first solo show of paintings and photographs "The Ineffable Inevitable" at Taylor Junction in Joshua Tree.

story:
In keeping with my belief that the arts and imagery can effect and spark social change, I have launched the IamTheChange™ Campaign. This campaign was inspired by the quote, “Be the change you wish to see in the world… ” by Mahatma Ghandi. I wanted to find a way to capture the WHY for everyone-WHY they are the change, and use it as a visual aid to inspire others to embrace their WHY or discover their WHY. Because our “why” or the reason we are the change is also tied into our purpose on this earth..the reason we were sent here.

Once we’ve recognized that reason, once we embrace it, own it, stand on it, and deliver it..that is when change happens. I’ve combined my passion for photography and “social good” to help spark the mind of the person that will change the world.

 IamTheChange™ is global social good photography campaign, brand, and coffee table book inspired by the quote, "You must be the change you want to see in the world.." by Mahatma Gandhi 

Imagery is a powerful weapon, and I've decided to use it for good. My goal is to capture a total of at LEAST 500 images of people all over the world through out my travels while they wear an IamTheChange t-shirt and display their reason for being the change on the change chalk board. Once I reach my goal, the images will be compiled together to create the IamTheChange Coffee table book!

          What am I going to do with the money I raise? Glad you asked!

With the money that is raised, I will be able to purchase more IamTheChange t-shirts (which are given to all of the people who I photograph for free) and the funds will be used to cover the printing cost for our IamTheChange photography coffee table book. Simple, right? With your help, everyone featured in the book will recieve a free t-shirt AND you help to offset the cost of printing for the first 100 copies of the IamTheChange book!

Take a look at some of the images we have taken so far that will be included in the IamTheChange Coffee table boook! http://www.iamthechangecampaign.com/gallery/atlanta-ga-iamthechange-photo-shoots/

To change the world, we must begin with us. Won’t you join us so that we can all inspire one another to be the change?

20% of the proceeds will go to The She is Me Program, Inc. a 501 c3 non-profit organization that educated and empowers young women to creat thier own media while exposeing them to positive role models.

This campaign was inspired by the quote, “Be the change you wish to see in the world… ” by Mahatma Ghandi. I wanted to find a way to capture the WHY for everyone-WHY they are the change, and use it as a visual aid to inspire others to embrace their WHY or discover their WHY. Because our “why” or the reason we are the change is also tied into our purpose on this earth..the reason we were sent here.
Once we’ve recognized that reason, once we embrace it, own it, stand on it, and deliver it..that is when change happens. I’ve combined my passion for photography and “social good” to help spark the mind of the person that will change the world.
 IamTheChange™ is global social good photography campaign, brand, and coffee table book inspired by the quote, "You must be the change you want to see in the world.." by Mahatma Gandhi 
Imagery is a powerful weapon, and I've decided to use it for good. My goal is to capture a total of at LEAST 500 images of people all over the world through out my travels while they wear an IamTheChange t-shirt and display their reason for being the change on the change chalk board. Once I reach my goal, the images will be compiled together to create the IamTheChange Coffee table book!
          What am I going to do with the money I raise? Glad you asked!

With the money that is raised, I will be able to purchase more IamTheChange t-shirts (which are given to all of the people who I photograph for free) and the funds will be used to cover the printing cost for our IamTheChange photography coffee table book. Simple, right? With your help, everyone featured in the book will recieve a free t-shirt AND you help to offset the cost of printing for the first 100 copies of the IamTheChange book!
Take a look at some of the images we have taken so far that will be included in the IamTheChange Coffee table boook! http://www.iamthechangecampaign.com/gallery/atlanta-ga-iamthechange-photo-shoots/
To change the world, we must begin with us. Won’t you join us so that we can all inspire one another to be the change?
20% of the proceeds will go to The She is Me Program, Inc. a 501 c3 non-profit organization that educated and empowers young women to creat thier own media while exposeing them to positive role models.

story:
Short Summary


My name is Achim Harding. I am an emerging photographer in New York, NY USA. I mainly photograph fashion and this year my focus will be on international fashion! My 2015 New Year's Resolution is to travel more and expand my knowledge in culture, art, fashion, and languages. In Spring of 2015, I will be traveling to the country of Brazil to explore all that G-D wants to show me throughout this experience. I plan on traveling to the fashion capital of South America: São Paulo, Brazil. I will be documenting life, fashion trends, and how the culture differs from here in the United States. I plan to attend São Paulo Fashion Week in April, which will be a huge part of this documentary.



Click here to check out my portfolio and keep up with my blogging throughout the whole process. www.AchimHardingPhotography.com

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for your assistance in the cost of travel and materials needed to create this documentary of fashion in Latin America. This can be anything from props for sets, studio accessories etc. It is essential to assemble the right team to make it happen (make up artists, hairstylists, wardrobe, assistants, models) and so forth. I will be sharing this experience in the form of videos, photos, social media, story books, and email updates!  We have some awesome perks! You can either get a print of your choice at the end of our trip of any picture from our art gallery. We also have photography session perks for those who live in either the New York Tri State area or South Florida. See the perks for more details. 


The Impact

The impact from this trip will be tremendous. It will be great to bring the essence of South American fashion and culture back to the United States. I have never traveled so far away in my life! I will be able to teach the English language and photography skills to the people of Brazil and return having learned more than I could ever imagine. The reason why I got into photography in the first place is because I love to create art. Having this campaign funded, will open up the door for some great pieces to come out of this trip. Learning about the fashion industry from a South American perspective will benefit me vastly in my future endeavors and create various opportunities for me as a multilingual speaker.


Risks & Challenges

There are various risks and challenges when traveling to an unknown country. Safety is number one! Which is why I am taking precautions to make sure that is my top priority. The second challenge will be the language barrier. As of right now I know the basics of Portuguese to get me by. However, by the time my trip comes I would like to be able to actually carry on a conversation with people beyond the basic introductions. Another obstacle will be taking the photos. Fashion Week can be a challenging event as there will be multiple media outlets there all battling for the same shots. There are certain places that will be heavily trafficked with people, so I will have to plan my days out when the pedestrian traffic is less.

Other Ways You Can Help

Ways you can help is to SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! There is no telling who will be able to see and contribute to my campaign, if you simply share via the social media platform that you subscribe to!

story:
At a glance...

My name is Ambre, I'm 27 years old and I really am passionate about photography. This is why since last year, I'm a student in a photography school in the north of France. Before that, I had the opportunity to be a professional photographer in Canada during 2 years. I learned a lot, but being a professional is not the same as being an artist ! This is why I slightly changed my way, and began this Bachelor in Photography. Now, I learn how to express myself in other ways, and I have found mine.
 
Unfortunately for me, it's a pretty expensive way...
 
I am fond of film photography, especially color. This is why I have recently bought a Rolleiflex, a 1959 camera, which uses unusual films. It's a great camera, which produces high quality pictures. The quality that I want and need for my project.
 
I love the Japanese poetry in photography, especially Rinko Kawauchi's work. I will never say that I want to follow her tracks, but my project is about the same thing : capturing the beauty of our world, in little, fragile, colored frangments.
 
I tried to realize this with a digital camera, but working with a Rolleiflex is a totally different experience. First of all, you don't look into the viewfiender and take your picture; you have to head down in front of your subject. You have to physically detach yourself from the subject you want to photograph, in order to compose and focus. For me, it's mentally showing respect to your subject, even if it's a building.
Second of all, you don't use digital instruments. You don't even use 24x36 films ! You use 120 films, which produce 12 6x6 great quality pictures. With this quality, you can print huge pictures without altering the quality.
 
As you can see, my project is very specific, but it's, in my sense, a great project to which you can participate. I have a lot of things to say, but money is always the factor keeping my away from my dreams.
If you want to see my "commercial" work, you can visit my web page at www.photohorscadre.e-monsite.com

What is this project about ?

My original goal is 1500€. It was calculated on the basis of 3 big axes :

- The camera maintenance

- The purchase and the development of the films

- The prints

The camera maintenance is important to have nice, well-exposed pictures. As it is old, I will need to revise all its little pieces, and I can't do it myself!

The purchase of the films is, itself, pretty expensive. Every film costs 8€ (I buy the Kodak Portra 400 or 800 in order to have the smallest grain and great, vibrating colors), the development is 12€, and the scanning of each films is another 12€.

The prints are pretty expensive, as each print will cost me around 20€. As I aim a total of 20 -nice- pictures in order to have a consistent set of images, the total for only the prints will be nearly half the total of the project !

 


And what do you get ? Well, I was just about to say it !

If you believe in me and my work, I believe as well in you and the things you fight for. This is why, for every Euro you give to my project, I will give a percentage to the NGO of your choice. It can be to fight cancer, to help communities access water in Togo, or to protect the marine turtles, everything you want ! Please see the "contributions" panel in order to see how much I will give.

And if I don't have the full 1500€, well, I will still use the money to start the project ! I might finish it a bit later, since I will have to find other sources, but it will still be my only aim !

The impact

YOU will make the difference.

Why ?

Because without your financial support, young artists like me won't be able to be discovered, to participate in contests and exhibitions, etc.

With your help,  I will have enough money to present a wide variety of pictures to every gallery I will solicit, every contest I will try, every agent I will send an e-mail to. And, most of all, I will see that you, people, like what I do and that I can continue my work with your help !

Other ways to help

You might can't contribute to this project, but you still can help !

You can :

- Visit my website at www.photohorscadre.e-monsite.com and like me on facebook !

- Talk about me to your friends and family !

- Share this link to other persons who might find my project interesting !

And before you leave, let me say THANK YOU for having taken the time to read my project ! I'm sure you will make a difference.
 

My other works so far...

Until now, my work has already been encouraged, since I've won a Paris contest (one of my image figured on the first page of they 2011 pressbook), a Quebec contest (#1 city image), and I have an exhibition of some of my pictures in a gastronomic restaurant in Manosque, France. I would love to go further and further, and send some of my work to other contests and galleries !

story:
Short Summary

My name is JoAnna Brownrigg. I am a photographer, living and working in Seattle, WA. My primary area of focus is portraiture. I'm a graduate of Cornish College of the Arts, where I received a Bachelor of Fine Arts. I am a member of the Ponca Tribe of Nebraska. Our homeland is located in the northeastern part of the state. We have no reservation, however we have a tribal headquarters and several office locations around the area. I will be traveling to my tribal headquarters in Niobrara, NE from March 22-29, 2015. My colleague and friend Sarah Ricci is also joining me, serving as my photographer's assistant and videographer. Sarah is a filmmaker and editor with almost ten years experience. My goal is to begin a photography project that will serve as a exploration and celebration of my native heritage.

My maternal grandfather served as my first exposure to my ancestry. He was born on Ponca land in Nebraska and held the ability to speak the Ponca language. I was very close to my grandfather. Growing up he would make me fry bread and share stories with me. When I was a eighteen he passed away. His spirit has always stayed with me. Growing stronger with each passing year. My whole life I have struggled to find my native identity. I did not feel like I belonged because I have fair skin, blonde hair, and green eyes. Unfortunately our western culture possesses a stereotypical image of what a person of native descent looks like. Inside I felt native but on the outside I didn't. People still look at me funny when I tell them I am Native American, but it doesn't bother me anymore; my connection to the land and to my people is strong. I hope to keep strengthening it by doing this project. Recently I found the courage to reach out to tribal officials and I was honored to receive their permission to start this project. 

My goal is to meet with other tribal members and share stories, traditions and make meaningful long-lasting connections. Some of the topics I will be exploring: tribal future, sovereignty, preservation of culture, projects (education trail) and programs (tribal youth reconnection program, etc..). Two important questions I will be asking: How does termination continue to effect the tribe, and how does one navigate being a Ponca in 2015? This is a project that needs time to develop, so my hope is to travel back to Nebraska periodically over the years. Ultimately showing the photographs locally and nationally in a gallery type setting. 

I would like to share a quote with you that has had quite a lot of impact on me. It has given me great strength recently. 

"We become educated and we give back to our people. Don't leave without giving back to your people. They need you, come back. Be educated but give. Unconditionally work for them, they need this." 
-Gloria Grant (Diné Nation), Matika Wilbur's Project 562

This journey is extremely close to my heart. I feel so proud to be Ponca. With this project I hope to share my pride with a large audience, from all backgrounds. Your kind donation will help make that possible. Thank you for letting me share my story with you. I hope to show you more in the future! 


What We Are Funding & What We Need 

You are helping to fund:

1. Plane Tickets, round trip from Seattle to Omaha (2 tickets total)

2. Car Rental

We are funding: 

1. Photography and Video Supplies: 

Film: medium and large format 

Film developing costs

Photo Printing and film scanning costs 

4x5 large format camera rental/possible purchase 

2. Lodging and Gas 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute, there are still ways you can help! Please share this page on Facebook. Or share through email. Anyway of spreading the word we would greatly appreciate!   


*The image above was taken at the Seafair Indian Days Pow Wow, Daybreak Star Cultural Center, Seattle, Washington, July 2009.

story:
What Is This All About? 

Mystery Spot Books is a collaborative artist book publishing imprint by artist Chad Rutter and scholar Emily Roehl. The Energy Landscapes of St. Louis is a project that we began during a residency at St. Louis non-profit art center The Luminary. Through this project, we take our desire to engage with issues of energy production and climate change and ground it in a particular place: the St. Louis region. Besides being at the confluence of three major rivers, St. Louis is also the point at which a complex web of energy companies, power plants, geological features, waste sites, communities, and area histories connect. 

During our stay in the Gateway City, we worked with local photographer and Washington University professor Jennifer Colten. Over the last several years, Colten has photographed post-industrial sites throughout the area. Together, we conceived of the book Flood Plain Color Field, which explores a part of our energy consumption process typically unseen by the public, the residual monuments of energy waste that accumulate in the flood plains of rivers.

Why Is This Important? 

Now, more than ever, artists, writers, and other cultural creators need to illuminate the environmental realities of the people and places most affected by climate change and energy production. This book draws attention to one such site across the Mississippi River from downtown St. Louis, which hosts a decommissioned power plant and coal ash mound. By engaging with this landscape through photography, design, and writing, we want to draw attention not only to the histories of extraction in the region but to the persistent waste products that affect the health of human and ecological communities. 

As a standalone project, this book helps expose a wider audience to the work of Jennifer Colten and Mystery Spot Books. As the next edition in the Energy Landscapes series, this book is part of Mystery Spot's template for future work in other cities. Our vision is to grow this effort into an ongoing investigation of how a changing environment writ large can be understood aesthetically, historically, and materially in the landscapes of our everyday lives. Your help in funding this book will go a long way toward making this broader effort a reality.

What Will The Funding Do? What Will I Get In Return?

We've completed the shooting, designing, and writing components of our photobook, and now we're asking for $2500 to help us print a limited edition of Energy Landscapes of St. Louis No. 3: Flood Plain Color Field. Any funding over that goal will be used to help stage launch events in St. Louis, MO (where Jennifer lives), Minneapolis, MN (where Chad lives), and Austin, TX (where Emily lives).

In exchange for your support, depending on amount, you will get awesome Mystery Spot publications, and, of course, a fresh copy of Flood Plain Color Field. If you dig especially deep in the ol' couch cushions, there are other, special perks detailed to the right. Here are some examples of what you can get: 

Labadie Zine:

The Forest Poster (printed with coal ash)

Mound.AB. 9397, Jennifer Colten Limited Edition Print 1

Mound AB. 0119, Jennifer Colten Limited Edition Print 2

 

What Are Your Credentials? 

Jennifer Colten’s work focuses on ambiguous landscapes- sites at the margins of the urban environment, and spaces that reveal a resilience of ecological transformation. Central concerns within her photographic practice reflect questions surrounding the representation of landscape, and examine multiple issues revealing social, cultural, and environmental implications of land use.

After receiving her MFA from Massachusetts College of Art in Boston, Colten relocated to the Midwest to teach photography at Washington University Sam Fox School of Design & Visual Arts.

In addition to private collections, Colten’s photographs are included in institutions including The Museum für Fotographie, Braunschweig, Germany, Museo de Arte Moderno, Bogota, Museo de Antioquia, and Bellas Artes Institute, both in Medellin, Colombia, the Centro Colombo Americano Institutions in Medellin and in Periera Colombia, South America.

jennifercolten.com

Emily Roehl is a PhD candidate in American Studies at the University of Texas at Austin and the co-founder of Mystery Spot Books. Roehl's research is focused on the energy humanities, environmental justice, and contemporary art. In her dissertation, Roehl looks at landscape photographs of extractive sites from upstream to down in the material life of oil, from the tar sands of Alberta to the proposed routes of the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines to the refineries of Illinois, Texas, and Louisiana. Roehl is interested in the aesthetic strategies of artists and activists who address the unevenly distributed risks of energy development.

mysteryspotbooks.com

Chad Rutter is an artist living and working in Minneapolis, MN. He makes work in a wide range of media exploring themes of place-based experience in the human-altered landscape. He received a BFA from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design and an MFA from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities. His work as an individual artist has been exhibited locally and regionally in venues such as The Soap Factory and the Minneapolis Institute of Art. His work as Mystery Spot Books has exhibited nationally and internationally in events including the LA Art Book Fair, the Tokyo Art Book Fair, Photobook Melbourne, the Vancouver Art Book Fair and in numerous gallery exhibitions. Distributors include Printed Matter, Inc. in New York and Ti Pi Tin in London. Mystery Spot titles can be found in archives and collections including The Indie Photobook Library in Washington, D.C., the Midway Contemporary Art Library in Minneapolis, and the Joan Flasch Artists' Book Collection at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.

mysteryspotbooks.com

chadrutter.com

Are There Other Ways I Can Help?

Absolutely! If you like what we're doing, please tell other people about it! It takes just a couple of clicks to let other people know about this project on your social media site(s) of choice.
