Mystery Spot Books is a collaborative artist book publishing imprint by artist Chad Rutter and scholar Emily Roehl. The Energy Landscapes of St. Louis is a project that we began during a residency at St. Louis non-profit art center The Luminary. Through this project, we take our desire to engage with issues of energy production and climate change and ground it in a particular place: the St. Louis region. Besides being at the confluence of three major rivers, St. Louis is also the point at which a complex web of energy companies, power plants, geological features, waste sites, communities, and area histories connect. 
During our stay in the Gateway City, we worked with local photographer and Washington University professor Jennifer Colten. Over the last several years, Colten has photographed post-industrial sites throughout the area. Together, we conceived of the book Flood Plain Color Field, which explores a part of our energy consumption process typically unseen by the public, the residual monuments of energy waste that accumulate in the flood plains of rivers.

Why Is This Important? 
Now, more than ever, artists, writers, and other cultural creators need to illuminate the environmental realities of the people and places most affected by climate change and energy production. This book draws attention to one such site across the Mississippi River from downtown St. Louis, which hosts a decommissioned power plant and coal ash mound. By engaging with this landscape through photography, design, and writing, we want to draw attention not only to the histories of extraction in the region but to the persistent waste products that affect the health of human and ecological communities. 
As a standalone project, this book helps expose a wider audience to the work of Jennifer Colten and Mystery Spot Books. As the next edition in the Energy Landscapes series, this book is part of Mystery Spot's template for future work in other cities. Our vision is to grow this effort into an ongoing investigation of how a changing environment writ large can be understood aesthetically, historically, and materially in the landscapes of our everyday lives. Your help in funding this book will go a long way toward making this broader effort a reality.
What Will The Funding Do? What Will I Get In Return?
We've completed the shooting, designing, and writing components of our photobook, and now we're asking for $2500 to help us print a limited edition of Energy Landscapes of St. Louis No. 3: Flood Plain Color Field. Any funding over that goal will be used to help stage launch events in St. Louis, MO (where Jennifer lives), Minneapolis, MN (where Chad lives), and Austin, TX (where Emily lives).
In exchange for your support, depending on amount, you will get awesome Mystery Spot publications, and, of course, a fresh copy of Flood Plain Color Field. If you dig especially deep in the ol' couch cushions, there are other, special perks detailed to the right. Here are some examples of what you can get: 
Labadie Zine:



The Forest Poster (printed with coal ash)


Mound.AB. 9397, Jennifer Colten Limited Edition Print 1

Mound AB. 0119, Jennifer Colten Limited Edition Print 2
 

What Are Your Credentials? 
Jennifer Colten’s work focuses on ambiguous landscapes- sites at the margins of the urban environment, and spaces that reveal a resilience of ecological transformation. Central concerns within her photographic practice reflect questions surrounding the representation of landscape, and examine multiple issues revealing social, cultural, and environmental implications of land use.
After receiving her MFA from Massachusetts College of Art in Boston, Colten relocated to the Midwest to teach photography at Washington University Sam Fox School of Design & Visual Arts.
In addition to private collections, Colten’s photographs are included in institutions including The Museum für Fotographie, Braunschweig, Germany, Museo de Arte Moderno, Bogota, Museo de Antioquia, and Bellas Artes Institute, both in Medellin, Colombia, the Centro Colombo Americano Institutions in Medellin and in Periera Colombia, South America.
jennifercolten.com
Emily Roehl is a PhD candidate in American Studies at the University of Texas at Austin and the co-founder of Mystery Spot Books. Roehl's research is focused on the energy humanities, environmental justice, and contemporary art. In her dissertation, Roehl looks at landscape photographs of extractive sites from upstream to down in the material life of oil, from the tar sands of Alberta to the proposed routes of the Keystone XL and Dakota Access pipelines to the refineries of Illinois, Texas, and Louisiana. Roehl is interested in the aesthetic strategies of artists and activists who address the unevenly distributed risks of energy development.
mysteryspotbooks.com
Chad Rutter is an artist living and working in Minneapolis, MN. He makes work in a wide range of media exploring themes of place-based experience in the human-altered landscape. He received a BFA from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design and an MFA from the University of Minnesota, Twin Cities. His work as an individual artist has been exhibited locally and regionally in venues such as The Soap Factory and the Minneapolis Institute of Art. His work as Mystery Spot Books has exhibited nationally and internationally in events including the LA Art Book Fair, the Tokyo Art Book Fair, Photobook Melbourne, the Vancouver Art Book Fair and in numerous gallery exhibitions. Distributors include Printed Matter, Inc. in New York and Ti Pi Tin in London. Mystery Spot titles can be found in archives and collections including The Indie Photobook Library in Washington, D.C., the Midway Contemporary Art Library in Minneapolis, and the Joan Flasch Artists' Book Collection at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago.
mysteryspotbooks.com
chadrutter.com

Are There Other Ways I Can Help?
Absolutely! If you like what we're doing, please tell other people about it! It takes just a couple of clicks to let other people know about this project on your social media site(s) of choice.

story:
Short Summary

I'm just a Russian girl who fell in love with figure skating several years ago and quickly discovered how much I loved taking photos at the events. Since then, I've been working hard to improve, visiting as many competitions as I can. Last season, I’ve been able to attend several events (including Lombardia Trophy 2018 and Rostelecom Cup 2018) as an official photographer. I've also upgraded my lens thanks to everyone who supported last year's campaign which was an overwhelming success. Most of all, I was happy to deliver both calendars and photos to so many people who seemed to really like it!

This season, I will have more opportunities for photography in an official capacity as well, but I still need to cover the travel & housing expenses. That’s where you come in!

 

My Goal and Your Rewards

My main goal this season is to photograph at two Grand Prix events (GP France and Rostelecom Cup) and 1-2 Challenger events. Luckily, I live in Moscow, so I will only need help attending the other competitions, i.e. travelling and accomodation expenses.
This is how the funding is going to be distributed:


    •    I'm planning around 20k RUB for GP France and 20k RUB for Challengers (~630 USD).
    •    Around 38k RUB (~600 USD) is what I'll need for printing the physical rewards.
    •    Around 22k RUB (~350 USD) is going towards shipping.
    •    About 5k RUB (~75 USD) + 25 USD (since I'm using a non-US bank account) will cover the platform fees.

 

As thanks for your contributions, I've prepared a range of rewards, including digital-only and physical! The highlights include:


    •    figure skating calendars with my favourite photos from the past seasons and the dates of the most important competitions coming up this season
    •    five special calendars dedicated to some popular skaters and my own favorite subjects: Yuzuru Hanyu, Shoma Uno, Wakaba Higuchi, Team Japan and Team Cricket Club
    •    an option for you to create your own, custom calendar made of any photos I have!
    •    your own special collection of photos of any skater or team participating at a competition I'm going to in 2019-2020 season (currently: Lombardia Trophy 2019, Grand Prix France 2019, Rostelecom Cup 2019, possibly more)
    •    a bundle of five 10x15 photo cards with any photos of your choosing.

 

Risks & Challenges

In case I don't reach my goal, I will still use the money to visit at least one of my planned competitions (probably GP France). I will still send out all the rewards, as well. I will continue to try and bring you the best photos I can, as much as I'm able to!


This is my second campaign! Last year I successfully raised funds to afford a new lens and sent out more than 40 calendars, as well as other digital and physical rewards. I have a trusted printing company and a more streamlined process of producing the calendars, so I am confident we'll be able to do this! I am always open for questions in the comments here or on my Twitter.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute directly, that's okay. Consider visiting my website, subscribing to my instagram account for the newest photos, retweeting photos I share on my Twitter account. And please share information about the campaign! If you want to translate this into other languages to share with more fans, I will be eternally grateful. Please get in touch on Twitter or send me an e-mail.

 

日本語

こんにちは！私はルダコヴァ ダリア (verit) です. このページを訪問していただきありがとうございます。
ロシアのフィギュアスケーティングの写真家です、さまざまなイベントへの旅を楽しみです、皆さんと写真をオンラインで共有しています。
私はより良くなり、正式な写真家になりたいです。 今シーズンは、もっとイベントに参加するにはあなたの助けが必要です。
あなたの助けを借りて、私はより良いフィギュアスケート写真家になることを目指しています。
応援よろしくお願いします！

 

中文

概貌

我是一名以专业摄影师为目标的、业余花样滑冰摄影师。我喜欢前往世界各地拍摄花样滑冰的相关照片，并把它们分享给大家。去年，我向不同国家的冰迷们寄出了40余本花滑日历。因此，今年我再次为大家带来独家的花滑日历，希望大家能帮助我前往更多的比赛进行拍摄。

 

短述

我只是个在几年前爱上花样滑冰的普通俄罗斯女孩，随后，我很快发现自己很喜欢在观赛时为选手拍摄照片。从那以后，我尽可能地前往更多的赛事现场拍摄。上个赛季，我有幸以官方摄像师的身份前往了一些比赛（包括2018年的Lombardia Trophy和2018年的大奖赛俄罗斯站）。感谢大家去年对我的支持，我得以更新我的摄像头。更重要的是，我很高兴自己能够把日历和相片带给这么多喜欢他们的人！
在新赛季中，我将有更多的机会拍摄专业的相片，但我仍然需要解决出行以及住宿的花费。因此，我在这里请求大家的帮助。

 

 我的目标以及大家的回报

我这赛季的主要目标是前往两个大奖赛分站赛（法国站和俄罗斯站）以及1～2个挑战赛拍摄照片。幸运的是，因为我就住在莫斯科，所以我只需要解决前往（除俄罗斯站外）其他比赛的支出，例如旅行费和住宿费。以下是这次集资的细则：

  • 我需要大约20k卢布前往法国站，以及20k左右卢布前往挑战赛（～630美元）
  • 大约38k卢布（～600美元）作为实体回报的印刷费
  • 大约22k卢布（～350美元）作为实体回报的邮寄费
  • 大约5k卢布（～75美元）+25美元（因为我使用的不是美国银行账户）的手续费

为感谢大家的帮助，我准备了电子版的以及实体的各种回报！这其中包括：

  • 花滑日历：包括我从以往赛季中精心挑选的照片以及新赛季中，重要比赛的日期；
  • 五种特别日历：包括人气选手以及一些我个人的偏爱：羽生结弦、宇野昌磨、樋口新葉、日本队以及蟋蟀俱乐部；
  • 订制日历：大家可以从我的照片中任意选择图片；
  • 照片集：2019-2020赛季中、任何参与到我会前往的比赛中的、选手或团队的照片（目前包括：2019年大奖赛法国站、俄罗斯站以及Lombardia Trophy，之后可能会有追加）；
  • 照片卡：5张，尺寸10*15，可以任意选择图片；

 

风险&挑战

即使集资没有达到我预设的目标，我也仍然会用这些钱前往至少一个我计划中的比赛（也许会是法国站）。我也仍然会寄出给大家的回报。我会继续尽可能地为大家带来更多的好照片！
这是我的第二个项目！去年，我成功集资更新了新的摄像头，并且寄出了40+的相册以及其余的电子/实体回报。我认识一个可靠的印刷公司，并会通过更加快捷而高效低制作日历，因此我有信心我们能够达成目标的！我会在评论区以及推特上回复大家的各种问题。

 

其他能帮到我的方式

如果你没有办法直接参与集资，那也没有关系。欢迎前往我的网站、通过订阅我的ins账户围观最新照片，或者在推特上转载我发表的图片。请将这个集资活动的相关资讯分享给更多的人！如果想将这些信息翻译成其他语言并分享给更多的冰迷，我会感激不尽的。请通过推特或邮件（asveriphoto@gmail.com）联络我。

 

Español

Vista General

Soy una fotógrafa amateur de patinaje sobre hielo, que busca convertirse en profesional. Amo viajar alrededor del mundo para tomar fotos de patinadores y compartirlas con los fans. El año pasado envíe mas de 40 calendarios por todo el mundo. Por eso, por segundo año consecutivo ofreceré calendarios exclusivos y a cambio, ¡puedes ayudarme a llegar a más competencias!

Resumen Corto

Soy solo una chica rusa que se enamoró del patinaje varios años atrás y que rápidamente descubrió cuanto amaba tomar fotos en los eventos. Desde entonces he estado trabajando duro para mejorar, yendo a todas las competencias posibles. La temporada pasada me fue posible asistir a varios eventos (incluyendo el Trofeo de Lombardia 2018 y la Copa Rostelecom 2018) como fotógrafa oficial. También he mejorado mi lente fotográfica gracias a todas las personas que apoyaron mi campaña el año pasado, la cuál fue un éxito abrumador. Sobretodo, estuve muy feliz por poder enviar calendarios y fotos a tantas personas que los apreciaron.

Esta temporada tendré mas oportunidades para fotografiar de manera oficial, pero aun así necesito cubrir los gastos de viaje y alojamiento para cada ocasión. ¡Aquí es donde puedes ayudarme!

Mi Objetivo y Sus Recompensas

Mi principal objetivo esta temporada es tomar fotografías en dos eventos Grand Prix (GP Francia y la Copa Rostelecom) y 1-2 eventos de la Serie Challenger. Por suerte vivo en Moscú, así que solo necesitaré ayuda para asistir al resto de las competencias, es decir, para gastos de viaje y alojamiento.
Los fondos recaudados serán distribuido de esta forma:

  • Alrededor de 20k RUB para el GP Francia y 20k RUB para eventos de la Serie Challenger (~630 USD).
  • Cerca de 38k RUB (~600 USD) para imprimir las recompensas en físico.
  • Alrededor de 22k RUB (~350 USD) serán destinados para envíos.
  • Cerca de 5k RUB (~75 USD) + 25 USD (ya que estoy usando una cuenta de banco fuera de EE. UU.) cubrirán las tarifas de la plataforma.


Para agradecer sus contribuciones he preparado una variedad de recompensas, ¡incluyendo versiones digitales y físicas! Los puntos destacados incluyen:

  • calendarios de patinaje con mis fotos favoritas de temporadas pasadas y las fechas de las competencias más importantes de la temporada en curso.
  • cinco calendarios especiales dedicados a patinadores populares y a mis sujetos fotográficos favoritos: Yuzuru Hanyu, Shoma Uno, Wakaba Higuchi, el equipo japonés y el equipo del Club Cricket.
  • iuna opción para crear tu propio calendario personalizado con cualquiera de las fotos de mi galería!
  • tu propia colección especial de fotos de cualquier patinador o equipo participante en alguna de las competencias a las que asistiré en la temporada 2019-2020 (por el momento: Trofeo de Lombardia, Grand Prix de Francia 2019, Copa Rostelecom 2019, posiblemente otras más)
  • un paquete de cinco tarjetas fotográficas de 10x15 pulgadas con las fotos de tu elección.


Riesgos & Retos

Aún en el caso de no alcanzar mi objetivo, usaré el dinero para asistir al menos a una de las competencias que tengo planeadas. Así mismo enviaré todas las recompensas.
¡Y continuaré tratando de brindarles las mejores fotos que pueda!

¡Ésta es mi segunda campaña! El año pasado reuní exitosamente los fondos necesarios para costear una nueva lente y envié más de 40 calendarios, así como otras recompensas en físico y digitales. Tengo una imprenta de confianza y un proceso simplificado para producir los calendarios, ¡así que confío que será posible lograr esto! Siempre estoy abierta a preguntas, ya sea aquí en los comentarios o en mi cuenta de Twitter.

Otras Formas de Ayudar


Está bien si no puedes contribuir directamente. Considera visitar my sitio web, suscribirte a mi cuenta de Instagram para ver las ultimas fotografías o compartir fotos que subo en mi cuenta de Twitter.
¡Y por favor comparte información de esta campaña! Si quieres traducir esto a otros lenguajes para poder compartirlo con más fans, estaré eternamente agradecida. Por favor contáctame en Twitter o manda un e-mail.

即使集资没有达到我预设的目标，我也仍然会用这些钱前往至少一个我计划中的比赛（也许会是法国站）。我也仍然会寄出给大家的回报。我会继续尽可能地为大家带来更多的好照片！这是我的第二个项目！去年，我成功集资更新了新的摄像头，并且寄出了40+的相册以及其余的电子/实体回报。我认识一个可靠的印刷公司，并会通过更加快捷而高效低制作日历，因此我有信心我们能够达成目标的！我会在评论区以及推特上回复大家的各种问题。
 
其他能帮到我的方式
如果你没有办法直接参与集资，那也没有关系。欢迎前往我的网站、通过订阅我的ins账户围观最新照片，或者在推特上转载我发表的图片。请将这个集资活动的相关资讯分享给更多的人！如果想将这些信息翻译成其他语言并分享给更多的冰迷，我会感激不尽的。请通过推特或邮件（asveriphoto@gmail.com）联络我。
 
Español
Vista GeneralSoy una fotógrafa amateur de patinaje sobre hielo, que busca convertirse en profesional. Amo viajar alrededor del mundo para tomar fotos de patinadores y compartirlas con los fans. El año pasado envíe mas de 40 calendarios por todo el mundo. Por eso, por segundo año consecutivo ofreceré calendarios exclusivos y a cambio, ¡puedes ayudarme a llegar a más competencias!Resumen CortoSoy solo una chica rusa que se enamoró del patinaje varios años atrás y que rápidamente descubrió cuanto amaba tomar fotos en los eventos. Desde entonces he estado trabajando duro para mejorar, yendo a todas las competencias posibles. La temporada pasada me fue posible asistir a varios eventos (incluyendo el Trofeo de Lombardia 2018 y la Copa Rostelecom 2018) como fotógrafa oficial. También he mejorado mi lente fotográfica gracias a todas las personas que apoyaron mi campaña el año pasado, la cuál fue un éxito abrumador. Sobretodo, estuve muy feliz por poder enviar calendarios y fotos a tantas personas que los apreciaron.Esta temporada tendré mas oportunidades para fotografiar de manera oficial, pero aun así necesito cubrir los gastos de viaje y alojamiento para cada ocasión. ¡Aquí es donde puedes ayudarme!Mi Objetivo y Sus RecompensasMi principal objetivo esta temporada es tomar fotografías en dos eventos Grand Prix (GP Francia y la Copa Rostelecom) y 1-2 eventos de la Serie Challenger. Por suerte vivo en Moscú, así que solo necesitaré ayuda para asistir al resto de las competencias, es decir, para gastos de viaje y alojamiento.Los fondos recaudados serán distribuido de esta forma:

Alrededor de 20k RUB para el GP Francia y 20k RUB para eventos de la Serie Challenger (~630 USD).
Cerca de 38k RUB (~600 USD) para imprimir las recompensas en físico.
Alrededor de 22k RUB (~350 USD) serán destinados para envíos.
Cerca de 5k RUB (~75 USD) + 25 USD (ya que estoy usando una cuenta de banco fuera de EE. UU.) cubrirán las tarifas de la plataforma.

Para agradecer sus contribuciones he preparado una variedad de recompensas, ¡incluyendo versiones digitales y físicas! Los puntos destacados incluyen:

calendarios de patinaje con mis fotos favoritas de temporadas pasadas y las fechas de las competencias más importantes de la temporada en curso.
cinco calendarios especiales dedicados a patinadores populares y a mis sujetos fotográficos favoritos: Yuzuru Hanyu, Shoma Uno, Wakaba Higuchi, el equipo japonés y el equipo del Club Cricket.
iuna opción para crear tu propio calendario personalizado con cualquiera de las fotos de mi galería!
tu propia colección especial de fotos de cualquier patinador o equipo participante en alguna de las competencias a las que asistiré en la temporada 2019-2020 (por el momento: Trofeo de Lombardia, Grand Prix de Francia 2019, Copa Rostelecom 2019, posiblemente otras más)
un paquete de cinco tarjetas fotográficas de 10x15 pulgadas con las fotos de tu elección.

Riesgos & RetosAún en el caso de no alcanzar mi objetivo, usaré el dinero para asistir al menos a una de las competencias que tengo planeadas. Así mismo enviaré todas las recompensas.¡Y continuaré tratando de brindarles las mejores fotos que pueda!¡Ésta es mi segunda campaña! El año pasado reuní exitosamente los fondos necesarios para costear una nueva lente y envié más de 40 calendarios, así como otras recompensas en físico y digitales. Tengo una imprenta de confianza y un proceso simplificado para producir los calendarios, ¡así que confío que será posible lograr esto! Siempre estoy abierta a preguntas, ya sea aquí en los comentarios o en mi cuenta de Twitter.Otras Formas de Ayudar
Está bien si no puedes contribuir directamente. Considera visitar my sitio web, suscribirte a mi cuenta de Instagram para ver las ultimas fotografías o compartir fotos que subo en mi cuenta de Twitter.¡Y por favor comparte información de esta campaña! Si quieres traducir esto a otros lenguajes para poder compartirlo con más fans, estaré eternamente agradecida. Por favor contáctame en Twitter o manda un e-mail.

story:
Over the past 18 months we have worked side by side with Peter to create a pack that will stand up to the rigors of travel and empower you to capture the moments that make life so incredible.  So after creating dozens of prototypes, flying halfway around the world to meet with manufacturing partners, and to the other side of the continent to brainstorm the development of these products with Peter, we are so excited with the finished products and can't wait to get them into your hands!

 Peter McKinnon is a Toronto based photographer & filmmaker. Peter is a coffee addict and has amassed a loyal following of creators on YouTube and Instagram. He has a passion for gear and is obsessed with things that work well to help him create better content every day. 

NOMATIC was born and raised on Crowd Funding. We have successfully funded 8 projects and have shipped over 100,000 products to customers all over the world. NOMATIC is quickly becoming a brand known for its highly functional bags and exceptional quality. Learn more at www.nomatic.com 

PRODUCT WARRANTY

Here at NOMATIC, we stand behind all of our products. Just register your product to activate your product's Lifetime Warranty. If we can't fix or repair a manufacture defect, we will replace the product, no questions asked.

Please note that scratches, scuffs, dents, and other blemishes that occur due to normal wear and tear of travels will not fall under the product warranty.  These marks are like badges of honor and should be something you are proud of.  Something that helps tell your travel stories.

RETURN POLICY

We offer a 30 day no risk return policy. If you are not 100% satisfied with the quality of the product within 30 days of receiving your order, simply send it back and we will refund you the product cost, no questions asked. But don't worry, we know you are going to love it!

CUSTOMS & DUTIES INFORMATION

DOMESTIC SHIPPING - To 30 Countries:

United States, Canada, and 28 EU Countries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom.

We have 3 warehouses worldwide that allow us to offer low-cost domestic shipping to the 30 countries listed above. Backers with a shipping address in any of these 30 countries will NOT have to pay any additional duties, sales tax, VAT, etc.

INTERNATIONAL SHIPPING - Rest of the World:

Backers from all other countries (apart from the 30 countries listed above) may have to pay additional import duties or other applicable taxes to the concerned authorities upon receipt of their goods - depending on the import policies of their respective countries. The duties and tax rates vary from country to country. If you wish to learn about the duties and taxes applicable to your shipment, you may want to check with the customs and border protection authority of your country.

Unfortunately, we do not ship to every country in the world. Due to logistical reasons we are unable to efficiently ship to every country. If your country is not listed as a country that we ship to, we suggest you find a freight forwarder or freight consolidator that specializes in shipping to your country. If you have any questions about this process, feel free to reach out to us.

SHIPPING POLICY

If our shipping carrier attempts delivery to you and the package returns to our warehouse (either because you’re not there, the wrong address was provided, or you moved without telling us), it will be the buyer's responsibility to pay the shipping fee to reship the order. When you receive your tracking number, please keep an eye out for the package.

(These images are of Pete testing early prototypes.)The smaller dividers fold and can be arranged in countless methods for endless customization.   Over the past 18 months we have worked side by side with Peter to create a pack that will stand up to the rigors of travel and empower you to capture the moments that make life so incredible.  So after creating dozens of prototypes, flying halfway around the world to meet with manufacturing partners, and to the other side of the continent to brainstorm the development of these products with Peter, we are so excited with the finished products and can't wait to get them into your hands!  Peter McKinnon is a Toronto based photographer & filmmaker. story:
***Because I've been asked a few times, CHILDREN are more than welcome to the photoshoot rewards. You can even have a children's mermaid phtooshoot party if you pledge enough. Please contact me for details. ***

I've always loved the ocean, and as a kid growing up in L.A.'s east-side, the stories of mermaids always fascinated me. Even though I was told they weren't "real", I always felt otherwise; the ocean was too deep and mysterious for man to really know the truth, there were too many stories all the way to ancient times for them to not be real.

As an adult, I haven't fully put that belief away, and as I've spent countless hours underwater; I've always been on the lookout for these mermaids and sirens, catching glimpses of their tails disappearing into the dark depths of the sea. ;)

This project is for a photo exhibition, inspired by images and stories of mermaids and muses. My models represent the strong mermaids of stories; their photos will symbolize different emotions, and use not only the tail that's seen in the video above, but fabrics and other props. They will not only be "mermaids", but also the muses in our creatives lives. Though they are thought as fantasy, that they don't exist in this world, I want to show that all of us have a mermaid, or merman, inside of us.

The gallery show is what I'm hoping to be Part 1 of a longer series that may include a photo book and possibly a film/documentary in the future.

I am a Los Angeles based photographer who is OBSESSED with being underwater, and would love to have this project come to fruition. With your pledge, you can help me put on a great exhibit and get yourself some beautiful art for your walls. Also, the opportunity to have an underwater shoot of your own; for yourself or a loved one, is available here, at a heavily discounted price from what I normally charge! You'll have a professional make-up artist to help bring out the mermaid, or merman, in you, and a beautiful print of your shoot!

The funds from this indiegogo project will go towards shooting more images for the project, expanding on the costumes, hiring a photoshop expert, and will help pay for the final printing and framing of the images before they're shown. They will be printed large, at a minimum of 30x40".

To me, mermaids have always represented freedom and joy, the happiness one finds in nature, the peace that being in the water can bring, and the serenity that surrounds you. The intent of my images is just that; to bring those emotions to the viewer, to have them feel that serenity, that peace, and joy that mermaids seem to have.

story:
*Vorweg: Bitte achtet darauf, eins der PERKS zu bestellen, anstatt einen Geldbetrag einzugeben. Sonst fehlt nämlich Eure Adresse und ich weiß nicht, wohin mit dem Buch!

 

Worum geht‘s?

TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER geht in die Dritte und letzte Runde!

Für alle, die den dritten Teil der TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER-Trilogie gerne in den Händen halten wollen und wissen möchten, wie die Story, das Tagebuch weiter geht – bestellt hier Euer Exemplar, denn das Buch kann es nur auf diese Weise geben!


Damit die Trilogie hübsch und perfekt zueinander passend im Regal steht, bleiben die Buchmaße und Seitenzahl exakt gleich: 240 bunte Seiten auf wunderschönem Offset-Papier und Softcover ohne Finish. Format: DIN A4. Die Story wird ebenfalls wieder mit der Schreibmaschine verfasst.

Warum soll ich jetzt schon bestellen und nicht einfach bis zum Release warten?

- Wenn nicht zumindest die Druckkosten hier per Vorbestellungen reinkommen, kommt das Buch leider erst gar nicht zustande.

- Die wunderbaren Pakete (Perks) mit Original-Dia der Reise, Erwähnung im Buch, persönliche Postkarte aus den USA, das signierte Polaroid-Original, Foto-Abzüge, Making-Of, Bier mit mir, etc. wird es später nicht mehr geben.


Ich werde auch diesmal wieder am laufenden Band in Videos und Posts über die Entwicklungen berichten, Bilder und einen Haufen Liebe teilen. Wir sorgen für geballte Vorfreude, bis das dritte Ding da ist! Man kauft also kein Buch – man bucht eine Reise. Auch hier immer tägliche News:

TALES-Facebookgruppe

Höchstwahrscheinlich wird das Design- & Postproduktion-Team, wie auch beim ersten und zweiten Teil, wieder aus dem wunderbaren Bureau Malte Metag und der phänomenalen Benjamin Pezo Postproduction bestehen. 

 

Und nun noch ein bisschen Hintergrund:

Ich heiße Ben Bernschneider, bin Fotograf aus Hamburg (www.benbernschneider.com) und habe 2015 ein Bild/Wort-Werk namens TALES OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER und 2016 den Nachfolger RETURN OF AN AMERICAN SUMMER veröffentlicht. Wer sich im Netz einlesen will, bitte sehr:

http://www.playboy.de/girls/fotograf-ben-bernsc...

http://hiphiphooray.de/blick-ins-buch-tales-of-...

http://www.interview.de/kunst/fotografie/bildba...

http://zeitjung.de/tales-of-an-american-summer-...

http://www.zuhloo.de/ben-bernschneider-tales-of...

http://coultique.com/photographie/diamondtimes-...

http://hiphiphooray.de/who-the-fk-is-ben-bernsc...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6dT98LFsyf4

 

Wann kann ich mein Exemplar in den Händen halten?

Der Produktions- und Schreibzeitraum wäre diesmal von August bis November, Editing und Postproduction im Dezember/Januar, Druck im Februar und noch vor dem Frühling liegen wir uns alle betrunken mit dem Buch in den Armen.


Ich finde das ganze hier cool, habe aber kein Bock auf ein Buch.

Kein Thema – wir wäre es, wenn du einem Bruder aushilfst und diese crowdfunding Kampagne teilst?! Bei Facebook oder whatever. Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieb haben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3

Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.

Liebe – Euer Ben

Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.

Wäre super. Und ich würde dich dafür lieb haben. Und du kannst ganz toll die Tools nutzen, die IndieGoGo dafür bereit gestellt hat. DANKE für JEDE Hilfe! <3Wenn Ihr Fragen habt, könnt ihr mich Tag und Nacht unter mail@benbernschneider.com  erreichen.Liebe – Euer Ben

story:
MY EIGHT-YEAR INTERNATIONAL PHOTO PROJECT WAS GALLERY AND MUSEUM BOUND WHEN A THIEF STRUCK. NOW IT'S DEAD IN THE WATER.  PLEASE HELP ME REPLACE LOST PHOTO GEAR.

WHO I AM

I am John Crosley, an amateur photographer mostly for 40 years.

Long ago I worked for Associated Press and magazines.   I photographed the Viet Nam war dodging bullets and mortars, photographed President Nixon, illustrated news stories, and shot photos of famous people at one time, in my 20s.

My photo work now is strictly amateur.  I do it for love of what I do.

I once worked with Pulitzer greats, but no matter how you sliced it, it was a job.

I take photos now for the love of photography; I haven't worked as a professional for over 35 years.

I did this on advice after a meeting with photo great Henri Cartier-Bresson in San Francisco.  His gave me good advice. I since have photographed for love of what I do, never as a job.

No one can tell me what photos to take or how to take them.  I have no one to please but my own artistic sensibilities.   My work is in a special photo trust for safekeeping, not sale, and for eventual exhibition and related use.

I have not sold my work for many years -- if I ever do, it will be through my trust and galleries.

THE PROJECT

I have been involved for most of the past decade on a project to document in interesting and artistic ways lives of people in Eastern Europe -- primarily Ukraine and Russia -- and contrast in photos those lives with similar photos of people in the United States. 

The photo work is about 2/3 finished, but disaster struck and halted my project; a thief stole all my photo gear.

MY REPUTATION

My work is known by many photo aficionados worldwide,  There have been tens of millions of 'views' of my photos on the Internet - maybe even a hundred milllion views or more.

Blogs worldwide link to my posted work.

I post on four sites:

Photo.net

FLICKR

Photocritiq.com

Photobucket.com

Here is a link to 80 representative photos on FLICKR (mature viewers only, please)

http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncrosley/page4/
 
THE PROJECT OF MY PASSION THAT THEFT INTERRUPTED

I have been passionately involved in my self-assigned and self-funded international photography project for the past eight years.  

That project has been the love of my life.

The loss was uninsured.

That theft broke my heart.

This project is my 'family', and it seems like I am losing a family member.

If some of my basic high grade photo equipment is not replaced, I must give up my gallery-bound and museum-bound photo project, and my last eight years' work will seem largely wasted which to me is unthiunkable.

It has been the reason I get up in the morning and go to bed at night, -- those nights I don't stay up all night working on this project.

I've posted here a gallery of over 50 representative photos for you to look at and evaluate.  I hope you find them interesting and viewable.

In my photo trust I have built an archive of over a half million photos, now waiting curating, then I hope exhibition. 

My work is followed by hundreds or thousands of photographers and aficionados   worldwide.

When I post a photo on the Internet a few hundred to as many as a quarter million people might see any particular photo, just on one site where I post.

On one Internet photo site with 800,000+ registered members, I'm named among the top 50 'most interesting' members.  There are just shy of 16,000 comments tallied under my photos on that site. (including mine in reply)

HOW THE LOSS HAPPENED

I once was pretty well off; now I live on a small fixed income.

I used my money to self-finance my project including buying some of the world's  best photo equipment. 

I sold my seaside house in California to finance this project.

One day after traveling 4 days, 12,000 miles, and visiting eight cities on two continents, I arrived on the West Coast at a major airport.

I grabbed a cab in a fatigued stupor, and asked to be taken to a car I kept in an economy parking area nearby.

The cab driver saw my stupor and my nodding off, put my bags, including my bulging camera bags loaded with expensive gear, into his trunk and off we went.

We arrived at my car, and while I drowsed on his front seat, he offered to transfer the bags to my car trunk.

I paid, thanked him, and drove off to a motel.

Later, a long ways away and the next day, I opened my car trunk and the bags with bulging with pro grade cameras, lenses and other photo equipment were not there. 

The trunk had not been tampered with. 

Thinking it might have been a mistake, I called the cab company on the receipt the cabbie had given me; the card he gave me belonged to a cab drive who had been deported and was of a different race the cab company told me.

It sunk in -- I had been stolen from.  The dispatcher said 'you ain't never gonna see your stuff again'.

He was right.

Fingerprints could not be lifted off the card; my hands had smuged them.  It was a 'borrowed' card, used as a ruse.

'MAKING DO' WON'T WORK

I've tried to borrow a camera and 'make do' but without high quality equipment, no matter how hard I try, the image quality is not good enough for exhibition in galleries and museums, which is my target. 

The owner of the borrowed camera also wants it back.

I soon will be entirely camera-less and cannot afford another, let alone two of the high quality cameras I need plus at least three professional lenses.

Much, much more was stolen, but I do not expect to 'get whole' here with this solicitation, just get enough for my basic needs.

Galleries and museums require highest image quality for their exhibited images, and that means photos I produce must be highest quality made with top notch professional equipment with no excuses.

I am asking now for just enough to get my project going again, keeping account my goal is to produce highest quality photos for exhibition, not just on the Internet but printed LARGE and for galleries and museums, to be viewed I hope well  beyond my lifetime.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

Taking photos intended to be exhibited hopefullly for hundreds of years and to be a part of history requires special care and special equipment.   It's not cheap but this time I promise never to let my hands off my gear. 

Lenses need large apertures for maximum light gathering in dim light plus sharpness and greatest resolving power, with vibration reduction where appropriate to get the best chance at the next-to-impossible shot.  

I need equipment that works well while I try and often get the 'impossisible photo' under most trying circumstances.   I do well under most adverse conditions -- rain, snow, fog, wind, near darkness AND I OFTEN GET THAT SHOT.  I cannot do that if equipment is not top notch.

An assortment of three pro lenses from widest angle to telephoto is needed for the way I shoot.  That's a minimal but workable requirement.  I am a very heavy, varied, and productive shooter. 

I'll be happy, however with whatever your generosity brings me with no hard feelings no matter what this campaign produces.  Bless anyone generous enough to give anything or even consider it.

To be worthy, a camera should be capable of taking a number of frames per second to capture the 'just so' moment, and also be compatible with all lenses made by the manufacturer.  It should have a very sensitive sensor for low light shooting and be pro rugged; I'm often in crowds or in tough situations.  Rain, ice and snow will ground non pro grade cameras, and I shoot in worst weather conditions.

I prefer and know Nikon equipment and know how to adjust it 'on the fly', rapidly, which is required for the way I shoot, and I'd prefer Nikon equipment.  I'd consider other brands.

I shoot quickly -- often within a fraction of a second --very often in lowest light, even frequently at night.  I get to know my equipment and explore the furthest bounds of its capabilities.  That's the magic of the best equipment; it produces under the harshest circumstances when no one expects that a photo can be produced, and sometimes those photos can be stunning.

Although I lost several cameras, just the Nikon D3s, costs well over $3,500.  Each pro lens costs between $1,000 to $2,500.  I addition, I lost a Canon pro video camera that costs about $3,500.

POSTING AND REPOSTING BY YOU WILL HELP TOO

Link this site to your FaceBook account, post it to your Tumblr, Tweet it up, or e-mail it to your friends in support of my project if you can, and I'll be ever so grateful --  every little bit helps. 

SUBJECT OF A DOCUMENTARY

I was subject of a documentary in the making last year that emphasized my shooting and street techniques, and it may start up again if it gets the funding.  That project is on hiatus now while the producer seeks additional funds.

I used their equipment during filming preparations, but it was a poor fit, unfamiliar, and their cameras and lenses no longer are available to me in any case.

I now live on a subsistence, fixed income and cannot afford replacements.

WHAT I NEED TO CONTINUE MY PROJECT

I usually carry two cameras, one high end camera. a digital SLR pro grade camera carrying a wide angle to moderate angle zoom of professsional caliber for working 'in close' with people and crowds.  

Highest quality requires I shoot FX (full frame) instead of DX (crop sensor).

At the same time, I generally carry a second high end SLR professioanl camera, this one with a large, heavy and super high quality 70-200 mm Vibration Reduction f. 2.8 zoom telephoto which is essential for some of my very best shots in low light. 

The majority of those shots in the gallery here would not have been possible if I had ordinary, consumer equipment.  (See photos in gallery attached)

The longer zoom lens allows me to shoot from farther away and also 'compress' subjects to make intersting juxtapositions.

I use a third, mid-range, zoom with a large aperture, interchangeably, on one or the other camera, and so also need a middle range zoom, good enough to use on a full-format (FX) camera, for portraits and mid-range photos -- in this case a 24-70 mm f 2.8 zoom, of highest quality glass.

Museums and galleries have no need these days to show or acquire work made with equipment which is less than the absolute best or which produces less than stellar image quality.

WHAT YOU CAN DO

Please help me replace some small part of my stolen photo equipment so I can continue my nearly decade-long project, tell the very interesting and artful stories that my photos tell, and hopefully have my photos end up in galleries and museums worldwide.

MY PHOTOS ARE CONTEMPORARY HISTORY ALREADY IN PARTS OF THE WORLD

I think in Russia and Ukraine already my images of daily life are considered by some aficionados a part of their contemporary history and culture. 

There, I'm a very well known photographer, especially in Ukraine, Europe's largest country.  Regrettably times in Ukraine are very tough; average wages are about $100 a month for many.  Ukrainians are generous and would be natural donors, but few have more than subsistence income or even credit cards to donate with, so as an American I must look to Americans and first world country photographers and philanthropist to aid my quest.

I BELIEVE IN MY OWN WORK AND HAVE 'PUT MY MONEY WHERE MY MOUTH IS'

To fund my project, I  sold my California seaside home and have been taking photos world wide since.  Funds have dried up with the ecoonomy, and now with this theft, I've suffered a huge loss I cannot overcome. 

I am handicapped somewhat, but not enough to prevent me from doing this work.

This work identifies me to much of the photographic community. 

Some photographers even write of a 'Crosley photograph' when they see my work because, they say, much of  my work is distinctive and identifiable to me.

Help return me to the streets of Seattle, Portland, San Francisco Los Angeles, and elsewhere in the US plus Kyiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Odessa, Lvov and elsewhere in Ukraine then Moscow and other places in Russia, taking artful,, insightful, one-of-a-kind,  hopefully INTERESTING and often socially aware photos for my project.


It is a project that may end up not only in photo archives but in history books as a reminder of contemorary culture at the outset of the 21st Century in Europe and the USA.

The project has the ultimate goal of showing contrasting cultures and showcasing those contrasts in photo books, galleries, texts and museums.

I have made it my life's work.


Will you help return me to that work, please?  I would be so grateful.

CRITICS PRAISE MY WORK

One prominent critic, a Lucie Award winner (Photography's highest award), told me three years ago that when my project was ready, he would help me at no charge get my work into world class gallleries and museums, many run by his friends and colleagues -- the giltterati of the photo exhibition world.

He offered; I didn't ask. 

Regrettably he's now disabled and unavailable.

My passion has eaten through my savings, but I have in return one half million photos in the Crosley photo trust waiting to be curated and the best exhibited, but the project is not ready for that yet.  The project is halted now indefinitely until I can continue shooting.

Replacement equipment and funds are also bound to be placed in that trust.

Luckily, to carry my work to completion, I need to replace only a small part of my enormous loss.

WHERE YOU CAN FIND MY WORK

 You can use Google.com to find my name and link to my work.
 
Just search 'John  Crosley' and press 'enter'.
 
Also try 'John Crosley photographer'
 
'John Crosley photography'
 
'John Crosley comment'
 
'John Crosley work'
 
'John Crosley comment'
 
If you wish to see how I'm regarded in Ukraine and Russia, try
 
'Google.com.ru' (Russian Google) and enter my name.
 
In Ukraine:   'Google.com.ua'   and emter my name.
 
In addition to the four Internet sites above, so many blogs I've lost count also feature my photos.  Sometimes Google lists all my photos, remarks, references and references by others on pages and pages of listings -- when they do that it takes about 100 Google pages at ten listings to the page to do the listing.
 
I also need a high end, three sensor Canon video camera.
 
PRIZE WINNING
 
My work is prize winning; I won the 'Blue Chip' Award for outstanding journalism with my photos at one time. 
 
My photos have won other prizes as well.
 
I'm an amateur, not a pro; I'm not for hire and have not been a pro in recent memory. 
 
A FAMILIAR FACE ON TWO CONTINENTS
 
I've become a familiar person on the streets in certain areas of Los Angele, also in  Portland, San Francisco Bay Area, and Seattle as well as Kiev, Dnipropetrovs, Lvov, and Odessa, Ukraine, as I search for telling photos that show 'ordinary people' doing sometimess extraordinary  and/or surreal things, and sometimes just  being themselves in interesting, surreal,  unusual, and often very INTERESTING and artful ways.

HELP ME CONTINUE MY PROJECT

Please help me continue my project - the love of my life -- my one great passion.

Please help me get quality replacement equipment, so I can continue my life work.
 
I live on an extremely limited income and could never hope to replace this equipment without donations.
 
Please help!
 
IF THE GOAL IS EXCEEDED
 
If my goal is exceeded, thank you for your generosity!  
 
Any excess is expected to be dedicated to financing this project, with any extra used both to make archival quality prints for exhibition and to acquire more needed equipment, all in trust.
 
With much thanks.
 
john
story_txt:
MY EIGHT-YEAR INTERNATIONAL PHOTO PROJECT WAS GALLERY AND MUSEUM BOUND WHEN A THIEF STRUCK. NOW IT'S DEAD IN THE WATER.  PLEASE HELP ME REPLACE LOST PHOTO GEAR.
WHO I AM
I am John Crosley, an amateur photographer mostly for 40 years.
Long ago I worked for Associated Press and magazines.   I photographed the Viet Nam war dodging bullets and mortars, photographed President Nixon, illustrated news stories, and shot photos of famous people at one time, in my 20s.
My photo work now is strictly amateur.  I do it for love of what I do.
I once worked with Pulitzer greats, but no matter how you sliced it, it was a job.
I take photos now for the love of photography; I haven't worked as a professional for over 35 years.
I did this on advice after a meeting with photo great Henri Cartier-Bresson in San Francisco.  His gave me good advice. I since have photographed for love of what I do, never as a job.
No one can tell me what photos to take or how to take them.  I have no one to please but my own artistic sensibilities.   My work is in a special photo trust for safekeeping, not sale, and for eventual exhibition and related use.
I have not sold my work for many years -- if I ever do, it will be through my trust and galleries.
THE PROJECT
I have been involved for most of the past decade on a project to document in interesting and artistic ways lives of people in Eastern Europe -- primarily Ukraine and Russia -- and contrast in photos those lives with similar photos of people in the United States. 
The photo work is about 2/3 finished, but disaster struck and halted my project; a thief stole all my photo gear.
MY REPUTATION
My work is known by many photo aficionados worldwide,  There have been tens of millions of 'views' of my photos on the Internet - maybe even a hundred milllion views or more.
Blogs worldwide link to my posted work.
I post on four sites:
Photo.net
FLICKR
Photocritiq.com
Photobucket.com
Here is a link to 80 representative photos on FLICKR (mature viewers only, please)
http://www.flickr.com/photos/johncrosley/page4/

 
THE PROJECT OF MY PASSION THAT THEFT INTERRUPTEDI have been passionately involved in my self-assigned and self-funded international photography project for the past eight years.  
That project has been the love of my life.
The loss was uninsured.
That theft broke my heart.
This project is my 'family', and it seems like I am losing a family member.
If some of my basic high grade photo equipment is not replaced, I must give up my gallery-bound and museum-bound photo project, and my last eight years' work will seem largely wasted which to me is unthiunkable.
It has been the reason I get up in the morning and go to bed at night, -- those nights I don't stay up all night working on this project.
I've posted here a gallery of over 50 representative photos for you to look at and evaluate.  I hope you find them interesting and viewable.
In my photo trust I have built an archive of over a half million photos, now waiting curating, then I hope exhibition. 
My work is followed by hundreds or thousands of photographers and aficionados   worldwide.
When I post a photo on the Internet a few hundred to as many as a quarter million people might see any particular photo, just on one site where I post.
On one Internet photo site with 800,000+ registered members, I'm named among the top 50 'most interesting' members.  There are just shy of 16,000 comments tallied under my photos on that site. (including mine in reply)

story:
Our Story

 Macro photography is  close up photography usually of very small subjects. It takes a lot of patience, a lot of time and mostly brings about disappointing results.  Nevertheless, once in a while it rewards you with a glance  to an unseen world that exists right beneath  your feet..


I have already been  working in this project for the past 2 years and have more than 1000 photos of insects of all kind...My goal is that, at somepoint,i will have enough photos for an educational database and for the publication of a book .Unfortunately, with the equipment that i currently  own, it is quite difficult and that's why i need your help .After only 2 years my camera has already 100.000 clicks so every shot that i take may be the last leaving me without the most important thing for a photographer.

Here is a small sample of my work so far ,http://xeneras.deviantart.com/gallery/24164201 . Furthermore  I am a portrait photographer and you can see my work here http://xeneras.deviantart.com/ .If you like my photography buy a perk give me work and in that way help me continue to shoot..



The Impact

There are ecological changes around the world as we speak.. For me it is fascinating and frightening that most of the creatures that i capture with my camera in their natural environment  will disappear for ever..My main concern is to have a large public database for the next generations to come, in order for them to be able to acknowledge these unknown to most of us creatures and share my passion for them with the rest of the world..

I am also planning the creation of a non profit magazine for environmental awareness and the publication of a book about insects. But since my country is in a financial crisis, as you may probably know, it  will take a while in order to be able to afford the printing costs.

What You Get

1)Anyone that decides to help will have my gratitude because it is unusual and commendable to help complete strangers accomplish their dreams...

2)Also, i have  quite a popular website  the 2 years I have shared my work and in which i will create a special thanks section where all the people that helped me will be presented.

3)If you prefer  a print, the printed photos of your choice from my gallery will be mailed by post. Eitherwise, you can send photos to be retouched by me and then sent back to you, in a digital form of the highest quality available (quality depends on the file that you will send me).

4)I would gladly answer any questions you have about macro or portrait photography. 

5)Last but not least for residents of Greece, or for those who  are visiting Greece i offer photo shooting sessions according to your individual personality that will last about 3 hours. The result, will be 10 photos edited and printed from your photo session ..Thank you all in advance!



What We Need 

 The camera i need is  a EOS 5D Mark II ( costs about 2200â‚¬) and i will have the speed and the quality needed for  such difficult subjects..The lens i am going for is the EF 100mm f/2.8L IS USM (costs about 1000â‚¬). Most importantly I need the MT-24EX MACRO RING FLASH ( costs about 900â‚¬) that enables me to shoot  at any given light condition. Also i want to purchase several filters for the lenses(cost about 400 â‚¬) and equipment that will allow me to shoot during rain or snow(cost 300 â‚¬)..These are just the basics...Everything else  will go to the creation of an indoor studio specialized for insects..

I know  this is over optimistic since few people share the passion for these funny looking creatures, but everything that can come out of this will be a great help  for me and i need it in order to  continue with this task ..If I don't meet the target here, I will try to find other ways to finance the  purchase of at least the camera and of course the flash ring since it's the most important missing part so far and surely it would be a big help for my project until the other upgrades are made.




Donating / Contributing

Even though the donations are shown in US dollars it is just as easy too make donations from  any other country using Paypal or directly with your debit or credit card.

If you want to use Paypal you can pay as a 'guest' on Paypal so there is no need to have or open an account with them.

Share this with your friend using the sharing tools and help this project continue.Spreading the word can be just as powerful as a donation ..

portrait photographer and you can see my work here http://xeneras.deviantart.com/ .If you like my photography buy a perk give me work and in that way help me continue to shoot..

 
The Impact

There are ecological changes around the world as we speak.. For me it is fascinating and frightening that most of the
creatures that i capture with my camera in their natural environment  will
disappear for ever..My main concern is to have a large public database for the next
generations to come, in order for them to be able to acknowledge these unknown
to most of us creatures and share my passion for them with the rest of the world..
I am also planning the creation of a non profit magazine for environmental
awareness and the publication of a book about insects. But since my country is in
a financial crisis, as you may probably know, it  will take a while in order to be able to
afford the printing costs.

What You Get

1)Anyone that decides to help will have my gratitude
because it is unusual and commendable to help complete strangers accomplish their dreams...2)Also, i have  quite a popular website  the 2 years I have shared my work and in which i
will create a special thanks section where all the people that helped me will
be presented. 3)If you prefer  a print, the
printed photos of your choice from my gallery will be mailed by post. Eitherwise,
you can send photos to be retouched by me and then sent back to you, in a
digital form of the highest quality available (quality depends on the file that
you will send me). 4)I would gladly answer any questions you have about macro or
portrait photography. 5)Last but not least for residents of Greece, or for those
who  are visiting Greece i offer photo shooting sessions according to your
individual personality that will last about 3 hours. The result, will be 10
photos edited and printed from your photo session ..Thank you all in advance!

What We Need 

 The camera i need is  a EOS 5D Mark II ( costs about 2200â‚¬) and i
will have the speed and the quality needed for  such difficult subjects..The lens i am going
for is the EF 100mm f/2.8L IS USM (costs about 1000â‚¬). Most importantly I
need the MT-24EX MACRO RING FLASH ( costs about 900â‚¬) that enables me to
shoot  at any given light condition. Also i want to purchase several
filters for the lenses(cost about 400 â‚¬) and equipment that will allow me to
shoot during rain or snow(cost 300 â‚¬)..These are just the basics...Everything else
 will go to the creation of an indoor studio specialized for
insects..
I know  this is over optimistic since few people share the passion for
these funny looking creatures, but everything that can come out of this will be
a great help  for me and i need it in order to  continue with this
task ..If I don't meet the target here, I will try to find
other ways to finance the  purchase of at least the camera and of course the flash ring since it's
the most important missing part so far and surely it would be a big help for my
project until the other upgrades are made.
Donating / Contributing
Even
 though the donations are shown in US dollars it is just as easy too 
make donations from  any other country using Paypal or directly
 with your debit or credit card.
If you want to use Paypal you can pay as a 'guest' on Paypal so there is no need to have or open an account with them.
Share this with your friend using the sharing tools and help this project continue.Spreading the word can be just as powerful as a donation
..

story:
Summary

My love for photography started when I was young. I enjoyed taking pictures of not just my friends but also the outside world.  In particular, I loved to find the beauty in simple objects that often get obscured in day-to-day life.

As I got older, the enthusiasm and support from others gave me the confidence to pursue photography professionally. Soon the work for weddings, family and other portraiture began to be a regular thing. While I thoroughly enjoy working with others and bringing out their character in photographs, I’ve recently realized that my real love lies in continuing my art photography at a professional level.  In my work, I want to show others the beauty and intrigue present in even the most commonplace things.

In the long-term, I would love to travel the world and document and share that experience with you via photography. For now, I continue to document what I see around me and am excited to show my work at a professional level in my first gallery opening.

In short, as a contributor you will be helping me to begin to achieve these dreams.

The Project
My passion and skill as a photographer has grown immensely over the last ten years and I would like to make the leap into the world of professional art photography. My upcoming gallery show and the purchase of new camera equipment will help me to do this.


What We Need

$5000:

-Approximately $1,500 will go to the gallery opening that includes: prints, framing, supplies for the space and an opening reception.

-Approximately $3,500 will go to new camera equipment that includes: Professional Canon camera, lenses and various accessories. 

What You Get

$5.00: A personal e-mail thank-you + gallery thank-you

$10.00: A home-made thank-you photo card + gallery thank-you

$20.00: Pack of 2 blank photo cards + gallery thank-you

$50.00: Pack of 4 cards + gallery thank-you

$75.00: Matted 8X10 + 4 cards + gallery thank-you

$100.00: Matted 11x14 + 4 cards + gallery thank-you

$200.00 Matted 8X10, 11X14 + 4 cards + gallery thank-you

$500.00 All of the above plus a personal or family photo shoot.

More than $500, all of the above + with the help of a few friends, we will recreate your favorite SCENE from a movie. Let's keep it PG-13. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially you can still help!  Just let others know about my campaign. Easy enough. Thank you!

story:
Big news! I have been awarded a scholarship by the International Center of Photography (ICP) to participate in a 2-week Bookmaking Masterclass this May with Sandra van der Doelen and Teun van der Heijden - the premiere photobook editors/designers around.

Those who know me well will have some idea of what this means. When I first arrived to Guatemala in June 2004 to work in the human rights field, it was supposed to be for one year.

Afterwards, I felt such a strong need to document what I had experienced that I came back in 2006 to start a documentary photography project – of which I knew nothing about. The idea was always to document two main issues: the post war processes, what has become “Life After Genocide”, and the conflicts between rural/indigenous communities and extractive industries. This latter project I’ve titled “This Land is Ours”.

Twelve years later, innumerable stumbling blocks and lots of support from friends, family and colleagues, I am still here. My goal was always to leave a visual testimony of these years that could at least attempt to complement the legacies of Jean-Marie Simon in the 80s and Jonathan Moller in the 90s/early 2000s. Huge task considering the amazing and historically priceless visual material they produced.

So, this workshop is a huge step in my attempt to achieve this goal. I believe the time is right to think about wrapping up these two projects, and perhaps even my time in Guatemala, in the near future. I also believe it is not too outlandish to think both projects could be combined into one book. Let’s see what the experts think…

Meanwhile, the realities of everyday life as a freelancer and a father are brutal. Getting the scholarship for the workshop is wonderful, but taking the time off work to do it is not. Hence, I am setting up a print sale in order to fund the extra US $1500 I need for materials, travel & housing expenses.

I am offering 5x5 and 12x12 prints of my black and white photos from Guatemala. These are from the same series that won 1st place in the POY Latinamerica contest in 2015 - all taken with iPhones.

All images will be printed in a metallic paper. They look great!

I can’t thank Alison Morley enough for once again believing in my work. It means so much to receive this scholarship – my second one for an ICP masterclass.

Thank you everyone who has supported my work all these years and this is just one step closer to what seemed like an impossible dream in 2006.

 

I am offering:

  • One 5x5 photograph: US $15
  • Set of two 5x5 photographs: US $25
  • Set of three 5x5 photographs: US $35
  • One 12x12 photograph: US $40
  • Set of two 12x12 photographs: US $70
  • Set of three 12x12 photographs: US $100

Shipping costs:

  • Guatemala: Free. I will hand deliver.
  • USA: US $5 flat regardless of how many prints are ordered.
  • Canada: US $8 flat free regardless of how many prints are ordered.
  • Europe: US $13 flat free regardless of how many prints are ordered.
  • Rest of World: US $16 flat free regardless of how many prints are ordered.

 

Here are some of the photos that can be selected as perks:

 

Here are some of the photos I am offering as perks. You get to select the ones you want:
https://mimundo.photoshelter.com/…/2018-05…/G0000GuQq1XxDW38

But if you want any other photo from my archive, that is possible too. We can figure out which photos you want after the perk is selected.

 

Everyone who buys a print or contributes will be thanked by name in the book... if and when it becomes a reality. :-)

story:
Kat Attack Photography is currently working to produce a unique series of photographs, which will be composed into a stunning, hardcover coffee-table book. "Lucha Diabolica- Boobs, Masks, Mayhem" will reveal a wide variety of striking female nude portraits, donning only the iconic Luchador mask. Due to the book’s focus on body diversity, women of all shapes, sizes, ages, colors, and cultures will be depicted.

The entirety of the money that is raised for this project will be used to fund travel to diverse locations (ensuring participation from a wide variety of subjects), as well as to develop and produce the book.

It costs money to edit, copyedit, typeset, and design a book—even before you actually print and ship the copies—and photography books require the right kind of paperstock and printing expertise to show the photos in their best light. The printing alone costs approximately $16,000. With enough backers and support I can do this. I am NOT printing, publishing, and selling this book for profit. I wanted to create this project for all people, women and men included, as a "Thank you for being you. You kick ass the way you are, and let's share that!"

***Please note that there is no minimum when it comes to donating, as we are grateful for contributions of any size. ***

"REAL WOMEN ARE FAT. AND THIN. AND BOTH, AND NEITHER, AND OTHERWISE."- Hanne Blan

story:
Hello everyone!

It is I, Brittany Markert, photographer, darkroom printer and storyteller behind In Rooms. The next installment, a 2 year body of photographic work is complete and designed to be released in 100 pages for you all to enjoy. I created this campaign because I need your help to fund the deposit to produce the books.

Why are you here? Why should you help this campaign?

(if you already know, skip down past #5, otherwise continue and indulge!)

1.  LOVE. You love my work already, you love me, you love the people in my work. You desire to own my work in it's entirety in one little place for you to enjoy at your leisure. Imagine, you can pet each page, kiss them, sit on them, do whatever your heart desires with all my work! 

2. CRAFT. You are a connoisseur of photography and appreciate the medium of analog photography, darkroom printing and black and white film. You desire to support a project in which every image was produced by hand, from the pre-limanery sketches, the crank of the Hasselblad and squeegeeing the final print in the darkroom. 

3. SOUL. You seek an artist with intention. An artist that pours their soul into every detail of their work. You are tired of the mediocrity everywhere and open to an experience that may transport you to another world, that may bring you to tears, that may arouse you, that may terrify you and beyond... 

4. AESTHETIC. Wallpapers from 1920's New Orleans, decaying abandoned schools, broken victorian dolls, old time beauty, rotting mental asylums... You want to find yourself in another world, each page rich with texture and nostalgia of another time and place. The comfort alone of escaping the modern world alone pushes you In Rooms. 

5. INTELLECT. The study of the human mind, peering and probing deep inside the locked doors of our inner secrets excites you. You have an interest to observe the mind, splayed raw and open in front of you, to further your studies of the human condition. Perhaps you love Jungian Psychology, Jung's Shadow Work? This is the book for you!

Will you join me In Rooms?

Is it a dream, fantasy or nightmare?

In Rooms Volume 2 (2016-2017)  takes readers on an intimate and erotic psychological journey into the mind of identifying as a woman, investigating fear, desire, death, mental health, sexuality, love,  gender and identity. The story is deeply personal, created through the intense confrontation of my inner dialogue, shadow self, and minds of my subjects. While personal, it was my intention to tap into the collective unconscious in the hopes that the story is not my own, not 'hers', not all women, but each of ours. Through an observation of this pain, struggle, beauty & resolution may we liberate our minds, find peace within ourselves and in the most simplest of pleasures, feel something, a sense of stimulation or joy in order to carry forward.   

In chronological order, accompanied with hand-written text, experience photography in a realm between literature and film, as a medium to communicate a surreal diary-like narrative. In the last section, readers experience an unpublished diary self portrait series with hand-written entries, sketches and contact sheets. This photo book provides viewers with the opportunity to juxtapose the artist's work with the artist's mind as a psychological study into creation of art and the human experience. 

In Rooms Artist Statement HERE

Press on In Rooms HERE

Social Media HERE

Directed & Printed by Brittany Markert

The content of this book is a mixture of self portraiture and collaborative work. I would not have been able to communicate this narrative without the contributions of my incredible cast

Cast Includes: Shelbie Dimond, John Zarsky, Brittany Markert, Marianna Rothen, Koko Bode, Hollie Witchey, Elisabeth O’Driscoll, James Jimenez, Alexandra O’Driscoll, Jim Whitman, Toybox Theatre, Lucy Castle, Candice Guttman, May Jane Fairbanks, Josh Darnell, Colleen Darnell

Inspirations for this project include: Anais Nin, Catherine Robbe Grillet, The Yellow Wallpaper, Francesca Woodman, Diane Arbus, Vivian Maier, Claude Cahun, Joel Peter Witkin, Hans Bellmer, Maya Deren, Carl Jung, Francis Bacon, Duane Michals, Lauren Simonutti,  to name a few... 

The Book

Every image is hand printed by myself in the darkroom, the words similarly my own, some taken from my diary. Roughly half of the images are created within the walls of my 70 sq. ft studio, while the rest were taken in a few locations I scouted and used repeatedly.  Many of the images are unavailable online or in print form and will exclusively remain in the pages of my books as they are meant to be seen. The subjects are myself and people I know well - my lovers, close friends and kindred spirits.

The book will be produced in Brooklyn by a team of women at Small Editions NYC. Once they receive the deposit there is a 1-2 week turn around to see the proof. And a 5-8 week turn around to receive all copies. If all goes smoothly then the book should be released in March/April 2018. For anyone familiar with Volume 1, Volume 2 offers exciting upgrades

Technical Specification:

Limited Edition 9"x10" Hardcover book wrapped in Black Linen  

96-110 pages (depending on available funding). Includes 60-80 (depending on funding) unpublished and published photographs from 2016-2017 and unpublished diary entries.

Each book is numbered (and some signed) in the back. Limited edition of 300-400 depending on funding

** Upgrade- tipped in image on cover!  *Untitled, New York 2016*

offset black and white printing  on warmtone silk paper imported from Germany (This special paper will do justice for the quality and tones of my own warmtone silver gelatin prints) **Upgrade- This year I am adding a gloss varnish!

The Collector's Edition includes a handmade slipcase of black linen to hold both volumes, tipped in with an image (pictured below). Included is a sealed envelope including a contact sheet print and custom letter

 

 

About Brittany Markert

(photo by Stephane Coutelle)

I'm a fine art photographer and darkroom printer that fell in love with traditional photographic techniques, the power of the photographic medium as a method for storytelling and cathartic release and the study of the psychological human experience. I am self taught with the assistance of many kindred spirits and mentors over the years. In Rooms is my legacy, my therapy, my catharsis, my story, my life's work.   

What I Need and What You Will Receive

With your help I will be able to fund the deposit ($12-15K) to the book publisher to produce 300-400 limited edition books. They require a deposit upfront to start the job and every dollar of this campaign will go to Small Editions NYC. I am hoping to reach this goal by pre-selling enough copies of the book.  If I go over the goal I will hopefully continue to sell copies of the book and can consider adding pages. This deposit does not cover the expenses and cost of producing any of the work, additional funds also contribute to my photographic costs (darkroom, paper, film, shoots, etc) and my cast! 

I have already met with the publisher and designed my book, they are just waiting on the deposit and hopefully you can help by pre-ordering a copy or donating toward another unique perk!

In addition to pre-ordering the book you can contribute to this fund by purchasing limited edition silver gelatin prints. I have also added more unique opportunities such as personalized postcards, darkroom lessons,  and In Rooms portrait sessions. It is a gift for me to learn and share the craft of photography and I hope for the right person I can inspire you through my knowledge of the darkroom, photography, or even my vibrant experiences "in rooms".

If you want to help but can't afford a book, print or other perk,  there is also the option to donate $1! Every dollar helps and I can't say thank you enough for your support.

The Impact

With this Campaign and Pre-Sale I will be able to move forward with producing and publishing  the second volume as a high-quality photobook. This will be a dream come true and a huge step forward for my photography project. By contributing to a photographic project such as In Rooms you will also maintain awareness and attention of traditional photographic practices and the present experience as a female artist. 

Challenges & Moving Forward

I have worked hard to find a great publisher and have committed the last 4 years of my life to live and breath In Rooms. I cannot afford to produce this book without your support.  I know what my next steps are and need the deposit to have it all come together

** Indiegogo does not allow 'sexually explicit' material or links to work of this nature (which includes nudity of any kind).  Please email inroomsinfo@gmail.com for links if you would like to see more work. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you again for taking the time to read this through and show support. In addition to ordering the book or contributing other donations it would greatly help if you share the campaign. I cannot afford advertising and am relying on word of mouth and sharing through social media to fund this campaign. 

- With Love,

Brittany Markert

Untitled, New York 2016

New Orleans, 2017

Ceremony, 2017

Tragedy, 2017

For anyone familiar with Volume 1, Volume 2 offers exciting upgradesTechnical Specification:Limited Edition 9"x10" Hardcover book wrapped in Black Linen  96-110 pages (depending on available funding). Includes 60-80 (depending on funding) unpublished and published photographs from 2016-2017 and unpublished diary entries.Each book is numbered (and some signed) in the back. Limited edition of 300-400 depending on funding** Upgrade- tipped in image on cover!  *Untitled, New York 2016*offset black and white printing  on warmtone silk paper imported from Germany (This special paper will do justice for the quality and tones of my own warmtone silver gelatin prints) **Upgrade- This year I am adding a gloss varnish!The Collector's Edition includes a handmade slipcase of black linen to hold both volumes, tipped in with an image (pictured below). Included is a sealed envelope including a contact sheet print and custom letter  About Brittany Markert(photo by Stephane Coutelle)I'm a fine art photographer and darkroom printer that fell in love with traditional photographic techniques, the power of the photographic medium as a method for storytelling and cathartic release and the study of the psychological human experience. I am self taught with the assistance of many kindred spirits and mentors over the years. In Rooms is my legacy, my therapy, my catharsis, my story, my life's work.   What I Need and What You Will ReceiveWith your help I will be able to fund the deposit ($12-15K) to the book publisher to produce 300-400 limited edition books. They require a deposit upfront to start the job and every dollar of this campaign will go to Small Editions NYC. I am hoping to reach this goal by pre-selling enough copies of the book.  If I go over the goal I will hopefully continue to sell copies of the book and can consider adding pages. This deposit does not cover the expenses and cost of producing any of the work, additional funds also contribute to my photographic costs (darkroom, paper, film, shoots, etc) and my cast! I have already met with the publisher and designed my book, they are just waiting on the deposit and hopefully you can help by pre-ordering a copy or donating toward another unique perk!In addition to pre-ordering the book you can contribute to this fund by purchasing limited edition silver gelatin prints. I have also added more unique opportunities such as personalized postcards, darkroom lessons,  and In Rooms portrait sessions. It is a gift for me to learn and share the craft of photography and I hope for the right person I can inspire you through my knowledge of the darkroom, photography, or even my vibrant experiences "in rooms".If you want to help but can't afford a book, print or other perk,  there is also the option to donate $1! Every dollar helps and I can't say thank you enough for your support.The ImpactWith this Campaign and Pre-Sale I will be able to move forward with producing and publishing  the second volume as a high-quality photobook. This will be a dream come true and a huge step forward for my photography project. By contributing to a photographic project such as In Rooms you will also maintain awareness and attention of traditional photographic practices and the present experience as a female artist. Challenges & Moving ForwardI have worked hard to find a great publisher and have committed the last 4 years of my life to live and breath In Rooms. I cannot afford to produce this book without your support.  I know what my next steps are and need the deposit to have it all come together** Indiegogo does not allow 'sexually explicit' material or links to work of this nature (which includes nudity of any kind).  Please email inroomsinfo@gmail.com for links if you would like to see more work. Other Ways You Can HelpThank you again for taking the time to read this through and show support. In addition to ordering the book or contributing other donations it would greatly help if you share the campaign. I cannot afford advertising and am relying on word of mouth and sharing through social media to fund this campaign. - With Love,Brittany MarkertUntitled, New York 2016New Orleans, 2017Ceremony, 2017Tragedy, 2017

story:
Short Summary

We are a group of Nine HNC student photographers from Leicester College that are looking to finish our two year course on a high with a successful exhibition.  The event is self funded with no financial support from the college.

Our exhibition is at the Leicester Peoples Photographic Gallery, 1 Belvoir Street, Leicester, LE1 6SL.  Between the 18th (Opening Night) and 28th June.  

What We Need & What You Get

In order to cover our exhibition, opening night, promotion and printing costs we would need to raise £400.  Anything over this would help to cover individuals printing costs, which can easily run to £50 per person.

For a small donation you will receive an invitation to opening night to see the work and discuss it with us.  For a slightly larger donation you can get an A4 print of your favourite image from the exhibition.

The Impact

The course is geared towards developing us into commercial photographers, a successful exhibition is a great way to showcase our work to the public.  This could be the stepping stone we need to get into the industry and start a new career.

Other Ways You Can Help

Forward on this link to friends, family, anyone that you think may be interested!

Credits

Video by: John Bidmead, Viktoriya Skoryk.

Still images used in the video by: Jane Colver, Anthea Turnbull, Viktoriya Skoryk, Chris Challis, Alex Rooksby, Viktors Kuzmin, John Bidmead, Lindsay Marlow, Simon Sperry.

Special thanks to: Marco Salotti, Alex Severn, Izzy Amertash.

Music used in the video: "Little Tomcat" (Instrumental Version) by Josh Woodward is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution License.
Based on a work at http://www.joshwoodward.co
