story:
Pursuit of Passions:

This is my passion and my dream.

At 12, I self-taught myself Photoshop and learned to emulate my favorite graphic design styles. At 13, I got my first point and shoot Nikon camera and pushed it to its boundaries, using magnifying glasses to discover macro photography (and the importance of steady hands) and eventually discovered my greatest passion: photography.

Now, I am at a roadblock: plenty of passion, drive, and plans vs. outdated and unsuitable technology. After my long-loved first Macbook died, due to financial constraints and other circumstances I was only able to replace it with a cheap, very low-end Gateway laptop.

I can no longer edit the photographs I take to my specifications in Photoshop or Lightroom. One large action, such as re-sizing or using even a sharpen mask overloads the laptop and forces Photoshop to quit unless I am working at an un-printable resolution. Other things hinder as well: the screen quality/resolution and size of the laptop, slow response time to my Wacom tablet, lack of HD space.

It took a few years for me to realize that, yes, this is what I want to do. This is what will make me happy, something that I will always want to focus on for the rest of my life. Photography is an ever-growing and ever-changing field. It combines my love of technology with my love of style and design, allows me to funnel all of my creativity into whatever I can imagine, and lets me share my passion with other people. I am a people pleaser to the bone and can't wait to be able to really work one-on-one to fulfill the needs and desires of my future clients through the lenses of my camera. 

What I Need

The most important goal I have right now is getting up-and-running, which means getting to a point where I can confidently offer my services as a photographer knowing my end products will be the best I can offer. What exactly do I need to start offering and advertising my full services? 

  • An efficient -- or more than efficient -- computer and OS that can meet my hi-res editing and storage needs. 
  • My goal is to invest most of the funds from this campaign into an Apple iMac. After comparison to similar desktop machines in resolution, power, and longevity for what I need, the iMac is the best option by far. Not only is the OS familiar to me and intuitive, it's also best suited for the kind of creative work I do.
  • If the fundraising goal is not fully met and is too little (ie. less than $900) to realistically be able to add to for my main goal of an iMac, the funds will go to various things: a temporary RAM upgrade for my current laptop and a small Hi-res monitor if the funding is at the very low end, if just to allow me to reach my perk goals. Also various equipment upgrades and advertising, business cards, ect., all the small extra things associated with starting up a new business!                     

The Endgame

What makes my campaign different from another start-up Photography campaign? Let me explain a few of the things that are integral to my vision and plans for what I will offer to my clients:

  • Immediate and/or post-edited social media integration! I use Ey-fi wifi and mobile media cards when I shoot and hope to be able to offer my clients at least one instant media image from their shoot -- in a world where almost everyone has some sort of social media presence, who doesn't want to be able to instantaneously share the results of an afternoon or morning spent with a loved one or even alone, celebrating themselves, by sharing a professionally shot image on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or all three? These instant images would be watermarked in a corner with my logo and of phone-quality resolution, a taste of the full shoot that my clients could share while waiting for the final edited product(s).
  • Pre-shoot questionnaires for my clients that will help me understand how they feel about their own body. I want my portrait and photoshoot work for clients to be something they can celebrate and feel amazing about. I encourage body positivity in every aspect of my own life and interactions with others and I hope to translate that in my work. The questionnaires for clients will be optional but reccomended and include space for the client to list the things they love about their bodies, and things or parts of their body that they do not like focused on. I also have been able to really get a feel for how someone sees themselves in the most positive way by viewing photographs they've taken of themselves, or favorite photographs of themselves taken by others. My pre-shoot approach will be to make sure each client is pleased with, if not delighted by, the way their photographs turn out.
  • Design integration: photoshoot packages that include media, ie. bragbooks or fully designed photobooks to keep or to give as gifts, save the date cards or flat designs with engagement shoot images, ect.
  • Unconventional & fun photoshoot offerings: Wreck-the-Dress sessions for brides or entire bridal parties, highly stylized shoots, photoshoots for album art and more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't help monetarily, but still want to help, you can still help me reach my goal! 

♦Share this campaign link on Facebook, Twitter, or whatever other social media you use!

♦Keep my name in mind for the future, or to recommend to a friend!

Contact Me:

I'm happy to answer questions/inquires at megalexandraphoto@gmail.com

story:
Vetruvian Tim - 1993  

  

X - 1980

 

Andre the Giant - 1980  

  

Poseurs

 

Timothy Leary 1993
This poster is from a Sold Out Edition of 420 signed by Timothy Leary
Prints are available individually as Pensive & Playful


Randy Rhoads

Cleaning Out My Closet

My name is Tony Blake aka Miguel, I've been making photos for over 30 years but I've only shown them in small spurts and less than a handfull at that.  Now, I have hundreds of images that I'd like to share, some old and some new.

They've been in the closet for almost as long as me, and I think it's time we both
stepped out and gotta little love.

I feel it's important for others to see the struggle some of us have with turning in our work for fear of rejection; and still get through the struggle with persistence.

Because I love my work so much it's been like a child to me that I've kept locked away, safe from harm and judgement, but now it's time to let my children step out and see the world. They may fall on their face or they may stand tall and thrive on their own, but I'll never know until I try.  This is me trying.

The Rock n' Roll images were created in 1980-81 mostly at the World Famous Starwood 1972-1981. It was one of Hollywood's most infamous night clubs, owned by Eddie Nash (see Wonderland - Boogie Nights).


Darby Crash - Darby Crash Band


Naked Nikki

 
Timothy Leary & his trusty companion Bo

 
Timothy Leary & his "Magic" kitty

My goal is to print and display as
many prints from this period as funds will allow, in a One-Man Show somewhere in Los Angeles.

The success of this project will allow me to create a book so these images won't be trapped in my closet forever. 


Jah Wobble & John Lydon - Public Image Limited 

 


Grace Jones


Nikki Sixx - London


Nikki Sixx - London


Stiv Bators - Former "Dead Boy" 


Danny Elfman/Oingo Boingo - Whiskey A-Go-Go


Darby Crash - Darby Crash Band

I met Timothy on Santa Monica Blvd. in West Hollywood one day while remodeling a  Sex Shop.  I was in the shop with my back to the door when I "felt" Tim walking behind me.  I stopped what I was doing and ran outside and yelled, 150 ft. down the street an older man waited for me as I ran to him.  I introduced myself to him, telling him "I feel like I know you" he responded with a "me too", I told him I'd love to take his photograph and he invited me to his home.  The results are here in the form of images.


Timothy & Rosemary Leary

Timothy and his ex-wife Rosemary Leary taken at the Filmore
SF, they had just re-united after her years of living underground to avoid being arrested, look at her strength. 


Area de Rosales, Mexico - Velvia Slide Film 


Sharpened in PhotoShop - Shot on film


Raw film, not adjusted

 
Osprey 3 - Baja California Norte


Healing Dolphins of Kona


Freshly Washed Hawk 


Grit & Parrot

  
3 Towers - Venice Beach


Calla Caress - San Francisco 

Purpose

  • The funds are for printing, framing, and gallery expenses for a one-man show in Los Angeles to start with.  With success, the show will travel. 
  • My intention is to put together a show with the funds raised, so if I raise the full amount it will be the show I would like to put on.  If I fall short, it will be a smaller shjow, with fewer prints.
  • Either way I will be creating large prints on canvas and showing them to the public!

Motivation

I feel these images are a part of history that shouldn't be forgotten and shared with others.  I also need to do this so I can move forward with the rest of my art and have a sense of completion as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like any of these images please tell your friends, post a link on your Facebook page or just send me some good vibes (I'm grateful to all I receive).

  
My First Hawk 


Experimenting w/ Textures


Dyno Splash


The Old Man - Disney Center LA


Turtles in Space


Trashy Umbrellas - Santa Monica

 
Mexican Banana Leaf - Fuji Velvia Film

 
Terry Bozio - Missing Persons

l
Dale Bozio - Missing Persons

 
Nick Cash - 999


Sting - Santa Barbara


Andre the Giant - Battle Royale - Olympic Auditorium


Andre the Giant - Battle Royale - Olympic Auditorium


Tanaka - Battle Royale - Olympic Auditorium


DJ Bonebrake


Billy Zoom


Exene


Exene


 X - Starwood


Ray Manzarek & Exene - Vinyl Fetish


X Record Release Party - Vinyl Fetish


Lee Ving - Fear


Grace Jones

story:
Summary

Are your photos trapped in a camera, computer, phone, or cloud 
– never to be seen?

Have you been disappointed in how much quality and clarity
your image loses in canvas printing?

Yes to both for me!

 

So what are glass photographs you ask?

Glass photographs are an alternative to canvas printing and framing photographs. 

Glass photographs Features:
- Rich visual effects
- Easy to hang and display
- Simple to clean
- Framless
- Quality and clarity (especially compared to canvas printing which tends to dull the image)

Glass photographs give your image a crisp and vivid look, they’re easy to hang and display, simple to clean, and you don’t need to worry about frames!

How does the process work? 

Free your images from your camera, computer, phone, etc. 

Upload your digital file and we’ll do all the work to turn it into a glass photograph.

Alternatively, you can choose from a gallery image chosen for this particular campaign.


What’s the end goal? 
   To properly develop our website – as an effective means to deliver the product from our shop to the world’s doorstep.

With sufficient funds, we would be able to create an intuitive and easy to navigate online portal where people can create Glass Photographs of their own.

So, I come to you through crowdfunding, 
asking for your help to bring this to fruition.


 


 What We Need & What You Get

Put simply…

- We need: Funds to develop our online ordering website.

- We want: Your input / ideas for our new website and product line

- You get: First to get Glass Photographs!  
                     Choose from a variety of different perks to suit you. You can upload your own digital photo file or choose from a gallery image that has been chose in particular for this campaign.

After fulfilling perks, the funds go to website development. With more funds and your input, we can create a more functional and user-friendly website and develop a product that you would want to buy.



Information About Perks


You can upload your own digital photo file 
or choose from a gallery image

  


Choose a Collection Photo Perks
Choose 1 of 12 photos Collection Photo Perks

**See these images in more detail in our Indiegogo Gallery

Support a Canadian Photographer Perk
Choose 1 of 8 photos for "Canadian Photographer Perk"

Featured Canadian Photographer
Janet Phillips - Ontario

Featured Canadian Photographer
Mark Phillips - Alberta
Choose 1 of 8 photos above for "Canadian Photographer Perk"


Support an American Photographer Perk
Choose 1 of 6 photos for "American Photographer Perk"

Featured American Photographer
Denise Cottin, San Francisco
Check out her incredible photography at http://denise.photography/  
Choose 1 of 6 photos above for "American Photographer Perk"


 Impact

We want to make a difference through our Glass Photographs on both a personal and broader community / societal level.

We aspire to uplift and create positive feelings through them. 

In your home, we want Glass Photographs to make you feel something, to stir something inside you. 
When your eye meets a Glass Photograph, we want it to remind you of the moment you took the original photograph (the sights, sounds, smells, and feelings). 

We want Glass Photographs to evoke emotion – even just for a moment – to help you recapture the feeling.

 

Gift cards are also available as a perk.  

Great for weddings or new baby arrivals!


 Risks & Challenges

       One of the challenges we face is website development - as a well-designed and easy to use website is crucial to our ability to share Glass Photographs. 

        Another challenge we face with this project is packaging for shipping. 
Glass has a tendency to break… and this is a potential problem we have to overcome. We have ideas on how to overcome this through custom packaging. However, this requires tooling fees and significant quantities in order to make it a viable way to ship. But this can be expensive initially!

       Through this crowdfunding campaign, we hope to attain both your input and contributions to help create the best site for the easiest user experience!

 (If you live in the Calgary area and would rather pick up, please contact us at connect@glassphotographs.ca)


Background

Hello! My name is Sarah Cantrill. As far back as I can remember, I have been working with glass. My family has owned a glass manufacturing plant in Calgary, Alberta my whole life and over time, my parents grew their business from a small operation inside our basement to a 13,000 sq. ft. shop. But glass is my Dad’s passion - he was a glazing instructor at a post-secondary school for many years and continues to be one of the trade’s experts in the city.

However, my own passion has never really been awakened in this business… until we happened upon our new product… Glass Photographs! I have always had an interest in photography but never really explored it. But now I’m able to combine that interest with my experience in glass!

Already, I have learned so much about an array of topics - photography, editing, online marketing, and the crowdfunding process - all of which I have found myself to be very interested in and excited to work with. Sometimes, my husband has to remind me to take time off but it just doesn’t feel like work to me!


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if Glass Photographs are not your thing, the timing isn’t right or you are not in a position to contribute, there are still many ways you can help us in our project!

  • Tell your friends!  Please use the Indiegogo social media share tools provided to spread the word through your network.  You never know who might be interested in what we are up to.

We have ideas on how to overcome this through custom packaging. However, this requires tooling fees and significant quantities in order to make it a viable way to ship. But this can be expensive initially!       Through this crowdfunding campaign, we hope to attain both your input and contributions to help create the best site for the easiest user experience! (If you live in the Calgary area and would rather pick up, please contact us at connect@glassphotographs.ca)Background
Hello! My name is Sarah Cantrill. As far back as I can remember, I have been working with glass. My family has owned a glass manufacturing plant in Calgary, Alberta my whole life and over time, my parents grew their business from a small operation inside our basement to a 13,000 sq. ft. shop. But glass is my Dad’s passion - he was a glazing instructor at a post-secondary school for many years and continues to be one of the trade’s experts in the city.
However, my own passion has never really been awakened in this business… until we happened upon our new product… Glass Photographs! I have always had an interest in photography but never really explored it. But now I’m able to combine that interest with my experience in glass!
Already, I have learned so much about an array of topics - photography, editing, online marketing, and the crowdfunding process - all of which I have found myself to be very interested in and excited to work with. Sometimes, my husband has to remind me to take time off but it just doesn’t feel like work to me!


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if Glass Photographs are not your thing, the timing isn’t right or you are not in a position to contribute, there are still many ways you can help us in our project!
Tell your friends!  Please use the Indiegogo social media share tools provided to spread the word through your network.  You never know who might be interested in what we are up to.

story:
About the Art Of Racing Photobook Project:

In a world of speed, organized chaos, mass advertising, there is a hidden world of fantastic art through photography. 

I have been a race photographer for quite some time and wanted to bring a new and fresh perspective on motorsport racing.


About CJ:

Ever since I was a little racer... I have always loved everything about motorsports. I would dream about racing or working in a pit. I love the world of motorsport. I can remember the first racetrack I was going to visit and I couldn't contain my excitement and when we got there, I never wanted to leave.

I have been an amateur photographer for over 25 years. I started shooting photos the second my mother gave me a camera when I was a kid and enjoyed it ever since. The first time I started shooting motorsports, I vividly remember the sights, the sounds, the smell of racing fuel and I was instantly hooked. I love this world of motorsport racing and love sharing the beauty of it all with the world through my lens.


What I Need & What You Get

This project is to visit various tracks on the F1, IndyCar, NASCAR, RedBull Air Racing, and other motorsport circuits and capture the beautiful side of racing and produce a photo book and other deliverables for all of you to enjoy. It truly is a lot of work as I shoot about 800-900 photos per race weekend and finding the best shots is always the fun part. Shooting at motorsports races is like trying to photograph an active volcano. But the rewards are worth the work.

The rewards will be direct results from the project. Posters, photobooks and photographs will all be part of the perks you can get by helping fund this project.


How will the money be used?

The funds will be used for the following:

  • Gear rental like lenses, additional camera, etc.
  • Travel related expenses like fuel, lodging, airfare, etc.
  • Insurance
  • Publishing services for the final photo book. (Printing, shipping, etc.)


When will this project be complete?

I expect to have enough photos by the end of October or mid November. That will give me enough time to compile the book and have it delivered to folks who donated to the photo book level before the Holidays.  


What if funding is exceeded?

If funding is exceeded, this will allow me to produce more photo books to sell at future racing events as well as my website. Eventually, I would like to produce a photo book each year relating to motorsport racing.


What are the risks and challenges?

The obvious risks associated are weather and travel related. But proper planning will help alleviate that. Having a large pool of events in the coming months will also help offset risks associated with weather.


Other Ways You Can Help Me...

  • Tell everyone you know that may be interested in this project!
  • If you are a race team or track, any assistance in getting me access to obtain these beautiful shots at the events would be greatly appreciated!

Thank you VERY much and I appreciate you all!

CJ

story:
We have reached the $15,000 goal, so the campaign has been successfully funded! Thank you to everybody who has contributed and shared this to help make this book a reality. Definitely keep the contributions coming until the end, because any extra money raised will go towards ordering more copies of the book!

I look forward to spending more time working on the book over the next couple of months in order to complete it by mid-February so I am able to launch the book around the three year anniversary of the Wisconsin Uprising. If you live in Madison or Milwaukee, Wisconsin, be ready for a book-launching party where you will be able to pick up your book in person if you choose to do so!

THE BACKSTORY

In February of 2011, the massive protests against Wisconsin Governor Scott Walker awoke me from my slumber and changed my life completely. I immersed myself within the front lines of the fight for justice and equality, and I haven't looked back even once. Fast forward two years and nine months and I am now living in New York City, traveling all over the US and internationally to stand with others who are striving for a better world. In the process, I have been arrested, pepper sprayed, tear gassed, hit with water cannons, and shot at with plastic bullets. I have slept on planes, trains, and buses, outside in the rain and snow, and on strangers' couches. And, everywhere I go, I have my camera in my hands. It has been an exciting, intense, and unpredictable journey where I am constantly being inspired by the people and movements I capture through the lens of my camera.

A photo of me on the streets of Istanbul, Turkey. Credit: Tim Eastman

THE BOOK

An Activist Armed With a Camera will be a self-published 8x10 hardcover book with approximately 100 pages featuring photos I have taken since February 2011. You will get a view into movements and protests over the past three years as seen through my eyes, as well as the story of my personal experiences along the way. The book begins with the Wisconsin Uprising in 2011, when Governor Scott Walker launched an attack on public workers and many other people in the state through his "budget repair" bill. The people fought back and we occupied our state Capitol for 3 weeks, and what began with just a few thousand people on the first day turned into 200,000 people marching on our Capitol at one point:

Wisconsin Capitol - February, 2011

Another section of the book will include photos from Occupy Wall Street, when thousands of people converged on the financial district in Lower Manhattan beginning on September 17, 2011 to protest social and economic inequality, among many other issues. I traveled to NYC at the end of September that year and slept in Zuccotti Park for about 10 days, capturing the movement, including the well-known Brooklyn Bridge shutdown where over 700 people were arrested:

Brooklyn Bridge Shutdown - October 1, 2011

Also included are images from the on-going Turkish Uprising, which began at the end of May 2013 when a small group of activists occupied Gezi Park in an attempt to keep it from being demolished in order to build a shopping mall in a part of Istanbul where green space is very sparse. The police responded to the protest with tear gas, water cannons, and plastic bullets. This sparked protests all over Turkey, and tens of thousands of people took over Gezi Park, completely halting construction in the park. I traveled there just a week after the protests began, and stayed for two weeks. I then went back again for 10 days in July:

Istiklal Street, Istanbul, Turkey - June 15th, 2013

An Activist Armed With a Camera will also include images from many other protests, such as the 2012 RNC and DNC, the 2012 NATO protest in Chicago, Occupy 1-year anniversaries in NYC, Chicago, and DC, Occupy Sandy (Hurricane Sandy aftermath/recovery), the March 2013 Marriage Equality protests outside of the Supreme Court, the 3-day March for Education Justice in Chicago, and the Forward on Climate Rally in Washington DC:

2012 RNC protests - Tampa, Florida

Occupy Wall Street 1-year Anniversary

Forward on Climate Rally, Washington DC - February 2013

THE FUNDING

What the funds will be used for:

  • The cost of self-publishing and printing the first order of books
  • The cost of post cards and prints for the rewards
  • Shipping expenses
  • The cost of traveling back to Wisconsin where I will have a book launch and organize and ship out the books (a small 5th floor apartment in NYC with no elevator isn't an ideal place to have over 100 books shipped to, organized, and shipped back out)
  • My time, effort, and love spent on putting the photo book together

*Since this is a fixed-funding campaign, I will only receive the funds if we reach the $15,000 goal. If the goal is not reached, then all contributors will receive their money back.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

As with most things in life, unforeseeable obstacles and setbacks may come up. Although I plan to have the book completed by mid-February, since that will be the 3-year anniversary of the Wisconsin Uprising, there is always a chance that it may take longer. I promise to post updates if any issues should arise, and will work my hardest to get the books, prints, and postcards out within a timely manner.

PRESS

ROAR Magazine: http://roarmag.org/2013/11/gezi-park-photography-jenna-pope/
Popular Resistance: http://www.popularresistance.org/upcoming-book-an-activist-armed-with-a-camera/
RT America:

I promise to post updates if any issues should arise, and will work my hardest to get the books, prints, and postcards out within a timely manner.PRESSROAR Magazine: http://roarmag.org/2013/11/gezi-park-photography-jenna-pope/Popular Resistance: http://www.popularresistance.org/upcoming-book-an-activist-armed-with-a-camera/RT America:

story:
Introduction

I’m Inga Erdmane, an artist and photographer based in Riga, Latvia.

In 2016 I collaborated with the Latvian Probation Service and five of their clients by providing a nine month, weekly photography workshop devised as a social art project. The participants were given a disposable camera and developed tools to help them capture the world as they see it. The resulting photographs are a reflection into both the process and result of five accidental artists on the margins of the criminal justice system.

The project will be part of the 2018 Riga Photography Bienalle with a book of more than 1000 pages - including all the shot images - at its core. A successful campaign makes it possible to print a limited edition of 500 books and your support would be invaluable. 

1024 pages, 125×175 mm

 

 

"An amateur’s gift is naivety. If you don’t know rules, you don’t know not to break them. The amateur doesn’t fear failure."

                                      Erik Kessels

 

 

Project Description

This project had its beginnings in November 2014 with Šķeļot viļņus (Breaking the Waves), a cooperative effort to develop and implement an informal education program for incarcerated young people, as part of the Project Workshop for Communities 2012-2014. I was invited to organize a self-portrait workshop in Daugavgrīva prison Baltais gulbis (The White Swan). I found it important, after my initial experience, to keep exploring the minds of the condemned youth and their relationships with society.

 

 

In the late autumn 2015 I learned of a new Probation Service (Riga, Latvia) program in 2016 for clients conditionally discharged or released pre-term.

 

 

The work on the project began in February 2016. I intended to serve only as the intermediary, giving the main role to the participants. I designed a program for a photography workshop that would help the participants to come to an awareness of themselves and their environment via photography, as well as acquire new skills and discover new leisure activities (photography, in this case).

 

 

The participants of the project The Pleasure of Ignorance – 1 female, 4 male – were clients of the Probation Service. Their task was, for a period of time, to document and reveal their environment as they know it and which otherwise remains hidden to us. The participants were encouraged to express themselves using the visual language, rather uncommon for them. There was no specific target of photography, it could be anything – local architecture, scenery, people or stray cats.

 

 

With recurring meetings, their technique of photography was improved, making them more confident with their decisions and more perceptive. With time, their interest in photography, or the absence thereof, became evident. Their difficult life-styles would prevent their participation at times, just to have most of the participants return to the project after a while. Almost 40 films were filled, some of them exposed to light, some caught in the developing machine, 3 cameras malfunctioned, shifting colors, and most of the initial photos have fingers covering the lens partially or fully. Afterwards, we met to analyse the photographs informally in a public place of their choosing, and thoroughly discussed their mistakes – the human factor, such as fingers blocking the lens, trees or posts filling up most of the image, and technical issues.

 

 

In March 2016, first photographs of three of the participants were displayed at ISSP masterclass final exhibition in Kuldīga, Latvia. All the participants have signed an agreement, granting me full license to the use of their pictures. Our conversations with the participants revealed that they found the exhibition format to be too abstract, so I decided early on to also make a photo-book. A book would remain with them as a tangible reminder and could also introduce less obvious realities to the general public of both Latvia and abroad. 

 

 

This experience has convinced me of the project’s impact on both the participants and the general public and of its potential to improve the social discernment and attitude. With the tendency towards dissociation from the “undesirables”, a public discussion of this complex subject matter is essential. Exhibited and published, the work of the naive amateur would find validity and give the art aficionado a glimpse into a world which exists parallel to ours.

 

 

Printing a book of over 1000 pages as part of my contribution to the Riga Photography Bienalle 2018 is the last stage of this two year process.

story:
Thanks for stopping by!!!

 

Update! 5/24/2013:

New perks added, Made Possible By page live on the blog!

 

I'm Nick, 25 years old, during the week I'm a professional aircraft mechanic. When I'm not working on aircraft I'm usually out taking pictures of them, or any other object or landscape that strikes me as beautiful.

 

I haven't had any formal training in photography, but years of practice and experimentation have led to a unique style and a wide variety of photos. I've found that most of my best photos come from those out of the blue moments where I see a scene and just say "Wow!" then break out my camera and capture it.

 

Much like aviation, photography can turn in to an expensive activity! Buying new lenses, camera bodies, various other pieces of equipment, and traveling to new locations are expenses that hold many amateur photographers back. That's why I'm running ths campaign, so I can continue to expand my creativity and elevate the quality of my photos.

 

Eventually I'd love to grow my photography hobby into a buisness, while that goal may be far in the future, I see this as the first step in the transition.

 

Thank you for your consideration, even the smallest contributon is greatly appreciated!!!

 

Come visit my photo blog: sandinphoto.blogspot.com

story:
Why am i here

Hey all you people, my name's Keira, I'm 14 years old, and I love Photography. I've been taking pictures pretty much my entire life, and I don't plan on stopping now. I got my first camera when i was about 7, it was one of those old ones where after you take the pictures it prints out. Lots of fun.

My obsession with photography is how i see the world. I always carry a camera around wherever i go. And I really want to develop my talent and take my photography to the next level by upgrading to a SLR Camera. 

So now i am here, and i'm really excited to do this!

Your contributions towards my dream

Here's what I am purchasing with your contributions, plus the $ I save from babysitting:

  • The Canon EOS Rebel T3 12.2MP DSLR Camera With 18-55mm Image Stabilized Lens Kit
  • extra money contributed will be put towards lenses, trypods, and other camera accessories.

The perks of claiming a perk

In return for claiming a perk, I'll email you 1+ digital images of your choice of my photos from my flickr. I will take reasonable requests.

Other Ways You Can Help

if you're not up to putting some money in, THAT'S FINE! So here's how you can also help...

  • Tweet my page to let your friends know
  • Email people you know
  • If you know of any photographers GIVE THEM A SHOUT i'd really like their support

 

Once again, even if you're only putting a dollar into my campaign I'm alright with that, every penny counts! thank you. The extra money raised (if any) will be put towards trypods, camera case, and different lenses.

story:
We are raising funds to create Oliver's first official coffee table book, showcasing his remarkable photographic skills and improving positive awareness around Down Syndrome.
The book features 128 pages of Oliver's beautiful images, illustrating his unique view of the natural world. Oliver's dream is to make photography his fulltime profession.

Thank you so much to all those who have pre-ordered and contributed so generously to help us gain the funds to design, publish and distribute Oliver's book, making it available to all his fans around the world.
We have been overwhelmed by your support!

Any additional funds, now we have reached the production total, will be put towards helping Oliver become a professional by updating his website to make ordering more streamlined and hopefully enable better sales for him, to update his photographic equipment and experience, as well as furthering vital awareness and support around Down Syndrome, with a donation from every book sold going to support hundreds of families through the charity founded by Oliver’s mother after his birth www.upsanddowns.net


There are only 1,000 copies to be claimed in this 1st edition of Oliver’s book, priced at £20.00 plus post and packaging (UK £5.00 and Rest of world £10.00). $47.00USD inclusive.

To order a copy of the book or one of Oliver’sprints choose from the "perks" listed on the right.


 All those who order via this campaign will also get their name in the supporter credits at the back of the book.
Thanks again for all your amazing support. We look forward to sharing Oliver’s amazing photographs withyou, spreading more positive awareness, and also supporting and informing other families who have a child/young person with Down Syndrome through the charity Ups and Downs Southwest.


To follow Oliver and see daily updates go to www.facebook.com/OliverHellowellPhotographer 

and to learn more about him and see items available for sale go to www.oliverhellowell.com

story:
Hello, I'm Bridgett with Euphoria and I am SO excited to preset this project to you! I am a fashion Designer, Cosplayer and all around Geek! Together with Cameko Cosplay we have put together a unique project that will definatly warm any Mutants heart!
 

The Uncanny Calendar

This full-color calendar is 8.5"x11" closed (11x17 open), saddle stitched, and has a drilled hole for easy hanging.

Each month features a unique setting with themed cosplays that fit perfectly with the time of year. There is one full size 8.5" by 11" image for each month along with one Vertical picture featured beside the Calendar days.  This way each month features two unique photos brilliantly captured by our photographer; Cameko Cosplay.

______________________________________________________________________________________

__________________________________________________________

Cant Contribute? That's ok!

If you love the project but you just cant contribute right now there are other ways to help!

  • Share this project with others on social Media and in your daily life!
  • Follow Euphoria.bjc on Instagram and Facebook and other platforms.
  • Follow Cameko Cosplay on Facebook, Instagram and other platforms.
  • Talk about the project to others in your daily lives!

story:
Short Summary

Hi everyone, I am Luigi Pica, an Italian Photographer that became a professional photographer in the last year.


For me the Photography is everything, I gave all my time, and all my money to it, for me is very important to improve and is very important also to expand my photographic gear.

I took picture since I was a child, I think that I was born with the camera in the hands.

When I was 13 I decided to buy my first personal reflex, and from this moment to some days ago I started to save money from my small works, to buy my dreams equipment.

In the last year I reached the goal, and I bought all that I need. I did an investment of 10k €.

But two days ago I parked my car at the Hospital Parking , and someone burgled my car trunk and stole everything.

It's like stealing a part of my heart.

I have never liked to ask people to help me, and I have never feeling sorry for myself.

No one will ever stop me, but right now in this moment, I'm in an extremely complicated situation, because I can't earn anything without my camera.

I had a lot of difficult moments, but I never gave up.

What I Need?

I need to buy everything, I had a Nikon D810, and a lot of lenses, the Nikkor 70-200 f 2.8, the Nikkor 24-70 f 2.8, the Nikkor 85mm f1.4, the Nikkor 50mm f1.4, and also the Samyang 8mm Fisheye, and also the flash the SB-910. (but this isn't important for the moment).

It's a lot of money for me, right now, without any help. Because I bought just 2 weeks ago the 85mm and I spent a lot of money.

In exchange what you get?

I will send you personally, a printed picture of one of the picture that you like more, from my Flickr gallery (at the end of the text I will insert all my links)

I Will never stop to believe it.

Please, Help me to start again with my biggest passion , and also with my work of my dreams.


Here there are the list of the links that you can view my picture.

website: www.luigipica.com
flickr: www.flickr.com/photos/i-am-gigi
Instagram: www.instagram.com/luigipica
Facebook: www.facebook.com/luigipica

story:
About my project:


I am an award winning photographer living in Rotorua New Zealand and I specialize in adventure lifestyle photography.

  I have been a professional photographer for the last 12 years.

  •   Traveled around the world with my camera, including trips to Nepal, Tibet, Thailand, Caribbean, USA, and New Zealand
  •   Won the Banff Mountain Photography Contest


  • Had work published in a variety of magazines, books, and newspapers

I have turned to Indegogo to help me realize my life long dream of publishing my own book. I have the opportunity to photograph the first ever Thailand UItramarathon in a remote region of Northern Thailand.


The event will be over two weekends with a 100km trail run and a 50km trail run and the course will take competitors through three remote tribal villages near the Thailand/Burma border and I want to document the racers who are willing to travel from all over the world to take on the race, the people behind the race, and the local villagers that the race will affect.


Why support of my project?

I have figured out that I will need at least $3000 to cover all of my travel expenses as well as production costs for a limited run hard-bound coffee table book

  •   The majority of the cost will be for the airfare getting from New Zealand to Changmai, which is the nearest airport.
  •   Then there is the ground transportation as well as accommodation while in Thailand
  •   And finally, the rest of the costs will go towards printing a high quality coffee table book.
I have chosen the flexible funding option for this project, which means that even if I don't reach my target goal, I will still receive the money pledged and will deliver the perks promised.


Here are the perks that I am offering:

  1.   For $5, you will be added to an exclusive database that will receive  exclusive daily updates about my trip.

  2.   If you donate $15, you will get a custom postcard with a handwritten story  from adventures Thailand and the exclusive daily updates.

  3.   If you donate $35, you will receive a 5x7 print of your choice from my trip and the exclusive updates about my trip.

  4.   If you donate $50 (The cost of a dinner out), you will receive a custom post card with a handwritten story about my adventure, a signed and matted 8x10 print of your choice from my trip, your name mentioned in my book and the exclusive daily updates.

  5.   If you donate $150, you will get your name in my book, an autographed copy of my book and the exclusive daily updates.

  6.   If you donate $300, you will get a personal dedication to you in the book, two autographed copies of my book and a framed and matted 11x14 autographed photo of your choice from my trip to hang in your office or home and the exclusive daily updates.

  7.   If you can donate more than $500, then let me know what you would like in return: a free 1-on-1 day long photo tutorial near Rotorua, New Zealand, a free two hour photoshoot including travel to a location of your choice in New Zealand for it, or a 20x24 print framed and matted and two 8x10 prints matted of your choice from my trip.


Why fund this project?


One of the reasons I have chosen this race to document is that there really is not another race like this in the world. Sure there are a lot of ultra-marathons already out there, but the ones already happening are based around popular tourist destinations. Ban Tham village near Soppong, where the Thailand Ultramarathon is based, is barely a blip on most tourist destination lists. This will be a good way to help promote an unique event and an area of Thailand that has not been overrun by backpackers and provide support to some authentic hill tribes in the area.


Other Ways You Can Help


I know not everyone can afford to help me out financially, but if you could pass this campaign on to people you know that might be interested in this project, I would really appreciate it.

  •   Please feel free to share this with your connections via email
  •   Or you can use the Indiegogo share tools to post this on any/all your social media channels.

Thanks for reading and sharing.

Mead Norton

story:
Project: Photo-blogging Israel: People, Places, and Things

What is it?: I am heading to Israel in January and February 2014 for an intensive Hebrew language course, and I want to spend some of that time using my skills in photography to create a project and product that others can enjoy.

  Everyday, while walking the streets of Israel, I will see new and exciting (and sometimes disturbing) sights and sounds. On my walks, I will seek out one person I have never met, one place I have never been, and one thing I have never seen, don't know what it is, is unique, or displays some other interesting feature.

  When I meet each day's person, I will explain what I am doing and then preceed to have a short interview/conversation with them about who they are and why they are where I found them.

  I will also photograph one new place everyday and find out what it is and its significance to the world around it. I will also find that one interesting object and find out what it is and what it is all about.

  Everyday, each of these three pictures will be posted to a photoblog online with a brief blurb about each person, place, and thing in an attempt to tell the microstory of Israel.

   Upon my return, I will self publish a book of the blog and all of its photos.

story:
I'm an italian professional Fine Art photographer. After a career in the amazing world of travel magazines (about 200 reportages published), I decide to dedicate myself to my real passion: photography projects, made by creative tools such as Holgas and other toy cameras, pinhole cameras, polaroids, and of course digital cameras (DSLR and compacts).

I loves Nature, and trees are my best photographic passion. So, this is the reason why I made the Lucus project.

My project aims to explore, thanks to photography, forests not only as a natural environment, but also as places where is deposited and secured our imagination, the place of the sublime and the beauty, the perfect harmony between culture, history and nature.

What I want to do are essentially three things: a hard cover, high quality Book with black and white images and texts about the project theme; a DVD with 3D photographs (to watch by cyan-red glasses) and QTVR images to navigate and that gives the impression "to be in the forest" and finally an Exhibition made with Cyanoypes prints of the B&W images of the project, and also Anthotypes and Lumenprints to illustrate the "Herbarium" section. The basic concept  is that the forest is characterized by two key elements: the light of the sun (which provides the energy) and the time, that allows the trees to grow, become monumental, and to live for thousands of years old. So, this is the reason why I choose this old classic print techniques to print the exhibition. 

In greek, anthos meaning "flower": the Anthotype is a technique to create images from a sensitive emulsion made from plant materials such as flower petals, leaves and berry juice. Such as Cyanotype, Anthotype was invented by sir John Herschel during the second half of 19th century.

 

Once the emulsion, spread on a sheet of drawing paper, is dried, I placed on parts of a plant (leaves, twigs, etc..) and everything is exposed to the sun for two, three, seven, twenty days, depending on the season and the sensitivity of the emulsion itself. The sun fade the parts exposed to its light, and the protected parts remain dark. 

To create Anthotypes the sun and time are the basic element, just as in nature. In addition, by their nature, the Anthotypes are not perennial: despite the protective coating that can cover them, sooner or later will vanish. A beautiful metaphor of the decline of nature in modern times! In the Exhibition there will be reproduction of the original Anthotypes, so in the book.

What I need to realize my project are time (I provide by myself!) and money, for whom I need your help. 9000,00 € (about 10,000 USD) is not a so big amount, but is out of my economical power! 

 

CONSIDERATIONS

The first temple in which men have worshipped their gods, was the forest. These immense cathedrals of nature that covered the planet, evoking the magic and sacredness of the divine, create environments of light and shadow, perfumes and colors, suggestions and emotions. 

Over time, cathedrals became of stone and brick, but the relationship between man and the forest continued: just think of the thousands of legends that have for background or character the forest, or Lucus of the Romans, the sacred groves that could not be violated becouse dedicated to the gods, or think to medieval witches' Sabbath, that took place -according to popular belief- in clearings of the forests.

Only in more recent times, the relationship between man and the forest seems to have stopped, or at least have suffered a backlash: the wood can become an economic thing or a place for entertainment, but seems to have lost that aura of magic that had characterized it for millenniums. Yet, within each of us, a reflection of that magic remained. We realize that when we cross the threshold of a wooded area, the verticality of the trunks (the "pillars of heaven" of American Indians), the inability to gaze wander too far, the games of light and shadow, the shapes of the log or the texture of the bark, the cracks of dry leaves underfoot,  the smell of earth and moisture, the shapes and colors of mushrooms, berries, vines, everything seems to contribute to create an habitat able to solicit the imagination and stimulate the senses. For this reason the woods -even though sometimes we refuse to admit it- are absolutely essential for us.

 They are the home of our fantasies and our dreams.

story:
Hello everyone!!

My name is Camille Reyes and I'm an 18 year old, first year University student living in Canada.

I would just like to fill you in and request your support and any contributions at all if possible! 

THE PLAN

I have applied, interviewed and been accepted to travel to Casablanca this Summer as an intern. Casablanca is the largest city in Morocco, situated in Northern Africa. For six weeks, I will be participating in a Global Community Development Program. My duties will be to showcase and expose Casablanca and Morocco as a destination for tourists and to familiarize myself with Moroccan traditions and customs, thus supporting the economical growth of the city and country. More specifically, I have been asked to create two videos exhibiting the vibrant culture and the customs in the area, snap some eye-catching photos, conduct video-making tutorials and organize a Cross-Culture Day event for various schools in the city of Casablanca.

THE DREAM

As many of you may know, I am an SFU student pursuing a joint-major in Business and Communications, with the hopes of somehow landing a career in Tourism Advertising. By supporting my trip, you will be providing me with an amazing opportunity to get a taste of what that would be like and what could quite possibly be the gateway to the fulfillment of one of my impossible dreams (to ride a camel aka my nickname, other than chameleon). 

YOUR SUPPORT

Please elevate me to achieving my wildest dreams so that I may experience the crazy things life has to offer, share joy and love, grow, discover and fall in love with the wonders of creation more and more.

Your time, contributions and prayers are greatly appreciated!

Thank you so much and God bless!!

story:
In A Nutshell...

As many of you know, I, Elizabeth McCoy, started Pictor Photography on March 26th, 2007. On that day, I bought my beloved Nikon D80 SLR, and went out into the Los Angeles goth scene to take photos. Several gallery shows later, I began photographing bands such as Hex Rx, CHANT, Kevorkian Death Cycle, The English Beat, The Specials, Skabilly Rebels, The Amalgamated, The Slackers, King Hammond, and many, many more. I've branched into theater in the last year, doing work for two productions put on by the Illyrian Players (my work was featured in several articles on their latest play, not to mention actually showing up IN the play), and was recently offered a chance to show in a gallery presentation for the play 99 Ways to F**k a Swan...

However...my camera, for unexplained reasons (in particular the shutter), has decided to pass on after seven long, globetrotting years of fog machines, sweat, fake blood, downpours, and crowd-dodging. Her repairs will cost far more than worth it at this point in time, and so...I must lay her to rest...

...which ends Pictor Photography, my gallery show, and any other work people would need from me...unless I can get a new camera. Which is where YOU come in!

What I Need & What You Get

Friends, I need a new camera. Pure and simple. I want a Nikon D5200, with better low-light capabilities for concert/event/theater photography, better quality photo output, and more shutter capability for an even BETTER 2014 for Pictor Photography. This will run me 800.00 roughly with tax included.

And what's in it for you?

  • Prints, prints, prints...signed, framed, limited, or custom, depending on contribution!
  • Exclusive headshots/photo sessions from me, with make-up and movement tips!
  • Attendance at my upcoming Wake for Lady D80kins, which includes booze and a home-cooked dinner made by me (and if you know me, you know that's gonna be some gourmet stuff right there)!

Pictor Photography Loves and Needs You...

As always, I wouldn't be this far without every one of you who has supported me, hired me, and used my work on your Facebooks, even. I wouldn't be in this dire need if I didn't feel like my work was so loved and needed. I want to keep snapping your shows and pretty faces. Keeping me in business will keep you looking good in every photo I take. I'm proud to have worked with every single person in every single photo I have taken. I have a killer theme with my next gallery show, and I am devastated at the idea that I wouldn't be able to make that a reality. My love and gratitude for any and all help would never, ever end...and I'll have you on my mind every time I pick up my camera to create some beautiful images.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't make a donation? I totally understand, and love you for stopping by and caring just the same. If you can pass this on via the Indiegogo share tools, on your social media, via passenger pigeon and eager cats with mailbags, that means just as much and more.

I could do nothing, shoot nothing, show nothing, without your support, both before and after this hit the fan. You honor Lady D80kins and every photo I've taken with your help. Thank you so much for your time and efforts.

story:
Short Summary

Hello, My name is Cody Langford. I live in Northern rural California. I have just recently became a registered charity known in California as, "Remember Syria Relief". I have gathered in the past supplies for Syrian refugee's and have successfully coordinated with other organization with their gratitude on making sure the much needed Relief of supplies arrives in safe hands and to the right hands.

I am the sole owner and board member of Remember Syria Relief. I am currently waiting approval of Tax-Exempt Status from the IRS but do have a EIN number;

My cousin Cedric Mcbane has done photography for some time now, but with his amazing work he would like to donate half of each $15 dollar donation to the refugee's of Syria. With donating $15 dollars, Cedric will then send you a 8x10 Scenic Print he himself took. Half of the dollars of the $15 will be turned back to Syrian refugee's.

We are going to just start by trying 10 prints at this time. If this picks up we will consider on doing more! Thank you for your most valuable help.


What We Need & What You Get

A $15 dollar donation and you will receive a 8x10 Scenic Print to add to your household.

The split half that is donated to Remember Syria Relief will be used to purchase sleeping bags, socks, and other winter items to prepare refugee's for 2015 upcoming winter. I will then use these donations to purchase the items, deliver them to a registered partner non-profit and with their gracious help move the aid overseas. The container ship usually takes 4-6 weeks to arrive from leaving the Oakland Bay Port in California. A NGO that is partnered with the charity will then deliver them in besieged areas among Syria. Also to refugee's that are currently displaced, and non-internally displaced.


The Impact

It will bring hundreds of smiles to most needed people in the worse conditions no human could bear. I myself went to the Turkish/Syrian border and aided children in a makeshift village. Their smiles of joy brought tears to my eyes. It will make a huge impact, even the smallest deed's.

I have also in the past successfully sent aid to Syria within being in California. You can find more at Remember Syria's website; www.RememberSyria.com . Or search Facebook; Remember Syria.


Challenges

Once these sleeping bags and winter items arrive in ports such as Jordan, Turkey, or Lebanon; NGO's then find the proper, and most efficent way to get the supplies to the most needed families in and bordering Syria.

Pictures to chose from

Escape

Morning View

Musical Chairs

Road to Nowhere

Art School




Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign! If you don't currently have any money to donate, you can share! One share can possibly equal a thousand!

story:
I’m photographer Ron Levine. I want to talk to you about a project I’ve been working on for over 18 years, called Prisoners of Age. It started out as the first privately mounted, large scale photo exhibition at Alcatraz, the world’s most infamous prison. The exhibit featured portraits I had taken of geriatric convicts - prisoners of their advanced age, as much as they were prisoners of the penitentiaries that kept them locked up.

Since then, the exhibit has been held in other cities and prison museums in North America, Europe and Australia. I was originally motivated to take these photos as a study of some of the most marginalized people in our world. But an interesting phenomenon has occurred over the years. The reaction to these photos has evolved from questioning the compassion of our society to building a safer one.

The portraits have consistently resonated with young people, particularly among at-risk youth, in a way that wasn’t expected [see 'I Can See What I Can Be' clip in the Gallery Images] I have been told by educators, social workers, police and young people themselves that the stories and portraits of these convicts in their advanced age have had a genuine effect on kids. Seeing the consequences of a mistake or crime that often resulted in a lifetime behind bars is making troubled kids think about their own actions. 

Sharing these photos as an educational tool with as large an audience as possible has become a real passion for me, and I hope you will want to support it. 

We have the opportunity to present a new exhibit at Alcatraz, where it would be seen by over a million visitors from July to December, 2015 . 

However, mounting a new series of twelve-foot tall, larger than life photos is a very costly challenge. Although Alcatraz is prepared to welcome “Prisoners of Age” back, there is no funding available for the project.

If you are interested in supporting the Prisoners of Age project, you can help by making a financial contribution. This will help us print up new images for the exhibition, build the lighting needed for the exhibition and take care of shipping the exhibit to and from The Rock.

There are many levels of sponsorship available, so take the time to read through this site and help us to share these images and life-lessons with a new generation.

A huge Thank You to all of you!


About "Prisoners of Age":

THE PROJECT

"Prisoners of Age" is a series of photographs and interviews with elderly inmates and corrections personnel conducted in prisons both in the United States and Canada since 1996.
The exhibition and 208-page companion book serve to capture the complexity of a subject that is seldom contemplated – aging offenders in the correctional system. The project explores the socio-economic causes of crime and delinquency, encouraging visitors to consider the human dimension of doing time while growing old in prison; the objective being to open the eyes of a younger public, to play a role in stimulating social and institutional change by addressing these issues of social justice and human dignity through images and interviews.



More than two million North Americans are now behind bars, an estimated 35 percent of them edging far past middle age. "Prisoners of Age" offers a microcosmic glimpse of what lies ahead in this new millennium. 
Existing prison space is in serious decline, bunk space and medical costs are soaring. Geriatric inmates comprise the fastest growing age group in the United States. The average expense of medical care and maintenance for inmates over 55 is $79,000 per year --  about four times the norm- sometimes as high as $150, 000. Meanwhile, the people who manage North America's prison system are worrying more and more about how to handle the imminent explosion in the geriatric population.


THE EXHIBITION

The portraits in the "Prisoners of Age" exhibition are immense [8‘x12’ for the upcoming exhibit], graphic and command the viewer’s attention. The full exhibition comprises 60-70 prints, vertically supended from the museum ceilings. All prints include text from interviews with inmates and corrections personnel. 


It’s hard to imagine these old men and women as criminals running from the law.  Many of their stories are about fits of anger, rage, foolish steps they took in their youth that have brought them to where they are now. Others are remorseless. "Prisoners of Age" seeks a balance of the two dispositions, through images and text, lending insight into the lawbreaker's proclivity to commit crime.
It is our ambition that we can persuade a younger audience to avoid making the same mistakes that doomed so many of these inmates.




The project has been exhibited at: Alcatraz Penitentiary [2000-2001], The National Archives of Canada, Ottawa, [2002] Eastern State Penitentiary, Philadelphia, [2002], the Kilmainham Gaol, Dublin, Ireland [2004], Cirque du Soleil Headquarters, Montreal [2006], Fremantle Prison & Museum, Fremantle, West Australia [2010], Powerhouse Gallery, Brisbane, Australia [2011]. The exhibit returns to Alcatraz in July 2015 for 6 months where more than one million people will see it. 


THE DOCUMENTARY

The television documentary explores, illuminates and extends photographer Ron Levine’s groundbreaking project with geriatric prisoners. Journeying with Levine on a series of photo shoots in Canadian and American prisons, we discover why he has embarked on this artistic pursuit, what he seeks to reveal, who his subjects are and why we should care. With Levine as our gateway, the film provides an immersion into the world of the aging prisoners, revealing a number of important social issues surrounding the aging prison population, and bringing forth the personal dimension of this human tragedy.


“Prisoners of Age” asks a fundamental question that has no easy answer: what becomes of an inmate who is too old or too ill to stay in the general prison population? Levine’s consummate skill as photographer evokes deep sympathy for the inmates’ plight, but his images lead us to a second, more disturbing question: what about the justice demanded by the inmates’ victims, their families and society at large? The heart of the film lies in this conflict between feelings of sympathy and the desire for punishment, while revealing the artistic role of the photographer in staging this theatre of unresolved emotions.

story:
Help fund the production of the limited edition photo book In Rooms Portfolio Book (2014-2019)  by pre-ordering a copy, purchasing a print or booking a private darkroom lesson with artist Brittany Markert.  Every dollar helps bring this book to life, no contribution is too small

Hello everyone!

It is I, Brittany Markert, photographer, darkroom printer and storyteller behind In Rooms.  I created this campaign because I need your help to fund the deposit to produce the books.

With my first two books, In Rooms Vol. I & II out of print, I wanted to create a smaller, more affordable book that allows a wider range of people to live with my work. The book was curated to have a unique experience while not taking away from Volume I or Volume II. 

In Rooms Portfolio Book includes 22 prints from 2014-2019 including 19 of the artist's favorite images from Sold Out Vol. I & II, 3 unpublished prints, 6 unpublished Self Portrait Diary Prints paired with excerpts from 4 interviews & handwritten text

Technical Specifications
hardcover - black linen bound - image set on cover -  foil stamping on cover
40 pages - digital offset printing 
first edition, 2019 
limited edition 500-1000 copies 
printed and bound by Small Editions NYC

In Rooms Artist Statement HERE

Press on In Rooms HERE

Social Media HERE

Directed & Printed by Brittany Markert

The content of this book is a mixture of self portraiture and collaborative work. I would not have been able to communicate this narrative without the contributions of my incredible cast

Cast Includes: Toybox Theatre, John Zarsky, Brittany Markert,  Hollie Witchey, Shelbie Dimond, Nicole Absher, James Jimenez

Inspirations for this project include: Anais Nin, Catherine Robbe Grillet, The Yellow Wallpaper, Francesca Woodman, Diane Arbus, Vivian Maier, Claude Cahun, Joel Peter Witkin, Hans Bellmer, Maya Deren, Carl Jung, Francis Bacon, Duane Michals, Lauren Simonutti,  to name a few... 

 

The Impact

This book will enable me to continue sharing my work at art fairs around the globe and reach more people with a more affordable price point. 

Risks & Challenges

Making books is a slow and expensive process! The full amount needs to be raised to produce the books. While it is my hope the book will be finished by the end of March, this could be longer due to production.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate or already own both of my books any sharing is greatly appreciated!

Thank you!
