story:
What is The Raw Beauty Project?

The Raw Beauty Project is an innovative arts project that celebrates women with disabilities, educating viewers to redefine perceptions and beauty, unleashing potential for all.

Note: The Raw Beauty Project is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community.

Presently, the media reflects a small fraction of the population and not every day REAL people. Often, women and girls are left with an unrealistic, false sense of how they should look. We want to change that so beauty is not limited to a certain size, age, color or ability and uniqueness is celebrated. We want all women (including your mothers, daughters and friends) to CELEBRATE THEIR BEAUTY, OWN THEIR POWER and LIVE THEIR PASSION.

Connected by their experiences, Ginny Dixon, Dr. Susan Solman, and Wendy Crawford have been inspired to come together with women with disabilities across the country, and volunteer their time, in order to create Raw Beauty Project exhibits.

The first exhibit, Raw Beauty Project NYC, was launched on September 20, 2014 at ACA Galleries in Manhattan to a sold-out crowd. The exhibit has been to Miami, New York City and Washington DC as an educational tool for corporations, community groups and schools.

The team is creating a Los Angeles photo exhibit, which will make its debut September 17, 2016 at Paul Mitchell The School in Pasadena, CA. Photographed by fashion and celebrity photographers from the L.A. area, the exhibit will showcase twenty-five dynamic women with disabilities and their personal stories displayed next to them. The photographs are based on three words: beauty, power and passion. The L.A. exhibit will unveil a brand new way to experience The Raw Beauty Project photographs, using tactile printing in addition to traditional gallery prints. This exhibit will be the FIRST OF IT'S KIND and we need your help to make it happen! Share your passion and power, and celebrate raw beauty, by helping us make this exhibit happen!

Project Description: 

The Raw Beauty Project (RBP) photography exhibit is a powerful and impactful tool for education, self-acceptance and empowerment. The project is focused on women with disabilities, as they tend to struggle more with body image, and are marginalized in many areas including employment and finances.

Many of the models who participated in this exhibit have been inspired to bring the project to their hometowns. Angela Rockwood of the television series “Push Girls”, along with the RBP core team; including fashion photographer, Daryl Henderson as Creative Director and volunteers, are creating an exhibit scheduled to launch on September 17, 2016 in Los Angeles at Pasadena's  Paul Mitchell School,  825 E. Green St, Pasadena, CA.

Media: The original exhibit in New York resonated with media across the world, igniting a global conversation and has been featured in "O", Oprah Magazine, TODAY.com, Huffington Post, as well as many publications across Europe. You can see a full list of media at www.therawbeautyproject.com .

Who We Are:

Ginny Dixon spent most of the last 30 years making pictures at major newspapers and national and international magazines. Dixon is the Director of Photography at the Miami Ad School Wynwood, in Miami’s Arts District. She is also a member of three Pulitzer prize-winning newspaper staffs.

Dr. Susan Solman, a podiatrist, pharmacist, and college professor always strived to reach lofty goals until her life came to an abrupt halt when she became paralyzed at the age of 40 due to a spinal cord tumor. She felt she lost her purpose when she lost the use of her limbs. Through her own personal journey of self-acceptance, reinvention and empowerment, she does more than ever! Dr. Solman has devoted much of her time to The Raw Beauty Project, which inspires others to move forward in their own lives.

Wendy Crawford, an up-and-coming model was struck by a drunk driver on her way to the airport to leave for a modeling job and became paralyzed. Wendy, TEDx speaker and founder of mobileWOMEN.org, has been raising awareness of the particular issues that women with disabilities face, including the challenge of self-image and self-acceptance.

What are the Benefits of the Raw Beauty Project?

Education: The viewers have a glimpse into the lives of a rarely exposed group, women with disabilities. Through the models’ narratives, the audience is able to learn about their obstacles, their journeys to overcome them, and their passions.

In working with the models, the photographer begins to expand their definition of beauty and opens their minds to the possibilities of working with people with disabilities.

Empowerment: As the model goes through the process of becoming a model for the Raw Beauty Project, they become more confident.

The audience of the exhibit also learns to embrace their own beauty and strengths, and are inspired to tackle challenges in their own lives.

Opportunities: Visibility creates a society more cognizant of people with disabilities, and in turn, generates opportunities, including employment.

Why Do We Need Funding?

Although we volunteer our time, this project comes with costs including printing of the pictures and narratives which hang next to the pictures, shipping costs, venue rental, website (URL and hosting costs) social media postings and PR, and event production costs.

What Happens if we Exceed Our Goal?

If we get enough funding, we would love to hire women with disabilities to work on the project! Funds will go to shipping the exhibit to worthwhile organizations to create awareness and empower others.

How Can You Help:

We are extremely grateful for donations but there are other ways that you can help too!

·  Share our project with friends, family, organizations and anyone else that you feel may be interested!

·  Volunteer your time

·  In-kind donations such as printing, food & beverages for the event and auction items.

Embrace your Beauty, Own your Power, Live your Passion!

For tickets and more information, please visit www.therawbeautyproject.com

Donations to The Raw Beauty Project are tax-deductible through a fiscal agent. The Raw Beauty Project is funded by sponsors, donations and event ticket sales.

The Raw Beauty Project is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc (dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for The Raw Beauty Project and all donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane, Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or fax: 212-255-2053 or for our national charities registration,see details. A copy of our latest financial report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General, Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.
story_txt:
What is The
Raw Beauty Project?
The Raw Beauty Project is an innovative arts project that celebrates
women with disabilities, educating viewers to redefine perceptions and beauty,
unleashing potential for all. Note: The Raw Beauty Project is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc
(dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving
the performing arts community.
Presently, the media reflects a small fraction of the population and not
every day REAL people. Often, women and girls are left with an unrealistic,
false sense of how they should look. We want to change that so beauty is not
limited to a certain size, age, color or ability and uniqueness is celebrated.
We want all women (including your mothers, daughters and friends) to CELEBRATE
THEIR BEAUTY, OWN THEIR POWER and LIVE THEIR PASSION.
Connected by their experiences, Ginny Dixon, Dr. Susan Solman, and Wendy
Crawford have been inspired to come together with women with disabilities across the
country, and volunteer their time, in order to create Raw Beauty Project
exhibits.
The first exhibit, Raw Beauty Project NYC, was launched on September 20,
2014 at ACA Galleries in Manhattan to a sold-out crowd. The exhibit has been to
Miami, New York City and Washington DC as an educational tool for corporations,
community groups and schools.The team is creating a Los Angeles photo exhibit, which will make its debut
September 17, 2016 at Paul Mitchell The School in Pasadena, CA. Photographed by fashion and celebrity photographers from the L.A. area, the exhibit
will showcase twenty-five dynamic women with disabilities and their personal
stories displayed next to them. The
photographs are based on three words: beauty, power and passion. The L.A. exhibit will unveil a brand new way to experience The Raw 
Beauty Project photographs, using tactile printing in addition to traditional gallery prints. This exhibit will be the FIRST OF IT'S KIND and we need your help to make it happen! Share your passion and power, and celebrate raw beauty, by helping us
make this exhibit happen!

Project
Description: 
The Raw Beauty Project (RBP) photography exhibit is a powerful and
impactful tool for education, self-acceptance and empowerment. The project is
focused on women with disabilities, as they tend to struggle more with body
image, and are marginalized in many areas including employment and finances.
Many of the models who participated in this exhibit have been inspired
to bring the project to their hometowns. Angela Rockwood of the television
series “Push Girls”, along with the RBP core team; including fashion
photographer, Daryl Henderson as Creative Director and volunteers, are creating
an exhibit scheduled to launch on September 17, 2016 in Los Angeles at
Pasadena's  Paul Mitchell School,  825 E. Green St, Pasadena, CA.Media: The original exhibit in New York resonated with media across the world, igniting a global conversation and has been featured in "O", Oprah Magazine, TODAY.com, Huffington Post, as well as many publications across Europe. You can see a full list of media at www.therawbeautyproject.com .Who We Are:Ginny Dixon spent most of the last 30 years making pictures at major newspapers and national and international magazines. Dixon is the Director of Photography at the Miami Ad School Wynwood, in Miami’s Arts District. She is also a member of three Pulitzer prize-winning newspaper staffs.Dr. Susan Solman, a podiatrist, pharmacist, and college professor always strived to reach lofty goals until her life came to an abrupt halt when she became paralyzed at the age of 40 due to a spinal cord tumor. She felt she lost her purpose when she lost the use of her limbs. Through her own personal journey of self-acceptance, reinvention and empowerment, she does more than ever! Dr. Solman has devoted much of her time to The Raw Beauty Project, which inspires others to move forward in their own lives.Wendy Crawford, an up-and-coming model was struck by a drunk driver on her way to the airport to leave for a modeling job and became paralyzed. Wendy, TEDx speaker and founder of mobileWOMEN.org, has been raising awareness of the particular issues that women with disabilities face, including the challenge of self-image and self-acceptance.What are the
Benefits of the Raw Beauty Project?
Education: The viewers have a glimpse into the lives of a rarely exposed
group, women with disabilities. Through the models’ narratives, the audience is
able to learn about their obstacles, their journeys to overcome them, and their
passions.
In working with the models, the photographer begins to expand their
definition of beauty and opens their minds to the possibilities of working with
people with disabilities.
Empowerment: As the model goes through the process of becoming a model
for the Raw Beauty Project, they become more confident.
The audience of the exhibit also learns to embrace their own beauty and
strengths, and are inspired to tackle challenges in their own lives.
Opportunities: Visibility creates a society more cognizant of people
with disabilities, and in turn, generates opportunities, including employment.Why Do We Need
Funding?
Although we volunteer our time, this project comes with costs including
printing of the pictures and narratives which hang next to the pictures,
shipping costs, venue rental, website (URL and hosting costs) social media
postings and PR, and event production costs.
What Happens
if we Exceed Our Goal?
If we get enough funding, we would love to hire women with disabilities
to work on the project! Funds will go to shipping the exhibit to
worthwhile organizations to create awareness and empower others.

How Can You
Help:
We are extremely grateful for donations but there are other ways that
you can help too!
·  Share our project with friends, family, organizations and anyone
else that you feel may be interested!
·  Volunteer your time
·  In-kind donations such as printing, food & beverages for the
event and auction items.Embrace your Beauty, Own your Power, Live your Passion!
For tickets and more information, please visit www.therawbeautyproject.com
Donations to The Raw Beauty Project are tax-deductible through a fiscal
agent. The Raw Beauty Project is funded by sponsors, donations and event ticket
sales.
The Raw Beauty Project is a sponsored artist with Performance Zone Inc
(dba The Field), a not-for-profit, tax-exempt, 501(c)(3) organization serving
the performing arts community. Contributions to The Field earmarked for The Raw
Beauty Project and all donations are tax-deductible to the extent allowed by
law. For more information about The Field contact: The Field, 75 Maiden Lane,
Suite 906 New York, NY 10038, phone: 212-691-6969 or fax: 212-255-2053 or for our
national charities registration,see details. A copy of our latest financial
report may be obtained from The Field or from the Office of Attorney General,
Charities Bureau, 120 Broadway, New York, NY 10271.

story:
I am a model since 2010 and I've been stealing interesting ideas and also tehniques from all the photographers I've worked with. I started taking photos in a more serious way 4 years ago. Until then I used a point and shoot and I used to shoot trains and railways. I've been told so many times that I am talented. I am currently studying photography and I love it so much. Right now I need a full frame camera - Canon 5D Mark III and at least 2 lenses and a professional set of lights. I am also saving money for that but I would need like 6000 euros to get everything and start working at my best ever. I style is nude, glamour, bourlesque, sexy, artsy.

Thank you very much for supporting my art!

story:
I've been providing figure skating pictures of ISU events for 3 years now, and need a little extra help to continue to be able to do so in Vancouver. Any donation of $6 or more will receive a print of a skater of your choice. You can send a message with your preferred skater and if you have a particular favorite image you can even let me know which one. I can also send a folder of images to choose from or you can make it photographer's choice. If you dpn't see your preferred skater listed below, feel free to send a message with a request and I will do my best to fill it. Shipping will be an extra $3.50 to the US and $10 to Canada, and $15 elsewhere. though for 1 and 3 print packages if you are attending the GPF feel free to find me and choose from a stack of pictures I have. Select "Holy See" for shipping location to pick up at the Final. This is optional though, as the prints I have at the Grand Prix Final are a special set and I am giving these prints away to the public for free. You are invited to come receive these prints for free as well if you are in attendance.

 

The list of available skaters is

Junhwan Cha
Yuzuru Hanyu
Jason Brown
Shoma Uno
Evgenia Medvedeva
Satoko Miyahara
Alina Zagitova
Vanessa James and Morgan Cipres
Aleksandra Stepanova and Ivan Bukin

story:
My Story

Hello everyone! I am Nydia Williams, a senior at Ithaca College studying Still Photography and African Diaspora Studies. This semester I am enrolled in Photo Workshop- my last photography course before I graduate in December 2011. The goal of this course is create a body of work that is continuously revisited and built upon throughout the semester. The product will be a cohesive set of photographs that are presentation ready.My entire class will have a group exhibition and display our work in downtown Ithaca for the community to enjoy in the first week of May, 2011. 

My project is an exploration of identity using a large format camera. This means that I am shooting film (the negatives are 4 inches by 5 inches), envision one of those cameras where people put the black cloth over their head and that's me!
In order to complete my project, I need help. While there are many reasons that I need financial assistance to fund this project, I ask for your help on the basis of the work. I have put a lot of thought, time, tears, and joy into this work. I believe in it, and I think you will too. It is important because it reflects the artistic work of my major, as well as the academic work of my minor. 

The Impact

As I am sitting here looking at all the photographs I have made thus far, I see a body of work that evokes pain, confusion, wonder, and frustration. These are emotions we each experience as we each try to figure out who we truly are. For me, it has always been about the journey and finding beauty within the struggle of coming to a personal understanding of who you are. 

Artist Statement (work in progress)

I have always considered photography to be a selfish act; a negotiation between what is real or tangible in the world, how I make sense of it, and my place within. I am interested in how my work functions as a replacement for the words I have trouble finding. My photographs work as momentary output, reflections of my current condition. They are often an amalgam of memory and fantasy, because at times I am unable to distinguish between the two.

 

With this series of photographs I am exploring the concept of identity and the ways in which it is formed, fostered, and functions. Coming to an understanding about oneself is an intimate experience, but also very much about the world and society at large. We are constantly receiving messages about who we are (and should be) based upon inherent traits such as race, gender, and sexuality. Historically these constructs offer certain people privileges, while they leave others oppressed with limited access to resources.

 

My subjects enter a space of contemplation, which is tainted by my personal journey of self-awareness but also reflective of their individuality. As people of African descent stereotypes have been created and perpetuated about them in American. Often, these myths were used as justification for mistreatment and to deny Black people equal status, rights, and opportunities. It is within this environment where they are forced to see themselves through the eyes of others, which they must come to understand themselves.

How do Black people cultivate and nourish a positive self-image? How is this journey painful, yet beautiful?

 

What I Need & What You Get

Because I have applied for two grants this semester, I have a very detailed budget...but that's kind of boring. In it's entirety my project will cost about $1,400, but here are the most important things you need to know, to understand where the money will go. I have already produced the bulk of the work, most of the images are made, developed, and now in digital form. Now, I have to get them ready for presentation which means they need to be mounted or framed- in addition I am making a photo book. 

I plan on making 24X30 prints that will be Sintra mounted, which means they will be mounted to plastic and laminated. I want to have 10 prints total, that cost approximately $100 each. I believe that 10 prints are needed in order for the viewer to gain a complete understanding of my exploration. 

For those of you that enjoy the work I make, this is an opportunity for you to be a part of my work. I always say that- I could never produce work if it were not for the help of my family,friends, and community. So many people have been my models, assistants, location lenders, prop securers and support in general. Thank you!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can come to the exhibition! Some how, some way, I will have work to exhibit and you should come see it. I will post the details on my Facebook page when the time comes.

story:
Our Story

Hello, my name is Chris Pahls.  I am a first year art teacher at USD 299 Sylvan-Lucas Unified High School in Sylvan Grove Ks (USD299.org).  We are a small rural school in the middle of the beautiful Great Plains.  Putting technology into the hands of our students is something we strive for.  While many schools are cutting art programs, USD 299 sees the importance of education in the arts and takes steps to preserve it.  We are offering our art students a new class this year:  Graphic Design and Digital Photography.  After unifying with another district last year, the school's camera collection grew from two to four Canon Rebel XT's.  With last years expected enrollment of 6 to 7 students, four cameras would be plenty for teaching and shooting digital photographs on a daily basis.  However, much to my amazement and joy, my numbers are much higher.  We have 15 students enrolled!  While we are thrilled to have the equipment that we do, it is simply not enough to teach 15 eager photographers and share with our Desktop Publishing class.  You now have the opportunity to help us fund this awesome learning experience.


The Impact

Here is what your contribution can do.  By helping to fund our campaign you can put the power of creativity, imagination, documentation, and digital technology into the hands of some really great kids who deserve it.  Our photography staff will take pictures for our yearbook, art shows, their personal portfolios, various community events, and the first school news paper we've had in a long time.  These students will be able to showcase all of the great things that go on in this school to their communities.  You can give our students the ability to learn a medium that they can love for the rest of their lives.  Some of them might even go on to make a little money at it.  You will be providing the foundation for numerous art and journalism scholarships.  Art education helps students academically, socially, and prepares them to be well rounded individuals who become productive adults capable of changing the world.


What We Need & What You Get

We are looking for funding for 5 more classroom cameras and 1 instructor camera.  We will be buying from B and H (bhphotovideo.com).  They offer great equipment at a great price.  We are looking to purchase 5 Sony Alpha A390's or 5 Canon Rebel XS's and one Pentax K-R for instructor use.  Any funding left after purchasing cameras will go to protective equipment, bags, lenses, and memory cards.


Other Ways You Can Help


You can also help us get the word out.  Post a link to our IndieGoGo page on your Facebook or twitter accounts.  Email your friends and family with a link to this page.  Tell your co-workers using good old fashioned word of mouth.  Anything you can do to help us reach our goal is greatly appreciated.

story:
THE BOOK IS STILL AVAILABLE !

With the help of crowdfunding the book was printed in Germany and is now available here for online purchase. A 96 page, A4 size, hardcover book printed on 200gr. paper in state of the art quality with facts, stories and 53 large pictures of 15 planes on 4 continents:

- for shipment outside Europe please paypal $49 USD:  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=79WTDCRFS2NSA

- for shipment in Europe please paypal €39 EURO (incl.VAT):  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=GPCUVMT9C3WD2

- for shipment in Germany please paypal €34,90 EURO (incl.VAT):  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=8CC3DGWEG2DJA  (in D geht auch Lastschrift - bitte im link auf Kreditkarte/Lastschrift clicken)

- for a SIGNED BOOK incl. worldwide shipment please paypal $59 USD:  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xc...

With Paypal you can pay with your credit card even without having a Paypal account. Please allow 2-3 weeks for overseas shipments and 5-10 days in Europe. With the purchase of the book you will also get access to the 'making of' pdf-files with exact locations of the planes, how i got there and links for further research. You will receive the link to the pdf-files with the shipment notification. Please read the comments section what buyers have to say about the quality of the book. If you don't feel confident that the book will arrive overseas - i have shipped more than 2500 from New Zealand to Alaska and they all arrived. Thank you for the support.

If you are interested in a Fine Art Print please contact dietmar.eckell@gmail.com.

For more of my work: www.dietmareckell.com

For updates please 'like' my facebook page: www.fb.com/138143699584627

 

'Happy End' is a photo-project about miracles in aviation history - 15 airplanes that had forced landings but ALL on board survived and were rescued from the remote locations. The planes remain abandoned in nowhere since 10-70 years. It's part of my long term project 'restwert' (german for residual value) to document abandoned objects with fascinating backgrounds like cold war relicts, olympic sites, flooded churches, railroad tracks, never finished nuclear reactors, overgrown adventure parks etc. -> www.dietmareckell.com

This series is for me more than wrecks not worth to recover: it's surreal - beautiful airplanes in vast landscapes with wonderful stories. 'happy end' is about

  • heroes - the pilots who turned desasters into miracles,
  • destiny - to survive a crash landing and get found in nowhere,
  • time - crashed in seconds and then untouched for decades,
  • space - even majestic airplanes can look lost in vast nature,
  • 'the end' - while most get scrapped in junk yards - these found a place to 'rest in peace'.

It started with my interest in the visual disruption of nostalgic technology in endless landscapes - but soon i got hooked to these planes/stories and spent over two years researching and documenting them. Aviation miracles are rare and the planes remaining out there are very remote - but the challenge was motivation and it was like a pilgrimage to get to these 'wonders' on 4 continents from Papua New Guinea to the Arctic Circle. 

My photography is not about documenting the planes condition & details but how they are embedded in grand nature after so many years. I try to capture the surreal beauty of these settings using high viewpoints or shooting through layers. Inspired by the shipwreck painters of the romantic period i look for dramatic skies, late light or fall colors to 'glorify' these wonderful planes. 

What I Need & What You Get

Now I want to share the photographs & stories in a self-published coffee table book and need your help to get it printed. 96 pages with over 50 large pictures along with facts and story of every plane. Clean layout, hard cover, A4 landscape format (8.3x11.7inch), 170gr thick paper, printed by one of the best photo-book printers in Germany. Most of the pictures were taken with 36 or 21 megapixel cameras with amazing details and the spreads up to 60cm wide (23.4inch) will show this quality. It's a limited edition photo-book for friends of photography, tech-gurus, aviation fans, veterans, explorers, nostalgics and everybody interested in the surreal beauty this world has to offer.

Status: The pictures are selected and the layout is finished. Next are the print-preproduction, proofs and the print-run of the books. This will require a total of $6000 which is the stretch goal of the campaign. With $4000 pledged i feel confident to start the production and cover the gap with the sales of the remaining books.

For those more interested in my journey to these remote airplanes there is a ‘The Making Of’ perk for $15. You get access to a 15 episode long online pdf-journal - where these planes exactly are, how to get there, google maps, pictures from the journey, links for further research and details to the photography. I will share learnings, failures and anecdotes like getting stuck with the Canadian police, how i lost my oktocopter in polar bear country, how to cross african borders with rebels or settle a land dispute in Papua New Guinea. 

Or consider a fine art print in very small editions for your home/office. Up tp 150cm (59 inch) wide prints with amazing details printed on archival museum quality Hahnemühle paper. Shipped in mailing tubes. For details see perks. 

About Myself

For 25 years i have been exploring with my camera the backroads of this fast changing world. My passion are 'empty' places like the Sahara, Mongolia, Bolivia, Alaska, Australia and Tibet. As mobility/flexibility is key for this kind of photography I normally travel alone by bicycle, motorcycle, 4WD or paramotor. The first abandoned objects i found by chance - today i plan my trips in great detail with the help of the internet. To keep the cost low and the experience real no production companies or professional guides are involved - it's a one man show and I only rely on the help of locals. You can see more of my work on www.dietmareckell.com 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.

The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!

Thank you so much for your support!
story_txt:
THE BOOK IS STILL AVAILABLE !With the help of crowdfunding the book was printed in Germany and is now available here for online purchase. A 96 page, A4 size, hardcover book printed on 200gr. paper in state of the art quality with facts, stories and 53 large pictures of 15 planes on 4 continents:- for shipment outside Europe please paypal $49 USD:  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=79WTDCRFS2NSA- for shipment in Europe please paypal €39 EURO (incl.VAT):  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=GPCUVMT9C3WD2- for shipment in Germany please paypal €34,90 EURO (incl.VAT):  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=8CC3DGWEG2DJA  (in D geht auch Lastschrift - bitte im link auf Kreditkarte/Lastschrift clicken)- for a SIGNED BOOK incl. worldwide shipment please paypal $59 USD:  https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xc...With Paypal you can pay with your credit card even without having a Paypal account. Please allow 2-3 weeks for overseas shipments and 5-10 days in Europe. With the purchase of the book you will also get access to the 'making of' pdf-files with exact locations of the planes, how i got there and links for further research. You will receive the link to the pdf-files with the shipment notification. Please read the comments section what buyers have to say about the quality of the book. If you don't feel confident that the book will arrive overseas - i have shipped more than 2500 from New Zealand to Alaska and they all arrived. Thank you for the support.If you are interested in a Fine Art Print please contact dietmar.eckell@gmail.com.For more of my work: www.dietmareckell.comFor updates please 'like' my facebook page: www.fb.com/138143699584627 'Happy End' is a photo-project about miracles in aviation history - 15 airplanes that had forced landings but ALL on board survived and were rescued from the remote locations. The planes remain abandoned in nowhere since 10-70 years. It's part of my long term project 'restwert' (german for residual value) to document abandoned objects with fascinating backgrounds like cold war relicts, olympic sites, flooded churches, railroad tracks, never finished nuclear reactors, overgrown adventure parks etc. -> www.dietmareckell.comThis series is for me more than wrecks not worth to recover: it's surreal - beautiful airplanes in vast landscapes with wonderful stories. 'happy end' is about
heroes - the pilots who turned desasters into miracles,
destiny - to survive a crash landing and get found in nowhere,
time - crashed in seconds and then untouched for decades,
space - even majestic airplanes can look lost in vast nature,
'the end' - while most get scrapped in junk yards - these found a place to 'rest in peace'.
It started with my interest in the visual disruption of nostalgic technology in endless landscapes - but soon i got hooked to these planes/stories and spent over two years researching and documenting them. Aviation miracles are rare and the planes remaining out there are very remote - but the challenge was motivation and it was like a pilgrimage to get to these 'wonders' on 4 continents from Papua New Guinea to the Arctic Circle. My photography is not about documenting the planes condition & details but how they are embedded in grand nature after so many years. I try to capture the surreal beauty of these settings using high viewpoints or shooting through layers. Inspired by the shipwreck painters of the romantic period i look for dramatic skies, late light or fall colors to 'glorify' these wonderful planes. What I Need & What You GetNow I want to share the photographs & stories in a self-published coffee table book and need your help to get it printed. 96 pages with over 50 large pictures along with facts and story of every plane. Clean layout, hard cover, A4 landscape format (8.3x11.7inch), 170gr thick paper, printed by one of the best photo-book printers in Germany. Most of the pictures were taken with 36 or 21 megapixel cameras with amazing details and the spreads up to 60cm wide (23.4inch) will show this quality. It's a limited edition photo-book for friends of photography, tech-gurus, aviation fans, veterans, explorers, nostalgics and everybody interested in the surreal beauty this world has to offer.Status: The pictures are selected and the layout is finished. Next are the print-preproduction, proofs and the print-run of the books. This will require a total of $6000 which is the stretch goal of the campaign. With $4000 pledged i feel confident to start the production and cover the gap with the sales of the remaining books.For those more interested in my journey to these remote airplanes there is a ‘The Making Of’ perk for $15. You get access to a 15 episode long online pdf-journal - where these planes exactly are, how to get there, google maps, pictures from the journey, links for further research and details to the photography. I will share learnings, failures and anecdotes like getting stuck with the Canadian police, how i lost my oktocopter in polar bear country, how to cross african borders with rebels or settle a land dispute in Papua New Guinea. Or consider a fine art print in very small editions for your home/office. Up tp 150cm (59 inch) wide prints with amazing details printed on archival museum quality Hahnemühle paper. Shipped in mailing tubes. For details see perks. About MyselfFor 25 years i have been exploring with my camera the backroads of this fast changing world. My passion are 'empty' places like the Sahara, Mongolia, Bolivia, Alaska, Australia and Tibet. As mobility/flexibility is key for this kind of photography I normally travel alone by bicycle, motorcycle, 4WD or paramotor. The first abandoned objects i found by chance - today i plan my trips in great detail with the help of the internet. To keep the cost low and the experience real no production companies or professional guides are involved - it's a one man show and I only rely on the help of locals. You can see more of my work on www.dietmareckell.com Other Ways You Can Help:If you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help:Please share this campaign with your friends on facebook, twitter or send to your email contacts who you think might be interested in this project.The Indiegogo share tools on this site can help get the word out!Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Two Women One Mission

Two Women One Mission are photographers Heather Wallace and Ali Lockwood. Our main goal is to bring awareness to Washington State mountains and unrecognized national parks. There are many publications about some of the major national parks, like Yosemite and Yellowstone. However, some national parks and Washington tend to be put on the way side.

We want to bring awareness to these places using our photography. If the mission is successful we will go on to other places in Washington State and on to other parts of the world that are less talked about or forgotten.

The end goal is to produce a beautiful photo essay book and have a gallery showing event.

What We Need & What You Get

We need $8,000 so that we can have the funds for travel expenses, camp and essential equipment needed for this trip and also funding to print the book and put on a showing of the images at a Gallery.

What you will receive:

Any bit helps! We are grateful for any amount that you contribute. Your contribution helps us feel like other care about our parks and what it be represented as much as we do. For a certain amount of money you donate you can receive some pretty cool items.

$10 - Name in the Book

You will receive your name in the back of the book as a donator.

$25 - Postcard

You will receive a postcard of an image from the trip and your name will be in the back of the book as a donator.

$50 - Print

You will receive a 8x10 print of an image from the trip. Also, your name will be in the back of the book as a donator.

$75 -  Print and Postcard

You will receive a postcard and a 8x10 print of an image from the trip. Also, your name will be in the back of the book as a donator.

$100 - Book

You will receive a signed hardcover copy of the book and your name will be in the back of the book as a donator.


$1,000 - Book, postcard, print and private dinner

You will receive a signed hardcover copy of the book and your name will be in the back of the book. You will also recieve a postcard and a print of an image from the trip. The special perk is you will get special recognition as well as a private dinner before the gallery showing.

 

Your help is most important:

Basically, with your help you can give us the funds needed so that we can go out and photograph these places they are looked over, like the Central Cascades.  We want to show the beautiful state and many more. Help us start what could be a great adventure that we will show you through our photography. This world is a beautiful place. Help us show it.
 
ALSO! 25% of our book and gallery sales will be donated to a project that is also in support of Washington State called the Mountains to Sound Greenway project!
 
You can help by donating money. Also, spread the word! The more people who know the better. You can visit our other pages to find out more ways to donate:
www.facebook.com/2women1mission
twitter:  @2women1mission
www.twomphotography.blogspot.com
 

Check out our photography on our websites:

www.alimagesphoto.com  - Ali Lockwood
www.photsbyhw.com - Heather Wallace

story:
Welcome!

Hello, I'm so glad to have you here, my name is Devan Squires. Thank you for your interest in this project!

 

The Book: The Gardens at Temple Square

From 2016 to 2020 I lived, worked, and worshiped within a half-mile area, allowing me to walk through Temple Square almost every day. The spring flowers so full of life, color, and joy inspired me to start photographing the gardens. Once I started photographing, I realized that I wanted to capture the beauty of every season over multiple years. This project became even more important to me after the announcement of Temple Square’s closing for several years for renovations. 

The Gardens at Temple Square is a 9 inch by 12 inch, 168 page book that immerses you in the lush gardens on Temple Square. The book documents the gardens throughout the seasons with photographs and poetry. Ruth Stoneman wrote and curated the wonderful selection of poetry in this book. The poems are uplifting and joyful, reflecting the beauty of the gardens.

 

My Story

I'm a CPA, yup, an accountant trying to self-publish a photography/poetry book! Eleven years ago I started college as a photography student at BYU. After a couple years I was accepted into the Bachelors of Fine Arts - Photography program but instead of pursuing that degree, I decided to switch to accounting.

I have continued to do photography as a hobby, but since the day I decided to discontinue pursuing a photography degree I have had two photography-related goals.

  1. Show my photos in a gallery
  2. Publish a book of my photos

Nine years later, this book is letting me finally accomplish one of those goals and I am asking you to help me on this journey!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Below is a breakdown of why I am asking for this amount, and what you get in return when you contribute.

Because of the cost efficiency of printing more copies, I am hoping that lots of people will be interested in the book! The $7,600 in funding would go toward printing 100 books, this is an opportunity for you to purchase prints from the book and the book itself since I do not anticipate it being sold in stores.

  • I need $7,600 of funding to cover the cost of printing 100 books. 
  • I am printing through a high quality, small batch publisher called Edition One. Printing 100 books comes out to approximately $76/book.
    • base cost of $46/book
    • + fees $200
    • + shipping from the printer $500
    • + taxes $350
    • + shipping to you $15/book
    • + Indigogo fees 9%

 

  • Even if you can't, or don't want to purchase a book, there are great perks for any amount, even $5. I even have some great bonus perks I'm throwing in when you purchase a book!
    • $5 - Phone wallpaper emailed to you
    • $10 - Personalized thank you postcard with a photo from the book
    • $25 - 8x10 print
    • $50 - 11x14 print
    • $75 - 16x20 print
    • $100 - 1 copy of the book
    • $200 - 1 copy of the book, plus a 20x30 print
      • To select a photo, visit this URL to view the options
      • https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1z0hPUbwawdj-lfk42p6Hu44WdeBOj9n2?usp=sharing
      • Note the number and letter on the photo and select those options when you choose your perk
      Note, all prints are your choice from a selection of photos included in the book

 

On some platforms if the goal isn't reached then no money is contributed, that is not the case with Indiegogo, your contribution will still go toward funding the project. If I don't reach the overall goal I will send you the perk you have purchased. 

The book is ready to go to the printer, and I would love to share it with as many people as I possibly can; it has been a labor of love for almost five years!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that this is a difficult time, if you would still like to support me but are unable to make a monetary donation at this time, here are other ways you can help:

  • Share this campaign with your friends and family
  • Share on social media using the Indiegogo share tools, or you can share the posts I've created on Facebook and Instagram (@DevanSquires)

Thank you for your support!

story:
Ever wondered how that photographer got 50,000 followers? Or if, in fact, there is any benefit to blogging and tweeting and posting and sharing? Is Social Media a waste of time, or can it be useful?

Follow Ollie, the Director of Virtually Famous, as he attempts to use Social Media to make contact with people around the world to make the film - can he use Social Media to make a film and prove that it can be a useful business and networking tool? Or is Social Media not all it's cracked up to be - a whole lot of people talking about themselves to nobody in particular?

Virtually Famous will interview leading creative people and discuss how they use Social Media as a tool in their businesses, if it has helped build their profile  and grow their networks, and whether or not there's any business generated from it. 

---------------------

 

"I am a filmmaker from New Zealand, and I want to prove that Social Media can be a useful business tool by interviewing influential people in the creative industry about their views and successes using Social Media. The sub-plot is the actual making of the movie itself will be by using Social Media to connect with these people, and the journey I go on from inception of the idea through connecting with and meeting in real life people with thousands of 'followers'.


Not only will the stories of these influentials teach the viewer about how useful a tool Social Media can be, the journey the viewer goes on with me making the film will show the effectiveness social media can have in a tangible way."

- Ollie Dale

 

---------------------

 

INTERVIEWED, IN THE BAG, DONE AND DUSTED

Name: Philip Bloom
“Cinematographer, Filmmaker, Blogger etc. DSLR Cinematographer”
Location: London, UK
Twitter: @PhilipBloom 39,000+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Nino Leitner
“Award winning cinematographer, filmmaker, film producer”
Location: Vienna, Austria
Twitter: @NinoLeitner 24,000+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

 

PEOPLE WE'LL INTERVIEW WITH THE FUNDS RAISED HERE:

These Peeps have confirmed their availability and interest in being a part of Virtually Famous:

Location: Los Angeles, USA
Twitter: @VincentLaforet 37,900+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Mitch “Planet5D” Aunger
“planet5d - the best HDSLR information on the planet!”
Location: St Louis, USA
Twitter: @Planet5D 22,300+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

“Speaking and Training on Building and Maintaining Relationships Online”
Location: New Zealand
Twitter: @BlueBanana20 3,500+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Chris Mclennan
“Director and Photographer”
Location: New Zealand
Facebook: 26,000+ Likes

                                            ---------------------------------------

 

WANT TO INTERVIEW

These Peeps are the Holy Grail - their Social Media stories are awesome and would be a fantastic addition to Virtually Famous... if only I could get through to them!

Name: Chase Jarvis
“Maniac Photographer Director”
Location: Seattle & NYC, USA
Twitter: @ChaseJarvis 113,000+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Brian “BT” Transeau
“Grammy Nominated Composer and Technologist”
Location: USA
Twitter: @BT 335,000+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Jasmine Star
“Photographer. Blogger.”
Location: USA
Twitter: @jasminestar 40,900+ Followers

                                            ---------------------------------------


Virtually Famous is being filmed and edited by New Zealand filmmaker and professional photographer Ollie Dale, a Master of Photography with the New Zealand Institute of Professional Photography.

"I wanted to meet these people with tens of thousands of followers and see how they do it, and to find out if Social Media really is worth the effort. From what I've seen so far I'm sure many people will look at Social Media in a totally different way."

Virtually Famous will premier in New Zealand in September 2012, and we need your help to get us there! Pick a pledge, be a part of our project, and help make our dreams become reality!

These Peeps are the Holy Grail - their Social Media stories are awesome and would be a fantastic addition to Virtually Famous... if only I could get through to them!

Name: Chase Jarvis“Maniac Photographer Director”Location: Seattle & NYC, USATwitter: @ChaseJarvis 113,000+ Followers
                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Brian “BT” Transeau“Grammy Nominated Composer and Technologist”Location: USATwitter: @BT 335,000+ Followers
                                            ---------------------------------------

Name: Jasmine Star“Photographer. Blogger.”Location: USATwitter: @jasminestar 40,900+ Followers
                                            ---------------------------------------


Virtually Famous is being filmed and edited by New Zealand filmmaker and professional photographer Ollie Dale, a Master of Photography with the New Zealand Institute of Professional Photography.
"I wanted to meet these people with tens of thousands of followers and see how they do it, and to find out if Social Media really is worth the effort. From what I've seen so far I'm sure many people will look at Social Media in a totally different way."
Virtually Famous will premier in New Zealand in September 2012, and we need your help to get us there! Pick a pledge, be a part of our project, and help make our dreams become reality!

story:
A fellow Weymouthite and local photographer had his camera body and half a dozen lenses stolen from him a few days ago. He has had photos published in the official Weymouth calendar and is always sharing his photos of Weymouth with us on WIE. We would like to help him replace his stolen equipment so we can start enjoying his photographs again 


This is a chance to help right a wrong in your community. Donations are very easy to make and PayPal is accepted.

story:
Summary of our project

Our project looks in to the digression of buildings which have become forgotten in time. We photograph derelict buildings and try to show their beauty and architecture in a positive light, many buildings we photograph will soon be knocked down or deteriorate past repair, so we try to record their presence before this time comes so they can be remembered and seen by those who may otherwise not have the opportunity to witness such grandeur.


Why we need funding
In December 2010 we visited Europe (along with many other locations around the UK at other times) for a month. We explored Germany, Brugge, Belgium, France and Switzerland. Now, we want to do it again- on an even more epic scale! We need to raise money to make this happen, last winter it cost us around £3000, for ferries, hostels, supplies, safety equipment and petrol. Your funding will help to kick start the process of this again so we can produce more stunning imagery of buildings we know only have months left of existence. By donating we hope to be able to show off these buildings to everyone, especially those who have donated to the cause, to show the world these beautiful locations, which many do not even know exist. Your funding will help pay for campsites, ferries petrol as well as supporting us for our location hunting, editing time, creation time, and the compilation of the book.

The book we want to make should be around 25cmx 25cm with a strong solid exterior. About 30% of this book is already photographed and ready for production. We are aiming for a paperweight of 200 GSM and between 50 and 70 pages. These details can be finalised when we have all of the images and order quantities. The more books we sell, the more money we can put in to making the book even better; thicker bigger, stronger!  

Our book will be filled with full-page colour photographs, it will also express our thoughts, feelings and knowledge of the history of each individual structure pictured. We will explain the smells, the atmosphere, the light, everything we can think of about our experience. This is going to be very special to us as it will be our first book we have marketed to an audience. It will have a hard exterior and be an item to keep and treasure, a solid relic to the buildings it contains which may no longer stand. The book will ignite your senses, fill you with awe, and flood you with feelings. The aim of our book is to celebrate architecture and grandeur of decay. The book will demonstrate an understanding of key safety precautions which is not normally expressed in these types of books. We do not want to influence people to enter derelict structures not knowing what they are getting themselves in to. We will dedicate a page talking about our photographic kit and our safety kit such as correct masks overalls and footwear, even down to the powerful torches we use to keep safe.


What we can offer you
As well as our eternal thanks for all of your support and interest in our project there are some things we can offer to you in return for all of your help. For any donation you make, you will be given access to exclusive video footage of our journey, we will share those little things that make what we do special!  As we are still working on a relatively small scale publishing wise, creating products can be expensive, especially making professional books (not those terrible vista print, bonus print etc etc. ones!) So to fund the project our perk amounts reflect this. The aim is to give you beautiful products from our journey, but also raise the money so it is possible for us to capture and bring these things to life! And of course, whether you have the money to support us or not you can follow our progress on the Facebook page:


https://www.facebook.com/pages/Derelict-architecture-photographic-book-by-Craig-and-Amanda/344452579010770

don't forget to share it with your friends too!

 


So here's some things you might be interested in:

Loose change

Anything you can offer will be greatly appreciated, you will be given access to the youtube videos for supporting us. 

 

Personal thank you message and our eternal thanks!

If you donate £5 or more to our project we will be eternally grateful for your help and support to make this happen, we will send you a personal message as a thank you! By donating you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

signed postcard

A signed post card of one of the best locations visited on our journey, designs will vary. By ordering the book you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

The Hard cover book

This is the main item which we want to create from our journey. it will be a high quality document to treasure, and to share. This book should be about 25cm x 25cm with at least 50 pages, with a unique and pleasing finish. By ordering the book you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

Hardback book and credit in the book as a main supporter

without you, this project couldn't happen, as a thanks for all of your help in making this book possible, we will credit contributors to let everyone know of the great support we have received. By ordering the book you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

A digital book

A book designed to be viewed on your computer laptop or tablet, this book will neatly display all of the images from our journey, and will include some which didn't make the final cut for the book. By ordering the digital book you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

A digital book and 10x8" signed print of your choice from the book

you will receive the digital book via e-mail, then once you have chosen a print we post you your signed artwork to your address. By ordering the book you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

Box of Prints

A Box of four 10x8" of the best images from our portfolio, signed by me and Craig, two from each of us. By ordering prints you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support.

 

Aluminum print of the blue Chateau

A 42x30cm aluminum print of the stunning building featured on this page printed on a high-quality, glossy vinyl film with solvent-free HP latex inks, applied on a 3 mm thick aluminum composite panel, with a center of a hard, black plastic core for stability. coated with a clear UV protective film. Ordering this unique item, you will also have access to exclusive video footage on our youtube page. you will also be mentioned on the Facebook page for your support, and appear in the book as a supporter.

 

Canvas Print and book 

40x30cm canvas print of your choice picked from the gallery we will add to the facebook page. You will also recieve a copy of the book , which you will be mentioned in as a supporter. you will have access to the youtube videos. 

 

Other ways you can help

Please spread the word about our project, even if you don't have the funds to donate, we want everyone to get involved and see what we are trying to achieve by our trip!


Contact us with your opinions and feedback!
craigandamanda@live.com

https://www.facebook.com/pages/Derelict-architecture-photographic-book-by-craig-and-amanda/344452579010770

 

 

        THANK YOU FOR SUPPORTING OUR PROJECT!

story:
We are a group of Middle Schoolers from Arizona. Our school is raising money for our field trips throughout the year. Some of these trips are: Playformance, a place where kids our age can get together can play physical games, such as dodgeball, competitive sports, obstacle courses and more. We will also be going to the Me-to-We Windsong Ranch to learn new ways to experience life as well as different world views . We will be using all of the money we earn from this crowdfunding project towards our school immersion trips. Fund our fun, and help us create, protect and change our world for the better. Donate Now.

Order your perks before December 1st, so we can get all of the products in before the Holidays. To look at our photos, click on the gallery tab of this page. If there are any specific images you want us to use, just let us know in the comment section by typing in the image number and don't forget to mention which perk you want your choice image to be applied to. Their are 6 examples of our products in the image gallery.

story:
To fund this project in Japan, please see at the Motion Gallery website.

日本語での支援をご希望の方は、以下のリンクから応援をお願い致します。

MotionGallery web site


A visual reference & a documentary of street culture

We aim to produce a photo book as a visual reference for the history of fashion as well as a photographed documentary of teenagers who played a role as a ’a piece of art’ in the street of Harajuku.


About the Book

Layers of chunky plastic accessories and Adidas’s zip-ups. Eye-dazzling as it is colourful, a total one-off style that like nothing anyone had seen before. In the late 90’s, this unique movement known as “Decora fashion” began. 

Radical Japanese fashion culture is again attracting interest and inspiring the the creative fields all over the world. In this project, we would like to produce and publish a photo book dedicated to the story of Decora fashion with photography from the entire archive of FRUiTS.

Aoki recognizes the late 90s, when Decora style was born, as the Golden Era of Harajuku street cultures. In this book, we’d like to present a collection of fashion snaps that follow the timeline from Decora’s birth through to today to showcase how it was created and developed during the period.

Aoki says “I photograph [my subjects] with my deepest respect. The best thing I could do is to showcase the reality of them as they are, being a ’A piece of art’ in and of themselves.” he added, “My intention is to create an archive of the golden era of Harajuku subculture under the theme of Decora. I’d like my work to help to revive Harajuku street fashion, allowing it to be used as a reference to create a completely new Harajuku culture.”

“Before the memories fade, I feel it is my duty is to preserve them as a record. To visualize the history of Harajuku street fashion.”

DECORA.STORY

- Format A5

- 300 to 500 pages

- 300 to 500 images

- Estimated publication date / June 2016



DETAILS ON THE PERKS

SIGNED ACRYLIC PHOTO PRINT

Size: 21×30cm

Printing method : Fuji Frontier Print

Edition Number : none


One and Only Positive Film

Film Type : 645 film

High Quality Acrylic Frame




About FRUiTS

FRUiTS, founded by Shoichi Aoki, is a magazine documenting fashion kids who hang out on the streets of Harajuku, Tokyo. The magazine serves as an almost anthropological reference to the unique and imaginative styles of the Harajuku neighbourhood.

The first issue of FRUiTS was published in 1997 and was one of the first examples dedicated to the scene. It has since gained cult status around the world, making it somewhat of a status-symbol to be photographed by Aoki.

*The title of the book may subject to change.


A COMMENT FROM AOKI

Decora style is one of the symbols of Harajuku fashion.

Many people in Japan recent years are not aware of this culture, however, it is still widely attracted many foreigners because of its original and uniqueness that you’ve never seen outside of Japan.

To me the originality is the primary importance. We can’t find too many examples of one-of-a-kind fashion cultures in the world other than traditional costumes. I’d only come up with five of those. Two of those, in my mind, were born in Japan and then one of those is Decora style which was created by teenagers. It really is a miracle.

Before the memories fade, I have a thought that my duty is to preserve them as a record.

I have a image in my mind the book speaks about mainly Decora and diverse Harajuku styles of the same period, to reinterpret the history of Decora, using about 500 of images with explanatory notes along time series.
